The 2 park guards were allegedly captured and executed by their assailants, while another went missing. The events happened around Lake Edward.

NOTES: Local police and civilians fled the village of Busumba in Masisi territory after Mayi Mayi militia fighters moved into the area and took control.

NOTES: Women of Dungu territory protested against the abduction of children by LRA rebels. They say at least 1000 children were abducted last year, with about 400 of them later being released.

NOTES: A nurse was attacked by FRPI militiamen in the Walendu Bindi area.

Teachers in Dungu territory engaged in a 5-day strike against the non-payment of salaries for the month of February.

A dozen suspected Raia Mutomboki gunmen stole livestock and property from Ngamba in Kalehe.
Nyatura Mayi Mayi militiamen killed a local leader in Masisi as he was heading from Lushebere to sell livestock in Mutiri.

23 people were abducted by a Mayi Mayi militia led by Chuma Maliene Jado. They were released after a payment of a ransom.

NOTES: Kadar Abdi Ibrahim, publication co-director of the Aurore newspaper, was arrested by police in connection with the publication of a photograph of a seven-year-old girl who died during the violent dispersal of a religious ceremony by the police and the Djibouti army on 21 December 2015. He was reportedly tortured in detention. He was later condemned to a two-month suspended prison sentence, while the publication of this monthly newspaper was also suspended for two months.
Security forces defused a bomb on 28 December 2014 on Gamaa bridge in Egypt's Giza governorate. No injuries or deaths were reported.
Tags: Egypt Independent; Ahram Online Strategic development

NOTES: Workers at the Ministry of Religious Endowments staged a protest demanding more economic rights, including "health and social insurance". They have been calling on the ministry to grant them the right to be included on the ministry's insurance lists since 2011.

A German national and his son were arrested in September 2015 for allegedly harrassing and assaulting a worker. Inside Al Amreya police station, the man claimed he and his son were detained and assaulted.
Tags: Daily News Egypt Violence against civilians

NOTES: A journalist was arrested on 30 December 2015 and detained on charges of forming an illegal political movement called Youth of 25 January. He was allegedly tortured until he confessed to his crimes, according to Arab Network for Human Rights and Information (ANHRI). The location of his detention remained unknown for several days following his arrest.
Tags: Daily News Egypt Violence against civilians

NOTES: A Yanair Gate journalist was arrested in Mohandesen on 31 December and was taken to the Dokki police station. The National Security Apparatus detained the journalist for 72 hours without disclosing his location. His defence lawyer claimed he was tortured and severely beaten during interrogating.
Tags: Daily News Egypt Violence against civilians

NOTES: Cairo, Jan 2 (MENA) - Military spokesman Muhammad Samir said on Saturday [2 January] that a cache containing explosives and artillery had been detected and seized on Mount Um Hasirah near al-Qusaymah area in Central Sinai. Thirty-two sacks of highly-explosive TNT have been found inside the cache.

SOURCE: Aswat Masriya; Al-Masry Al-Youm; Xinhua General News Service
NOTES: The Egyptian military announced the killing of 29 Islamist elements in North Sinai on 3 January as part of the implementation of the "Matry's Right" operation in the towns of Arish, Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid.
Tags: Aswat Masriya; Al-Masry Al-Youm; Xinhua General News Service Battle-No change of territory

Tags: Aswat Masriya; Al-Masry Al-Youm; Daily News Egypt; Xinhua General News Service Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: An Egyptian solider and civilian were injured in a bomb attack in Al-Arish City, North Sinai when a roadside bomb detonated on 4 January.

Dozens stood in solidarity with Al-Azhar critic Islam El-Beheiry on one of his appeal trial sessions at the Zeinhom court on 4 January. Protesters denounced his trial as they carried signs describing Al-Azhar as the "prison of enlightened thought", while others said "Islam did not despise the Quran or Islam".
Tags: Daily News Egypt; Egypt Independent Riots/Protests

SOURCE: Aswat Masriya; Al-Masry Al-Youm; Daily News Egypt; Xinhua General News Service
NOTES: Security forces based in North Sinai killed a total of 32 militants and arrested four suspects in an exchange of fire in Arish, Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid. 32 fatalities recorded over 3 events [10 in Al-Arish; 10 in Rafah and 9 in Sheikh Zuweyid].

SOURCE: Aswat Masriya; Daily News Egypt; MENA news agency
NOTES: Unidentified assailants shot dead a police officer in the Upper Egypt province of Beni Suef as he was on his way home. A citizen was also injured in the incident as he was crossing the site of the shooting to get to his car. No militant group has declared responsibility for the attack yet.
Tags: Aswat Masriya; Daily News Egypt; MENA news agency Violence against civilians

NOTES: Dozens of reward preachers in the Ministry of Religious Endowments who work without permanent contracts and the attendant financial security protested on 5 January in front of the Press Syndicate, demanding to be permanently hired.
Egyptian army forces killed 11 Islamist militants and arrested two suspects in the context of the "Martyr's Right" military operation in northern and central areas in Sinai.
Tags: Aswat Masriya Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: At least 14 Islamist militants were killed and 13 others arrested by the Egyptian Armed Forces in the North Sinai province. Operations were conducted in North Sinai's Arish, Sheikh Zuweid and Rafah cities. The forces also managed to dismantle 16 explosive devices that have been planted on the roads to target security men. Fatalities divided between three events (5 fatalities recorded in Al Arish, 5 in Rafah and 4 in Sheikh Zuweyid).
Tags: Xinhua General News Service Battle-No change of territory

SOURCE: Agence France Presse; Associated Press International; Xinhua General News Service
NOTES: The Egyptian branch of the Islamic State group blew up a gas pipeline that supplies the northern Sinai city of Al-Arish city and a nearby industrial military complex. Explosives were used to target the pipeline in the Al-Midan area, about 15 km from the entrance of Arish city.
Tags: Agence France Presse; Associated Press International; Xinhua General News Service Remote violence

SOURCE: Agence France Presse; Associated Press International
NOTES: A gang of around 15 people hurled fireworks and fired birdshot at police guarding a hotel in Giza's Haram district on 7 January where Arab Israelis were staying without hurting anyone. Unknown assailants had gathered outside the hotel and carried out the attack, which it said targeted police guarding the hotel, who fired back. Associated Press International reported that an Egyptian Islamic State affiliate claimed responsibility for an attack on the hotel near the Giza Pyramids, and that after throwing Molotov cocktails, the attackers "started firing at the hotel with live bullets."
Tags: Agence France Presse; Associated Press International Battle-No change of territory

Fatalities divided between three events (5 fatalities recorded in Al Arish, 5 in Rafah and 4 in Sheikh Zuweyid).

NOTES: The police killed three militants in Sharqiya province north of the capital Cairo during fire exchange while arresting them for an attempted assassination of a university official. Investigations showed that the three militants were two college students and an electrician in their late 20s and 30s, who failed to gun down a university official in December .
Tags: Xinhua General News Service Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: In Hurghada, a student, reported to have participated in the attack on the Bella Vista Resort on Friday night was reported to have been a victim of enforced disappearance. He was killed by security forces after the attack. This is contrary to the state-sanctioned disclosure.
Tags: Daily News Egypt Violence against civilians

SOURCE: Agence France Presse; Associated Press Online
NOTES: Two Austrian and one Swedish tourist suffered knife wounds when unknown assailants attacked a hotel in Hurghada. A police official said security forces stopped the attack on the Bella Vista hotel in the Red Sea resort of Hurghada, with one assailant killed and another "seriously wounded". No one has so far claimed responsibility for the attack in Hurghada.
Tags: Agence France Presse; Associated Press Online Violence against civilians

NOTES: One of the assailants of a knife attack on a hotel in Hurghada was killed and the other seriously wounded, a police official said earlier, adding that security forces had "foiled" the attack.
Tags: Agence France Presse Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Chairman of the Egyptian Commission for Rights and Freedoms (ECRF) Ahmed Abdullah was allegedly the subject of an attempted act of "kidnapping" by security forces on Saturday. Three men in civilian clothes claiming to belong to the police forces raided the coffee shop often visited by Abdullah in the Agouza district but he was not present.

The Muslim Brotherhood accused the Egyptian security forces of "assassinating" a gynecologist in an extrajudicial killing as they were arresting him in Fayoum as he was leaving his private clinic on 9 January.
Tags: Daily News Egypt Violence against civilians

NOTES: Armed assailants shot a dead police colonel and a conscript in Egypt's Giza. The ISIS-affiliated group "Sinai Province" claimed responsibility for the attack later on Saturday in a statement posted on an affiliated twitter account.
Tags: Al-Ahram Gate; Aswat Masriya Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: On Jan. 9, the Monib Traffic Department Director and a conscript were killed after their vehicle was attacked by anonymous gunmen in Giza. The attack was claimed by the ISIS-affiliated group “Sinai Province”.
Tags: Aswat Masriya Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Armed assailants affiliated with the "Islamic State" (IS) attacked a compound owned by a cleaning company called Care Service in Al-Arish, North Sinai on 10 January. They set the compound on fire; however no injuries were reported among the company's workers. Eyewitnesses said the attackers evacuated all 125 employees from their dormitories before setting it ablaze, causing at least 40 vehicles owned by the authority to catch fire and a string of explosions in the area. One worker said he and other colleagues were not wounded, but revealed that the assailants, after checking the employees’ IDs, threatened them with death if they cooperate with security again.
Tags: Daily News Egypt; Egypt Independent Strategic development

NOTES: A man in Beni Sueif was killed after he was forcibly disappeared on 10 January without knowing the charges against him. However, the Ministry of Interior later announced that their forces killed him in an exchange of fire on a farm.
Tags: Daily News Egypt Violence against civilians

NOTES: Hundreds of participants gathered for the prayer and chanted denouncements of the government at the funeral of a doctor killed by policemen on 10 January in Fayoum.

There was an explosion on 12 January on Al-Ayatt railway track in the Giza Governorate. No causalities were reported in the blast. Two additional explosive devices were found on the railway track in front of Mansha Fadel in the town of Al-Ayatt. Explosives experts defused them.

The student union at Cairo University’s Faculty of Arts said on 13 January they were staging a protest to denounce the death of a colleague, who died following a heart attack, after an observer kicked her out of her exam.
Two security recruits and a civilian were wounded on 14 January as a blast targeted a security patrol at the coastal road in the area between Arish and Sheikh Zuweid cities.
Tags: Xinhua General News Service Remote violence

NOTES: A bomb disposal team defused an improvised explosive device planted near a school and a power transformer in Arish city.
Tags: Xinhua General News Service Strategic development

NOTES: North Sinai security forces killed 30 militants and injured 10 as militant elements attempted to attack a military ambush in south Sheikh Zuweid. The attack resulted in the death of four military personnel and the injury of eight others.
Tags: Aswat Masriya Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A primitive bomb exploded behind a closed traffic police unit on the Ring Road in Giza with no casualties reported.

A police officer, two conscripts and two civilians were injured on 19 January as a bomb went off near Al-Maydan checkpoint near North Sinai's capital city Arish. A roadside bomb went off as a military vehicle was passing by. The Islamic State-affiliated State of Sinai group claimed responsibility on Twitter.

SOURCE: Xinhua General News Service; Ahram; Agence France Presse; Egypt Independent
NOTES: Between five and seven Egyptian policemen were killed on 20 January in an armed attack in Egypt's North Sinai city of Arish. Militants attacked security forces at Atlawy Square in Arish, killing five policemen and injuring 10 others. The Islamic State group's Egyptian affiliate, the Sinai Province, claimed that attack.
Tags: Xinhua General News Service; Ahram; Agence France Presse; Egypt Independent Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A young Egyptian man, was found dead on 31 January after having been reported missing for two weeks. He was arrested on 20 January from his house located in the Fifth Settlement suburb in Greater Cairo. His family were not informed of where he would be detained. Friends suspect that Galal was shot immediately after he went missing, and that his body may have been at the morgue for the entire ten days.
Tags: Daily News Egypt; Aswat Masriya Violence against civilians

SOURCE: Agence France Presse; Aswat Masriya; Xinhua General News Service; Egypt Independent
NOTES: A bomb blast killed eleven people, including eight Egyptian policemen and three civilians, as a team of officers on 21 January raided an apartment in Al-Haram district suspected to be a militant hideout.The interior ministry blamed Thursday's incident on the blacklisted Islamist Muslim Brotherhood movement of ousted president Mohamed Morsi. However, Egypt Independent reported that both ISIS-affiliate group 'State of Sinai', and the 'Revolutionary Punishment' groups claimed responsibility for the attack.
Tags: Agence France Presse; Aswat Masriya; Xinhua General News Service; Egypt Independent Remote violence

NOTES: Two policemen were wounded by gunfire when unknown elements opened fire at them in a village in Al-Sharqiyah Governorate [east of Cairo]. The two policemen were targeted by motorcyclists at Al-Qaramus village of Abu-Kabir city.
Tags: MENA news agency Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Police forces broke up three marches by Muslim Brotherhood supporters in the Berket al-Sabe', Tala and Ashmun localities, Monufiya on Friday. Protesters raised banners against President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi and others that read " Where are bread and freedom?", referring to the January 25 revolution slogan "Bread, freedom and social justice".

Police forces broke up three marches by Muslim Brotherhood supporters in the Berket al-Sabe', Tala and Ashmun localities, Monufiya on Friday. Protesters raised banners against President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi and others that read " Where are bread and freedom?", referring to the January 25 revolution slogan "Bread, freedom and social justice".

A missile killed one child and injured three people, after it hit their home in the Rafah city of Northern Sinai on Friday. Unknown assailiants "fired a mortar shell at a security point in Rafah but it fell on the house by mistake.

Police forces broke up three marches by Muslim Brotherhood supporters in the Berket al-Sabe', Tala and Ashmun localities, Monufiya on Friday. Protesters raised banners against President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi and others that read " Where are bread and freedom?", referring to the January 25 revolution slogan "Bread, freedom and social justice".

An attack on a checkpoint in a village in Egypt's northern Sharqiya province left two policemen and a passerby dead on 24 January. The attack also left four people injured after unidentified assailants on two motorbikes shot at the checkpoint near the town of Fakous.
Tags: Agence France Presse; Aswat Masriya Battle-No change of territory

SOURCE: Aswat Masriya; MENA news agency; Daily News Egypt
NOTES: The Ministry of Interior said in a statement that it raided an apartment suspected to contain explosives in Kerdasa, and was caught in an "exchange of fire" with a member of the Muslim Brotherhood in the apartment, before shooting him.
Tags: Aswat Masriya; MENA news agency; Daily News Egypt Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Bomb disposal teams defused a high-explosive bomb that was planted by unidentified men under an armoured cash transport car in Wabur al-Miah district.

A protest was reported in 6 of October city, on the outskirts of Giza. Dozens demonstrated near Vodafone Square, denouncing the government and the police. They also raised posters of ousted Islamist president Mohamed Morsi. However, riot police dispersed the gathering within 30 minutes of its formation.
Tags: Aswat Masriya; Daily News Egypt Riots/Protests

SOURCE: Aswat Masriya; Associated Press International; MENA news agency
NOTES: In the October 6 suburb of Cairo, police killed two suspected militants in a raid. Explosives and firearms were found in the raided apartment. The suspects opened fire at the security forces upon their arrival before the forces started to shoot back.
Tags: Aswat Masriya; Associated Press International; MENA news agency Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A number of protests were reported in Sharqeya, Fayoum, Menufiya and other governorates. Most demonstrations saw protesters lining residential streets or marching through populated neighborhoods. Some  demonstrators set off fireworks before being dispersed by riot police.
Supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood movement tried to demonstrate in Cairo's Al-Haram district near the pyramids, but quickly dispersed fearing police retaliation.
Anti-riot police forces dispersed a Muslim Brotherhood protest near Mataryia Square, with protestors reporting that police used live ammunition.
Tags: Daily News Egypt; Egypt Independent Riots/Protests

SOURCE: Associated Press International; Daily News Egypt
NOTES: In Alexandria, police arrested 15 people when they dispersed small protests by Muslim Brotherhood loyalists. A total of four active demonstrations were reported in Alexandria, composed mostly of women. It was reported that the protesters carried antigovernment banners and posters depicting the the Rabaa Al-Adaweya sign.
Tags: Associated Press International; Daily News Egypt Riots/Protests

NOTES: An improvised explosive device (IED) was disarmed in Alexandria Monday morning after civilians reported a suspicious object in Al-Max Street.
Dozens of supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood blocked a main road in Bahtim, Qalyubiya on 25 January, burning car tires before fleeing away.

SOURCE: Associated Press International; MENA news agency
NOTES: A 32-year-old Egyptian government engineer disappeared in mid-January when, according to witnesses, masked police burst into his office in the southern city of Beni Suef and dragged him off in handcuffs in front of his co-workers. On Jan. 25, he turned up dead. Police provided a different story saying they shot and killed him when he tried to storm a checkpoint.
Tags: Associated Press International; MENA news agency Violence against civilians

NOTES: Minor protests reportedly erupted in Bani Suaif and other provinces.
In Kafr El-Shiekh, eyewitnesses said police forces fired tear gas at protesters, after an attempt to block the international road in the city using burned tires.

A number of protests were reported in Sharqeya, Fayoum, Menufiya and other governorates. Most demonstrations saw protesters lining residential streets or marching through populated neighborhoods. Some  demonstrators set off fireworks before being dispersed by riot police.
In Shubra, three protesters were arrested after setting off fireworks and blocking roads.

According to state news agency MENA, dozens of pro-government protesters marched through Tahrir Square and down Mohamed Mahmoud Street holding Egyptian flags and posters bearing the images of police victims, and chanting "The police and the people are one hand".  Security forces and military tanks were close-at-hand.

A number of protests were reported in Sharqeya, Fayoum, Menufiya and other governorates. Most demonstrations saw protesters lining residential streets or marching through populated neighborhood. Some demonstrators set off fireworks before being dispersed by riot police.
A prisoner in the city of Sharqeya died in detention at Abu Hamad police station on 26 January, two days after his arrest, amid claims by his family that he was tortured.
Tags: Daily News Egypt Violence against civilians

NOTES: Security forces detonated two bombs planted near a main road west of Arish, North Sinai on 26 January. Eyewitnesses said the forces shot at the IEDs from a distance. The operation left no casualties.

One restaurant worker was mildly wounded when an IED exploded outside a court in Monufiya on 26 January. an IED planted opposite a district court in the city of Minuf caused the collapse of a primary school wall and two balconies from a nearby building. Four parked vehicles were destroyed as well.

SOURCE: Agence France Presse; Associated Press International; Daily News Egypt
NOTES: A roadside bomb hit an armored personnel carrier south of Al-Arish in the Sinai Peninsula, killing an army colonel and four soldiers and wounding twelve others. IS affiliate the Sinai Province said its members used explosive devices to target the army west of El-Arish.
Tags: Agence France Presse; Associated Press International; Daily News Egypt Remote violence

NOTES: An air raid reportedly killed 20 militants and wounded 15 others on 27 January at their hideouts near Arish International Airport while a massive militant cell was moving from southern Arish northwards to carry out activities.
Tags: Xinhua General News Service Remote violence

NOTES: The army shot and killed Attallah Abu Reteima, whom the sources identified as the person in charge of logistics for the Sinai Province group. The exchange of fire took place in a mountainous area in central Sinai.
Tags: Egypt Independent Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Anti-government protesters in the village of Faqous, denounced the death of a prisoner in Abu Hamad police station, chanting against the police force.

SOURCE: Associated Press International; Xinhua General News Service; Aswat Masriya
NOTES: At least three policemen were killed and five others wounded on 28 January in a massive blast in a city in Egypt's North Sinai province.The blast was caused by an improvised device targeting a police armored vehicle on a main road in downtown Al-Arish. State of Sinai later claimed responsibility.
Tags: Associated Press International; Xinhua General News Service; Aswat Masriya Remote violence

NOTES: Police in Matariya hospital assaulted two doctors after they attempted to provide one of them with healthcare.

Fighting between army troops and militants in the northeastern part of the Sinai Peninsula killed four children and wounded eight other minors on 28 January. The Rafah hospital said in a statement that the children were killed and wounded during clashes using heavy weapons, with some buried under rubble when buildings were hit and collapsed. The fighting took place close to the border with the Palestinian Gaza Strip.
Tags: Associated Press International Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Dozens of Brotherhood loyalists took to the streets of Abu Hammad city of Sharqiya, 80 km north the Capital Cairo, to protest against the police. At least four people were injured by birdshots fired by Muslim Brotherhood protesters. Local shopkeepers were provoked and started confrontations, and the Brotherhood responded by firing birdshots.
Tags: Agence France Presse Violence against civilians

NOTES: A bomb blast killed two Egyptian police officers and wounded five others in an attack on their armoured vehicle in the Sinai Peninsula on 29 January. The vehicle was targeted near a school in the North Sinai provincial capital of El-Arish.

Human Rights Monitor reported an extra-judicial violence case in which police forces arrested a man on 30 January while he was visiting his relative in Al-Aqrab prison. The group reported that Ibrahim's family said their son did not return home after the visit.
Tags: Daily News Egypt Violence against civilians

NOTES: Unidentified assailants set ablaze the houses of two police officers in Arish using Molotov cocktails on 31 January. There were no casualties since both houses were empty.
A 17-year-old Coptic girl was kidnapped by two men riding a tuc-tuc on 31 January in the village of Hassan Basha in Samalout, Minya.
Two police conscripts were killed and two others injured after a roadside bomb exploded near an armoured police vehicle on 31 January in south Rafah in North Sinai.
An army officer and a soldier were killed in a remotely-detonated bomb attack in the Sheikh Zuweyid region of northern Sinai on 31 January. There was no immediate claim of responsibility.
Three soldiers were injured in an IED blast in west Arish, North Sinai, on 1 February. The IED was planted by the perpetrators near the international road of Arish-Qantara Sharq at kilometer 17.

A government security guard was killed on 1 February in a drive-by shooting that targeted a traffic checkpoint on the Ring Road in Giza. The attackers purportedly mistook it for a security checkpoint. The employee killed was a security guard. Two assailants drove a motorcycle into the checkpoint and opened fire, killing the employee and injuring another with 14 bullets.
Tags: Daily News Egypt Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Thousands of supporters of Egyptian popular Al-Ahly Sporting Club, aka Ultras Ahlawy, gathered at the club's stadium on 1 February to mark the fourth anniversary of the 2012 "Port Said Massacre" that left dozens dead. The Ultras (hard-core football fans), chanted slogans against the police, army and former army chief Field Marshal Muhammad Husayn Tantawi, saying: "The people want to execute the field marshal."

Eight militants were killed and two suspects were arrested in a joint crackdown by the armed forces and police in North Sinai on 2 February. The crackdown targeted areas in Arish, south Sheikh Zuweid and Rafah. 3 fatalities recorded in Rafah and 2 in Sheikh Zuweyid.
Tags: Egypt Independent Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A construction worker from Nahia, died on 7 February after sustaining injures when police forces attempted to arrest him on 2 February. He was injured by falling off the roof of his house during a police raid. His family suspects that the officers conducting the raid "threw him off the roof" and then sent him to the Boulaq Al-Dakrour hospital to avoid suspicion.
Tags: Daily News Egypt Violence against civilians

NOTES: Eight militants were killed and two suspects were arrested in a joint crackdown by the armed forces and police in North Sinai on 2 February. The crackdown targeted areas in Arish, south Sheikh Zuweid and Rafah. 3 fatalities recorded in Al-Arish and 2 in Sheikh Zuweyid.
Tags: Egypt Independent Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Eight militants were killed and two suspects were arrested in a joint crackdown by the armed forces and police in North Sinai on 2 February. The crackdown targeted areas in Arish, south Sheikh Zuweid and Rafah. 3 fatalities recorded in Al-Arish and 3 in Rafah.
Tags: Egypt Independent Battle-No change of territory

SOURCE: Aswat Masriya; Agence France Presse; Associated Press News Briefs
NOTES: A 28-year-old Italian Ph.D. student in Cambridge University, disappeared on Jan. 25. His deceased body was later found in a roadside ditch along a highway in the 6th of October suburb on Cairo's western outskirts with stab wounds, cigarette burns and torture marks.
Tags: Aswat Masriya; Agence France Presse; Associated Press News Briefs Violence against civilians

NOTES: Two members of the militant group Ajnad Misr (Soldiers of Egypt) were killed in a shootout with police forces in Cairo district of Hadiq al-Ma'adi on Wednesday [3 February]. Police raided the place, exchanged fire with the militants and seized large amount of weapons, ammunition and explosive materials.

NOTES: Pro-Qaddafi supporters protested at a seminar at the Cairo Book Fair addressed by Qaddafi's former foreign minister and ambassador to the UN at the time of the revolution. The protesters threw bottles of water at him and accussed him of bring a traitor.
Some 500 villagers from Hassan Basha demonstrated on Wednesday 3 February in front of Minya governorate building demanding the return of a 17-year-old teenager kidnapped.
19 were reportedly arrested on 4 and 5 February and were forcibly disappeared afterwards. They later reappeared in Al-Montazah Police station in Alexandria on 13 February.
Tags: Daily News Egypt Violence against civilians

NOTES: Taxi drivers organised a protest on 4 February near Mostafa Mahmoud mosque in Cairo, as they expressed their objections to private taxi services such as Uber and Careem, which have become popular among Egyptians recently.

Unidentified assailants used Molotov cocktails and fireworks to set fire to a police car on 4 February parked in a garage in Alexandria's Asafra neighborhood. Masked assailants on a motorcycle without number plates set fire to the car, affiliated with the police's traffic department.

Under a cover by the armed helicopters, army and police joint teams stormed a number of militant hotbeds in Al-Arish, Shaykh Zuwayid and Rafah in North Sinai, killing a total of 10 Islamist militants. 3 fatalities recorded in Rafah and 4 in Sheikh Zuweyid.

Tags: MENA news agency Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Egyptian security forces arrested 10 young men from hard-core football fans, Ultras, following a protest they staged outside Al-Ahly club. The fans demonstrated to attend the training warmups of their team, but were not allowed inside. Police forces closed all roads leading to the club with metal barricades.

Three anonymous gunmen attacked Banha Teaching Hospital's gynaecology department on 6 February. One of the armed men purportedly claimed to be a police officer. Two of the doctors sustained concussions due to the attack, and the hospital was subsequently closed.
Tags: Daily News Egypt Violence against civilians

NOTES: People demonstrated in front of Italian embassy in Cairo over the killed Italian student.
Four alleged militants affiliated with militant group Ajnad Misr were killed on 7 February during an exchange of fire with Egyptian police in a hideout in Al-Kurayimat village in Atfih township.
Tags: Aswat Masriya; MENA news agency Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Members of Ultras White Knights gathered in the Fostat park in Cairo on 8 Feburary and held a rally to commemorate the deaths of 22 people killed in clashes last year between the police and fans of the Zamalek football club. The fans set off firecrackers and waved banners as large numbers of security forces were deployed outside the park.
Tags: Aswat Masriya; Associated Press International Riots/Protests

NOTES: Two soldiers were injured on 9 February in an IED blast in southwest Sheikh Zuweid City, North Sinai. Unidentified assailants planted an IED in Karam al-Qawadis area, in southwest Sheikh Zuweid City. The bomb exploded as an armored vehicle passed near it while security forces were carrying out a crackdown in the area.

Three young men re-appeared in an Alexandria police station after police arrested them from their homes in an enforced disappearance. The men displayed signs of torture and their health had severely deteriorated. The exact date was not specified.
Tags: Daily News Egypt Violence against civilians

NOTES: Three army conscripts were injured in an IED blast in Sheikh Zuweyid on 10 February. Unidentified assailants planted an IED in south Sheikh Zuweid City in North Sinai, targeting the security forces.
A bomb exploded on 11 February on the coastal road of North Sinai. Unidentified assailants planted a bomb in the Rawda area in Bi'r al-Abd locality on the Arish-Qantara Sharq Road.
On the North West coast in Masa Matrouh, a sit in was held by angry lawyers at the poor treatment by the police.

"Sinai Province" said that on 11 February it targeted a military camp and Al-Arish International Airport using BM21-Grad missiles, claiming they had executed this operation while both the interior minister and the defence minister were visiting the area.
According to Al-Watan, an Apache helicopter killed 45 Ansar Beit al-Maqdis (State of Sinai) militants and injured dozens. Location not specified.
Thousands of Egyptian doctors staged a protest Friday outside their union headquarters in Cairo over a lack of legal action against policemen who allegedly beat up two of their colleagues.
One police conscript was shot dead by unknown assailants while he was on duty at a checkpoint in southern Al-Arish.
Tags: Daily News Egypt Battle-No change of territory

SOURCE: Agence France Presse; Aswat Masriya; Daily News Egypt
NOTES: Two Egyptian soldiers, one an officer, were killed by an explosion as they tried to defuse a roadside bomb in in the area of Karm al-Qawadis, in Sheikh Zuweyid. The militant group Sinai Province also claimed the killing of seven security personnel during an incident inside the city of Al-Arish, however these claims could not be confirmed.
Tags: Agence France Presse; Aswat Masriya; Daily News Egypt Remote violence

NOTES: One prisoner was killed and 17 others injured in an attempted prison break from the Hawamdya Giza police station on 13 February. Police forces tried to stop them by firing tear gas to prevent them from escaping. In the process, 17 people experienced suffocation and a prisoner died in hospital after sustaining "bruises" and "fatigue". The usage of tear gas was seen as evidence of using excessive violence against inmates.
Tags: Aswat Masriya; Daily News Egypt Riots/Protests

NOTES: An officer and a conscript were killed, another conscript was injured while dismantling explosive device in Arish.

Families of Al-Aqrab prison inmates were attacked in front of the visiting hall on 14 February while they were waiting to visit their detained relatives. The incident started "when a security officer assaulted a girl. The families then protested, which resulted in the officers banning most of their visits. The families then tried to enter, only to be beaten and assaulted by the officers and soldiers".
Tags: Daily News Egypt Violence against civilians

NOTES: The Egyptian army continued its operations on 15 February against militants in the area of Al-Arish in North Sinai. Tribal sources told Daily News Egypt that a reported five militants were killed as the army raided a den allegedly used by members of the militant group Sinai Province. The sources said the army used helicopters to execute the attack.

Lawyers claimed that their colleague was attacked by a policeman in Basyoun in Gharbiya, sustaining cuts and bruises to his face. The altercation occurred when the policeman ordered the lawyer’s relatives to park their tuk tuk away from the court’s security deployment.
Dozens of lawyers protested outside the courtrooms complex in Basyoun, Gharbiya, on 16 February, condemning an alleged assault by a policeman on one of their colleagues.

Four people were killed and three injured when clashes broke out between residents of the Bulaq Abul Ela area in downtown Cairo on 16 February. The incident began as an argument between two people over the guarding of a kiosk that belongs to the district.

Gunmen on a motorcycle opened fire on a checkpoint in Egypt on 16 February, killing a policeman and seriously wounding two others. The attack took place in an area called El-Badrasheen in southern Cairo. There were no immediate details about the assailants. An ISIS-affiliated group in Egypt claimed responsibility for the attack.
Tags: Agence France Presse; Aswat Masriya Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Temporary workers in municipalities in Aswan went on strike.

A civilian received a fatal bullet from a policeman who was trying to break up a melee that erupted near the Cairo police headquarters, a security official told MENA. The policeman used his gun and opened fire in the air to break up the brawl, but a civilian sustained a fatal injury.
Tags: MENA news agency Violence against civilians

NOTES: Dozens of students and professors participated in a demonstration to show solidarity with late Italian student Giulio Regeni at the American University in Cairo (AUC) on 17 February.

A police officer dressed in civilian clothes shot and killed a 24-year-old taxi driver in el-Darb el-Ahmar district of Cairo. "The policeman pulled out his gun to end the fight but a bullet came out by mistake, killing the taxi driver," the Interior Ministry's statement added.

The Egyptian branch of the Islamic State group posted pictures online of what it says was the execution of two men caught spying for the army in the Sinai. The images were deemed authentic by US monitor SITE Intelligence Group.
Tags: Agence France Presse Violence against civilians

SOURCE: Agence France Presse; Deutsche Welle (Bonn); Associated Press International
NOTES: Hundreds of protesters gathered outside of Cairo's security directorate on 18 February after a police officer dressed in civilian clothes shot and killed a 24-year-old taxi driver. Disgruntled Egyptians beat up a policeman, blocked roads, and surrounded the local security headquarters after the officer killed a driver in a dispute.
Tags: Agence France Presse; Deutsche Welle (Bonn); Associated Press International Riots/Protests

NOTES: On 18 February, tens of family members gathered in front of the Press Syndicate to protest the treatment of the prisoners in Al-Aqrab prison, demanding that the ministry allow winter clothing and visits.

Hundreds of mourners turned out for the funeral of a taxi driver killed by a policeman on 19 February in Cairo. The protesters chanted against the police apparatus, and stood for a while in front of the Cairo Security Directorate.
A militant attack that targeted the main electricity line in Al-Shaykh Zuwayd and Rafah left both North Sinai cities, and nearby towns and villages, in a complete blackout.
A police officer killed his neighbour on 20 February after a dispute escalated in Al-Khosoos.
Tags: Daily News Egypt Violence against civilians

NOTES: State security forces carried out raids in Al-Arish, Sheikh Zuweid, and Rafah regions. They disrupted internet and phone services for 12 hours but there were no reports of clashes.
Approximately 10-15 doctors protested in several hospitals, including Al-Matariya Teaching Hospital, condemning the violations and assaults against doctors on their jobs.
Outraged residents of Al-darb Al-Ahmar protested against police violence.

Dozens of family members gathered in front of the Press Syndicate in Cairo on 20 February to protest the treatment of their detained relatives, as well as demanding "fair trials" and "an end to the death sentence".
Doctors staged silent protests in front of Damietta General hospital in Egypt on 20 February 2016.
Two Egyptian policemen were killed in a bomb explosion which targeted two vehicles in North Sinai. Specific location not detailed - coded to Al Arish.

Dozens of Niqab-wearing women from the Faculty of Medicine and Qasr Al-Aini hospitals staged a protest on 21 February outside the Qasr Al-Aini conference hall against Cairo University President Gaber Nassar's decision to ban nurses and doctors from wearing the full-face veil in Qasr Al-Aini Medical School (QAMS) and its affiliated teaching hospitals.

SOURCE: Daily News Egypt; MENA news agency
NOTES: A student was killed and seven other civilians were injured when a bomb went off near Al-Arish, North Sinai, on Sunday [21 February]. State of Sinai claimed responsibility, saying it was targeting a police patrol in B'ir Al Abd.
Tags: Daily News Egypt; MENA news agency Remote violence

NOTES: Masked security agents wearing civilian clothes and police uniforms raided a the home of a journalist in Damietta at dawn on 21 February, arrested the journalist, seized his laptop and his mobile phone, and took him away in a police vehcile. Four days after his arrest, he reported that he had been subject to torture by electric shock on four separate occasions and that security officers had pressured him to confess to crimes he did not commit.
Tags: Daily News Egypt Violence against civilians

NOTES: Many low-ranking police officers in the Sharqeya governorate organised a protest on 21 February in front of the security directorate in Zagazig in solidarity with officers who were arrested after it was believed they were going to incite people against the Ministry of Interior. Protesters demanded their immediate release.

A group of Nubian citizens and activists protested on 22 February at Aswan's Abu Simbel Temple. The protest condemned a presidential decree, referred to as 'Decree 444', which designated a large stretch of land in Nubia as a new restricted military zone, adjacent to Egypt's border with Sudan.
Tags: Ahram Online; Daily News Egypt Riots/Protests

SOURCE: Daily News Egypt; MENA news agency
NOTES: MP Mahmoud Khamis, an independent MP, assaulted a journalist in an attempt to prevent the media from interviewing MP Tawfik Okasha, after he was dismissed from parliament.
Tags: Daily News Egypt; MENA news agency Violence against civilians

NOTES: One person was killed and three others were severely injured after a missile fell on Rafah.
Bomb squads in Giza dismantled two IEDs on al-Haram Street on 26 February, after the Civil Protection Agency received a tip from residents about two strange objects in front of a shop.

SOURCE: Associated Press International; MENA news agency
NOTES: Security forces clashed with Islamist Muslim Brotherhood protesters in northern Egypt in a firefight, killing two of them and arresting six. The ministry said that the killed men were part of a group trying to stage a demonstration and carry out attacks against security forces in the northern city of Damietta. The Freedom and Justice Party, said in a statement that the men were killed protesting the military overthrow and price hikes. Two security men were injured.
Tags: Associated Press International; MENA news agency Riots/Protests

NOTES: A Muslim Brotherhood grouped planted a bomb exploding the main gas pipeline in Damietta governorate.
A police officer of the Badrasheen police station was killed on 26 February in a drive-by shooting in Giza by three unknown assailants.
Tags: Daily News Egypt Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A number of imprisoned journalists in Al-Aqrab (Tora) prison went on hunger strike to protest mistreatment and poor living conditions.
Tags: Ahram Online; Associated Press Online Riots/Protests

NOTES: A group of lawyers in Sharqeya claimed that a police conscript "kidnapped" their colleague in a case of enforced disappearance. The Ministry of Interior denied the claims.
Tags: Daily News Egypt Violence against civilians

NOTES: A police captain was shot dead by masked gunmen outside his residence in Arish, North Sinai, on 27 February. State of Sinai claimed responsibility.
Tags: Egypt Independent; Agence France Presse Violence against civilians

NOTES: Security forces on Saturday [27 February] arrested a suspected man and destroyed a number of militant hotbeds in North Sinai. The crackdown targeted the areas of Al-Arish, southern Shaykh Zuwayid and Rafah. The forces also defused two explosive devices with no casualties reported.
Two conscripts were killed and two others injured in a roadside bomb explosion in Rafah in North Sinai.

SOURCE: Agence France Presse; Daily News Egypt
NOTES: An Egyptian man was beheaded and his teenage son shot dead in the Al-Arish in North Sinai on 29 February. No militant group has yet claimed responsibility for the attack. Activists claimed that the two men were assassinated by members of "Sinai Province", but this has not been confirmed.
Tags: Agence France Presse; Daily News Egypt Violence against civilians

NOTES: A prominent journalist and head of the Freedoms Committee at the Press Syndicat and a committee member held a sit-in on 29 February in an open strike at the syndicate to protest the poor conditions in prisons for detained journalists.
Passengers on a ferry that hit a fishing boat in Tahta, Sohag, Upper Egypt assaulted the captain, who was then taken to hospital.

Under the title "I'm Human", some of Al-Aqrab (Tora) Prison detainees began a sit-in on 29 February inside the prison to protest the violations committed by the prison administration against the prisoners and their families

The prime suspect in shooting of Head of the Shubra al-Khaymah Criminal Investigation Department Mustafa Lutfi was killed in a shootout with police in a district in Al-Qalyubiyah governorate on 16 March.
Tags: MENA news agency Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: In Sinai on 2 March, a roadside bomb killed a conscript and wounded three soldiers when it struck a convoy of Humvees during a manhunt for a prominent militant leader. The attack was in the Khariza area near the town of Qasima. State of Sinai circulated reports which claimed the attack.
Tags: Egypt Independent; Daily News Egypt Remote violence

NOTES: Hundreds of Egyptian journalists organised a protest on 2 March in front of the Press Syndicate to demand the release of fellow detained journalists and protest the state's tacit acceptance of their deteriorating health.

Three soldiers were killed on 2 March during an attack on an army patrol near Sinai's Sheikh Zuweid. An IED ambush caught the patrol near Al-Wahshi checkpoint. At least one soldier was injured. The Sinai Province, the affiliate of the "Islamic State" (IS) in Egypt, claimed the attack.

The administrator of a page on Facebook calling for a "religious revolution" was arrested on 3 March, after protesting at the headquarters of Al-Azhar. He called for the protest stating that Sahih Al-Bukhary's Islamic teachings promote extremism and support ideologies of the 'Islamic State' group. He burnt the book of Al-Bukhary's teachings and the police forces arrested him.

The head of Shubra el Khayma criminal investigation department was killed during a security campaign to arrest a Khanka massacre suspect. The campaign took place in Ja'fra area in the Al-Qalubiyah central region of Shibin al-Qanatir.
Tags: MENA news agency Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Military operations were carried out by police forces and Egyptian armed forces in Sinai on 4 March. Security authorities indicated that 4 "Sinai Province" militants were killed and 6 injured in the Karam El-Qawdis region situated of Sheikh Zuweid.
Tags: Daily News Egypt Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A car bomb exploded on 4 March night in front of a building in the Mohandessin neighbourhood of Giza, leaving no casualties. The source said an explosion sound was heard on Gaza Street - where the Omani cultural mission headquarters lies.
A police officer was reportedly killed on 4 March after being injured in clashes with militants in the city of Rafah.
Tags: Daily News Egypt Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Five bullet-riddled bodies were found in a mass grave some hundreds of metres away from a well-known army base in Sheikh Zuweyid. State-controlled Cairo press simply said five unidentified bodies found killed. But local journalists reported that "a hummer disposed of the bodies in plain sight, and among the murdered were a child and a deaf and mute victim".
Tags: Daily News Egypt Violence against civilians

NOTES: On 6 March, after a blast wounded two Egyptian security personnel, gunmen shot dead two members of Egypt's security forces in an ambulance after they had been injured by a bombing in the Sinai Peninsula. A medic in the ambulance was also killed in the ambush in the town of Sheikh Zuweyid. No militant group has yet claimed responsibility for either the bomb attack or the subsequent ambush.
Tags: Agence France Presse Violence against civilians

SOURCE: Daily News Egypt; MENA news agency
NOTES: Second Field Army troops prepared a checkpoint in Al-Sabkha district in Al-Shaykh Zuwayid, northern Sinai when militants opened fire. The troops repelled the attack killing five elements.
Tags: Daily News Egypt; MENA news agency Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A blast targeted the armoured vehicle of Egypt's security forces in the town of Sheikh Zuweyid in North Sinai. Two security personnel were wounded.

SOURCE: Agence France Presse; Daily News Egypt
NOTES: A roadside bombing in Egypt's Sinai Peninsula killed two policemen on 7 March. The bomb exploded close to an armoured vehicle on a highway near El-Arish. "Sinai Province" claimed responsibility for the IED explosion. Other sources reported five killed - 2 fatalities recorded.
Tags: Agence France Presse; Daily News Egypt Remote violence

NOTES: A lawyer was allegedly arrested and 'kidnapped' on 7 March by police forces from his house in Gharbeya. His family said his whereabouts is still unknown and they do not know of what he is accused.
Tags: Daily News Egypt Violence against civilians

NOTES: A total of 3 soldiers were reported killed in North Sinai on 8 March in two explosions in Egypt's North Sinai governorate. The exact location was not specified. 2 fatalities recorded (1 other fatality recorded in Al Mahdiyah).

A soldier in the Egyptian armed forces was killed when an improvised explosive device (IED) detonated near an armoured police vehicle that was on patrol in the El-Mahdia region in Rafah in the North Sinai governorate. The planted IED was activated remotely by a member of the "Sinai Province" militant group.
Tags: Al-Jazeera TV; Daily News Egypt Remote violence

NOTES: Female relatives of women prisoners chanted at an event called 'Release Our Girls' during International Women's Day in front of the Press Syndicate in Cairo, Egypt on 8 March.

SOURCE: Associated Press International; MENA news agency
NOTES: Egyptian security forces fired tear gas on 8 March to disperse taxi drivers who had blocked a major road in the capital, Cairo, to protest Uber and other car-hailing applications, which the head of the Cairo traffic police insists are illegal. The drivers blocked Mustafa Mahmud Square, in Mohandiseen district, causing traffic congestion.
Tags: Associated Press International; MENA news agency Riots/Protests

NOTES: A civilian was shot dead by police forces in Haram district in Giza, after he was chased by security members. The Shehab Centre for Human Rights said it was an act of extra-judicial killing. It held the Ministry of Interior responsible for the killing, calling upon the prosecution to investigate the case.
Tags: Daily News Egypt Violence against civilians

NOTES: A group of lawyers protested outside the Lawyers Syndicate, demanding security officials reveal the whereabouts of a detained lawyer. The syndicate's Freedoms Committee refused to participate in the protest.
Three civilians were injured when an explosive device, which was placed in a street in the Feisal neighborhood, was detonated on 9 March while a police convoy was passing through.
Two Egyptian soldiers were killed when an explosive device went off at a gas station south of Al-Shaykh Zuwayid, in northern Sinai on 9 March.

Alexandria witnessed a strike by public transportation drivers, who called for the suspension of "unnecessary taxes which cut from the bonuses of the drivers". However, the strike ended after the army deployed military buses to transport passengers.
Hundreds demonstrated on 9 March in front of the Press Syndicate to demand the release of their fellow journalists and improvement of the poor conditions inside prisons.

Hundreds of sanitation workers employed by the Nahdat Misr Company in Alexandria started a strike on 10 March. The striking workers allege that they have not received their salaries for the month of February and have only received half of their due pay for January. The workers protested inside the headquarters of the company demanding the payment of late salaries, accusing the management of "avoiding" the workers and of "blaming the monetary problems on the governorate". The strike ended on 14 March.

State-security forces killed 12 militants on 11 March during airstrikes against "Islamic State"-affiliated groups in North Sinai. Apache helicopters were used to target several facilities of IS-affiliated militants; aiming to eliminate ammunition stores and vehicles, according to testimonies from residents on social media. in the same campaign, a police officer was reportedly killed on by an IED during a patrol in Sheikh Zuweid city in North Sinai.

Since 10 March, sanitation workers at Nahdat Misr Company protested inside company headquarters, demanding the payment of overdue wages and accusing management of avoiding workers and of "blaming the monetary problems on the governorate".

Dozens of doctors gathered in front of the Doctors' Syndicate headquarters in downtown Cairo on 12 March to protest against repeated assaults, most of which have recently been carried out by police officers inside hospitals.

Since 10 March, sanitation workers at Nahdat Misr Company protested inside company headquarters, demanding the payment of overdue wages and accusing management of avoiding workers and of "blaming the monetary problems on the governorate".
Reports circulated on social media claimed that three citizens were injured by an IED that exploded as a car passed over it on a road south of Rafah city.

Security forces stated that an IED was detonated near a military convoy south of Sheikh Zuweid city, located in North Sinai. No injuries were reported and state security forces set up a checkpoint in an attempt to arrest those responsible for the incident. The State of Sinai claimed responsibility.

Since 10 March, sanitation workers at Nahdat Misr Company protested inside company headquarters, demanding the payment of overdue wages and accusing management of avoiding workers and of "blaming the monetary problems on the governorate".
Social media reports said that police forces in Al-Arish were able to dismantle a bomb planted near Al-Nasr Mosque, after receiving a notification that it was found beside a parked car.
An Egyptian police officer was shot dead by masked individuals in North Sinai on 14 March near al-Arish police station.
Tags: Aswat Masriya Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: State of Sinai militant group published photos allegedly showing the official uniforms, laptops and explosive detection devices of the Egyptian armed forces. The photos were provided as documentation of a raid on an armed forces' checkpoint in Central Sinai on 14 March. Exact location not specified.
Tags: Daily News Egypt Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Since 10 March, sanitation workers at Nahdat Misr Company protested inside company headquarters, demanding the payment of overdue wages and accusing management of avoiding workers and of "blaming the monetary problems on the governorate".

A police officer was killed and four CSF recruits were injured on 16 March in an IED blast in Sheikh Zuweyid city, North Sinai. Unidentified assailants planted an IED in the path of a security force vehicle in the area of Mahdeya, south Sheikh Zuweyid.

Egyptian military forces in Northern Sinai's Rafah killed three "militants" during an "exchange of fire" on 17 March. Whilst raiding and combing militant hideouts they spotted three Islamist militants who had been trying to plant an explosive device in Rafah.
Tags: Aswat Masriya; Al-Jazeera TV Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: In Rafah, militants struck a weapons depot, killing at least five soldiers and injuring 10 others. Officials said that the attacks took place when suspected militants launched mortar shells at an army camp in Rafah.
Tags: Associated Press International; Channel 1 TV Remote violence

NOTES: An explosive device killed an army soldier in the town of Sheikh Zuweyid. The Egypt Independent reported that the security member was a police conscript.
Tags: Associated Press International; Egypt Independent Remote violence

NOTES: A mortar attack on an Al-Arish checkpoint in Egypt's Sinai Peninsula killed 15 policemen on 19 March. The Islamic State group (IS) claimed responsibility for the attack, but said in a statement that it had deployed a suicide bomber who blew up a car at the checkpoint, which the militants then raided. Security officials said five attackers were killed in clashes near the checkpoint after the attack.
Tags: Agence France Presse Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: The Doctors Syndicate continued their protest in front of public hospitals on 19 March, demanding that the accused police officers be referred to trial.

Egyptian security forces killed 10 members of the Sinai Province militant group in the North Sinai town of Sheikh Zuweyid. The deaths occurred during a raid by security forces on a militant camp in the south of the town, following a tip-off that a large number of Sinai Province militants — who are affiliated to the Islamic State group — were gathering ahead of a planned operation.
Tags: Egypt Independent Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Dozens of government employees gathered in front of the Press Syndicate on 20 March in objection to an attempt to repass the civil service bill, amid tight security. Demonstrators called on the cabinet to resign. Instead of the controversial civil service bill, they called for the preparation of a uniform law for all state employees without exception to be put forward for public discussion.
Tags: Daily News Egypt; Atlantic Council Riots/Protests

NOTES: Hundreds of small-scale importers demonstrated on 22 March in front of the Egyptian International Trade Point (EITP) at the Finance Ministry building in protest against decisions No. 991, 992, and 43, taken by Minister of Industry and Foreign Trade Tarek Qabil, which restrict imports.
Mothers of forcefully disappeared individuals staged a demonstration on 23 March. Location not specified.

The Egyptian army killed 60 militants and injured 40 more in North Sinai on 25 March south of Rafah and Sheikh Zuweyid in North Sinai. The toll could not be independently verified. 30 fatalities reported in Sheikh Zuweyid.
Tags: Aswat Masriya; Agence France Presse Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: The Egyptian army killed 60 militants and injured 40 more in North Sinai on 25 March south of Rafah and Sheikh Zuweyid in North Sinai. The toll could not be independently verified. 30 fatalities reported in Rafah.

NOTES: Four police personnel were reportedly injured on 26 March by an improvised explosive device' (IED) that detonated ahead of their armoured tank in the city of Al-Arish.
Bomb experts in Al-Arish succeeded in dismantling an explosive device on 26 March, which was found on the road near Palm Plaza.

"Sinai Province" claims it killed a total of 15 state-security soldiers by planting explosive devices on roads situated in Sheikh Zuweid and Rafah. Aamaq, a news agency affiliated with Islamic State claimed that "Sinai Province" militants intercepted a counter-attack by the Egyptian Armed Forces and captured two tanks. 8 fatalities recorded in Sheikh Zuweid, 7 fatalities recorded in Rafah.

"Sinai Province" claims it killed a total of 15 state-security soldiers by planting explosive devices on roads situated in Sheikh Zuweid and Rafah. Aamaq, a news agency affiliated with Islamic State claimed that "Sinai Province" militants intercepted a counter-attack by the Egyptian Armed Forces and captured two tanks. 8 fatalities recorded in Sheikh Zuweid, 7 fatalities recorded in Rafah.

On 28 March, a pregnant Bedouin woman was alleged to have been subjected to shooting from army forces inside the El-Tarabin district in Sheikk Zuwaid. The shooting resulted in injuring her with two bullets in her arm and belly, killing the foetus, according eyewitnesses' testimonies to the EORF.

NOTES: A suspected militant was killed on 30 March in a shootout in Giza's Warraq neighbourhood after an exchange of fire with a police force.
Tags: Daily News Egypt Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Three suspected militants were killed in army raid following an exchange of fire near Sinai's Sheikh Zuweid on 30 March. A force of the second field army was setting up a checkpoint when it became suspicious of three men riding motorcycles without plates. According to an army statement, the suspects opened fire on the personnel when the force tried to stop them for inspection, which led to the killing of the three suspects.
Tags: Daily News Egypt Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A police conscript and a citizen were reportedly killed on 1 April and another soldier was wounded when an explosive detonated targeting a police patrol crossing the coastal road in Al-Arish, North Sinai governorate.

The Egyptian army killed 65 militants in North Sinai, it was reported on 1 April. This came as the army, in cooperation with police, targeted a number of arms caches in Rafah and Sheikh Zuweid. 33 fatalities recorded in Sheikh Zuweyid and 32 fatalities recorded in Rafah.

Chuka University students violently protest disputed school elections by looting shops and lighting fires. Police made 15 arrests and offices temporarily closed the university.
