NOTES: Transporters block traffic to demand better road conditions. Security forces tried to disperse them but were "overwhelmed".
Rioters injured a policeman while recovering bags of fertilizer meant for farms. Police used tear gas to disperse crowds.
Vigilante militia kill a women accused of robbery in Mulange.
Rioters destroyed church property and set fire to vehicles after hearing a rumour that a pastor had turned into a snake. Police fired tear gas.
Kasungu residents riot and block roads protesting against sale of maize.
Mtakataka residents riot and block roads protesting against sale of maize.
Mob killed 4 in Chimbalanga who they suspected of using witchcraft to kill a young woman - the woman was killed by lightning strike.
Kasungu residents riot and block roads for second day protesting against sale of maize.
Mtakataka residents riot and block roads for second day protesting against sale of maize.
Vendors protest in Dzenza over placement of stalls.
Mob rioted and burnt a courthouse in Machinjiri. 2 policemen injured.
Rioter stoned and destroyed billboard showing President Mutharika's face. Police later arrested him.
Vigilante militia lynch to death 4 people in Mwanza who were found in possession of bones belonging to albinos.
Angry mob killed a man caught stealing tobacco in Chamkoma.
Protesters in Mzuzu address the government about food shortage and economic crisis.
MCP members protest demand release of a legal advisor accused of coup plotting. Police fired tear gas.
Vigilante militia burn to death 7 suspected of witchcraft because they were found with bones.
Tags: Nyasa Times; Agence France Presse Violence against civilians

NOTES: At least two armed Islamists of AQMI were killed in a military operation conducted by French forces in Timbuktu area. One of the Islamists killed was Abou al-Nour al-Andalusi, leader of AQMI's battallion 'Al-Furqan'.

According to the French radio, six peacekeepers sustained injuries, two seriously. It would be recalled a similar incident happened in the same area in the afternoon of 29 February without any material destruction.
Tags: Agence France Presse; Radio France Internationale Remote violence

NOTES: Seven gunmen riding motorbikes attacked a military camp in Misseni. It was later discovered that the attackers were policemen active in the racket business. They were riding motorbikes in civilian clothes when soldiers started to shoot at them near Misseni camp, mistaking them for militants. No injuries reported.

NOTES: Families of Salafi prisoners protested outside the jail.

NOTES: Members of the Initiative for the Resurgence of the Abolitionist Movement, IRA-Mauritania have "besieged" anti-riot police mini buses in capital Nouakchott. the activists of IRA - an anti-slavery group - shown in the photo standing in front of a "police" mini-bus were stopping it and "chanting hostile slogans against the regime of President Mohamed Ould Abdelaziz", while the mini-buses lined up behind were waiting to be allowed by IRA activists to continue driving. Police arrested a journalist covering the demonstration.
Three migrants drowned and about 20 were hospitalized when hundreds tried to cross into Ceuta. Some injuries may have been caused by security forces as 250 were arrested.

A door-to-door salesman set himself on fire Thursday in a public prosecutor's office in southern Morocco in protest at the judiciary's inaction on a complaint he filed. Suffering second degree burns, the unnamed man was taken to hospital under police escort.

A suspected Boko Haram child suicide bomber detonated his explosive in a grain market in Gombi on 29/01, killing at least 10 people.

NOTES: Protesters demonstrate in Ogulagha community (also known as Gulani) demanding the restoration of the scrapped Nigerian Maritime University (NMU) at Okerenkoko, Warri South West Local Government Area.
Fulanis attack another group of Fulanis land in Kuje. One death reported.
Unidentified gunmen abduct traditional ruler in Isoko South Local Government Area.

At least five members of the Civilian Joint Task Force were killed while four others sustained critical injuries when a Toyota Hilux patrol vehicle rammed into landmines/ Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs) in Buma, Kaga LGA suspected to have been planted by members of Boko Haram.

Boko Haram attacks Dalori village on 30/01 killing many. Many of the dead were children who had been burnt alive. The attack occurred during the evening hours. The death toll was raised to 101 over the course of the week (The Guardian).
Nigerian forces clash with suspected members of Boko Haram in Maiduguri on 30/01. No reported casualties.
Tags: Nigerian Tribune Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A bloody conflict between suspected Fulani herdsmen and Agatu farmers at Ega Adapti Island in Agstu Local Government Area of Benue State claimed 10 lives.
Tags: This Day (Lagos) Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Members of the APC protest outside their state secretariat in Benin City following the removal of a local councillor.
A vigilante mob attacks and kills a cobbler after they suspect him of a recent stabbing.

Military forces kill 100 members of Boko Haram and rescue 1,200 of their captives following a gun battle in Boboshe village, Dikwa LGA on 01/02. The prisoners were being held at the nearby towns of Garindawaji and Mamawarhi. Later accounts vary - This Day reports the death of 56 and the liberation of 520, other sources vary.

Five houses destroyed after a large bomb blast in Benin City. Police arrested several suspects. Following the incident it was reported the many residents were panicked, fearing Boko Haram to be responsible, though authorities have not substantiated this. Some residents are hospitalised by the blast.
Six people were reportedly killed while one person sustained gunshot injury when suspected members of Boko Haram sect invaded Goniambari village in Kaga Local Government Area of Borno state.

Scores of former employees of the Ibadan Electricity Distribution Company (IBEDC) staged a peaceful protest along major streets of Ibadan against alleged wrongful disengagement of more than 1000 of them.
Nigerian forces intercept a pair of Boko Haram suicide bombers attempting to enter Maiduguri. The two detonated their packs from a distance, killing only themselves.
Tags: This Day (Lagos) Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Local fishermen protest the use of large fishing trawlers.
About 150 retirees in Cross River State protest at the office of the governor over the non-payment of five months gratuity.
Members of the Islamic movement in Nigeria (IMN), a Shi'ite group, embarked on a peaceful demonstration in Kaduna metropolis demanding the release of their leader Sheik Ibraheem El-Zakzaky.
Members of Andoni community attack a police station in Okoro Ete, killing two and stealing weapons. The attack may be related to ongoing tensions among community groups in the area.

Workers of the Osun State Broadcasting Corporation, Orisun FM radio station in Ife-Ife were attacked by students of public secondary schools in the town in protest over alleged inability of the state government to pay their external examination fees. No reported injury.
A doctor is shot by police during a protest and strike by medical staff. It is not clear is the shot was fatal.
Boko Haram raided two villages, Mairi and Malari in Konduga Local Government Area of Borno, killing four persons and razing houses in the communities.
At least 10 persons were confirmed dead with scores injured when a group of Boko Haram invaded Mairi Mmumbe village, near Dalori of Konduga Local Government Area of Borno State.
Doctors at a Lagos teaching hospital protest a tax policy on 06/02.

At least 23 people are killed following an attack by gunmen who invaded Kwanar Dutse village of Maru LGA. No group has claimed responsibility, though locals fear Boko Haram may be responsible. Date of attack not entirly clear, "[occurred during the weekend]".
Students of Afe Babalola University, Ado Ekiti, destroyed property worth millions of naira protesting over yet-to-be ascertained reasons. Police were able to quell the situation.
A suspected Fulani Herdsmen attack in Buruku Local Government Area of Benue State, killing 12 and injuring 25. The violence was mainly concentrated around the areas known as Tom-Anyiin and Tom-Ataan.
Doctors at a Lagos hospital protest unpaid saleries on 07/02.
Organised labour, including the NLC and its civil society allies protested a electricity tax in several cities. The protests were peaceable.

Boko Haram attacked a group of firewood traders in Jawu village, about 8 kilometres from Auno town of Kondiga, west of Maiduguri, killing five.

Police open fire on an otherwise peaseable IOPB protest in Aba on 09/02. Six dead, injuries reported, plus arrests.
Protest against persistent Fulani violence in Asaba on 09/02.

No fewer than 12 people have sustained various degrees of injury, including a district head, in a fracas between Gwani and Kinafa communities in Yamaltu/Deba local government councils over farm land dispute.
Two female suicide bombers detonated bombs at the Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) camp in Dikwa, Borno State, leaving 58 people dead and over 78 others injured.
A group of Owerri residents attack and nearly lynch two men they suspect of robbery before they are saved by police.

Members of the All Progressives Congress (APC), "last week" (source dated 15/02) staged a peaceful protest at the party's secretariat in Kuje, calling for the replacement of their chairmanship candidate in the forthcoming area council election.

Students of Yaba College of Technology, YABATECH, protested the death of a fellow student, alleging medical malpractice and a transfer policy. Students were also protesting at the nearby University of Lagos, also on Lagos Mainland. The protest was violent and is expected to cause the university to close for several weeks.
Fulanis attack Abi community on 11/02, killing two and causing 19 to go missing.
Cameroonian soldiers launch a cross border raid against Boko Haram at Goshi location (in or near Ashigashiya) on 11/02, killing at least 27.
Tags: Associated Press  Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Military forces ambushed a group of Boko Haram fighters at Gwai Mainari in Mainok on 11/02. "Some" Boko Haram were killed in the attack, others injured, weapons recovered.
Tags: This Day (Lagos) Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Fulanis and Agatu farmers clash in Okokolo, Ologba Utukolugwu and Oweto areas of Agatu LGA. Six deaths reported.
Tags: Daily Trust (Abuja) Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: About twenty persons sustained injuries during a bloody clash among members of All Progressives Congress (APC), at Oka-Akoko in Akoko South West Local Government area of Ondo State. The violence is believed to be related to the party's choice of a governorship candidate. Two deaths, plus several injuries.
Fulanis and Agatu farmers clash in Okokolo, Ologba Utukolugwu and Oweto areas of Agatu LGA. Six deaths reported.
Tags: Daily Trust (Abuja) Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill a former Rivers State PDP lawmaker on 11/02. The reason for the attack is not known.

Boko Haram militants killed at least 30 people during attacks on two villages in Damboa (Yakshari-12/02 and Kachifa-13/02) over two days in Borno State. The attackers looted food supplies, carting away herds, and kidnapping women and children.
Organized labourers (mainly NLC) protest a electricity tax in Ikeja. This was a continuation of a similar mass protest in various areas in the previous week.

Soldiers traversing Dogon Gida and New Marte stepped on an undetected Improvised Explosive Device (IED) buried by suspected Boko Haram. The explosion caused four injuries and damage to the vehicle. Elsewhere in the area (unknown exact location), military forces in a joint operation with Cameroonian forces killed 10 members of the group while recuing 45 female captives. The source states the "military forces advanced to Mararraba, Angwan Fada, Dale, Wizha, Bokko Timit, Bokko Nasanu, Bokko Hide, up to Ngoshe village where they linked up with the Cameroonians." However, it is not clear where the encounters with Boko Haram occurred.

However, it is not clear where the encounters with Boko Haram occurred.
Unidentified gunmen invaded Omoku community on 12/02, forcing residents from their homes, reasons unknown. Fifteen dead reported.

Boko Haram militants killed at least 30 people during attacks on two villages in Damboa (Yakshari-12/02 and Kachifa-13/02) over two days in Borno State. The attackers looted food supplies, carting away herds, and kidnapping women and children.
One beheaded, another kidnapped when militia members from Agila, Benue State attack Ojiogu village, Ukwuagba-Ngbo, Ebonyi State in a boundary dispute. The attack occurred "at the weekend."

Students of Delta State University run riot, destroying school property. Sources said the students were protesting against the management's decision not to allow the final year engineering students graduate without passing the courses they carried over from other departments.
A group of factory workers violently protest the alleged taking of bribes by management. The protesters assaulted a police officer, injuring him.

Two persons are feared dead and six others injured in Kwal village of Bassa local government area of Plateau State following renewed hostilities between Berom and Irigwe communities in the state on 15/02.
Tags: Daily Trust (Abuja) Battle-No change of territory

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NULGE: Nigerian Union of Local Government Employees
NOTES: NULGE workers barricade council secretariats in Sagbama, Nembe, Yenagoa, effectively shutting them down, over unpaid salaries on 15/02.

Military forces attack and recapture the "spiritual" Boko Haram stronghold of Alagarno (which includes Komala, Dole, Kumshi and Moadori), killing two and capturing two leaders, Mustapha Busuru and Usman Abubakar.
Delta State University students protest for their non payment of their bursary allowance on 16/02 in Asaba.

Military forces battled Boko Haram on 16/02 in Borno rescuing 350 persons and killing 167 insurgents in separate but nearby operations in Gajibo, Maula, Gamai, Gamare, Maiwa, Warsale, Tangli, Tushi, Sowa, Hasanari, Changuwa, Malamaja and Marya towns in Mafa and Dikwa Local Governments Areas.

Military forces battled Boko Haram on 16/02 in Borno rescuing 350 persons and killing 167 insurgents in separate but nearby operations in Gajibo, Maula, Gamai, Gamare, Maiwa, Warsale, Tangli, Tushi, Sowa, Hasanari, Changuwa, Malamaja and Marya towns in Mafa and Dikwa Local Governments Areas.

Boko Haram attacks Kuda, setting fire to the village. In response to the attack military forces mobilized, though the Boko Haram attack retreated before the soldiers arrived. One woman reported dead from the fire.

Military forces battled Boko Haram on 16/02 in Borno rescuing 350 persons and killing 167 insurgents in separate but nearby operations in Gajibo, Maula, Gamai, Gamare, Maiwa, Warsale, Tangli, Tushi, Sowa, Hasanari, Changuwa, Malamaja and Marya towns in Mafa and Dikwa Local Governments Areas.
Members of the Nigerian Medical Association protest at the Osun state house over unpaid salaries on 16/02.
A coalition of civil society groups protest at the National Assembly and Education Ministry the termination of 13 vice chancellors of federal universities by the government.
Military forces attacked Boko Haram elements at Komala and Musafanari general area coming from Sambisa forest. A number of weapons were recovered. Casualties not known.
Tags: Daily Trust (Abuja) Battle-No change of territory

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NANS: National Association of Nigerian Students
NOTES: NANS students protesting the firing of education leaders demonstrate in Abuja on 18/02. Police dispersed the group with tear gas, make five arrests.

Protesters demonstrated at the office of Sterling Energy Exploration Company, SEEPCO, at Kwale, Ndokwa West Local Government Area, Delta State, demanding the relocation of the company's operational headquarters from Lagos to Delta State.
Gunmen suspected to be kidnappers on 20/02 invaded a Fulani camp at Gurfata village in Gwagwalada Area Council, Abuja, killing a member of the group and kidnapping another herder.
Prospective students barricaded JAMB offices in Lagos and Benin while protesting against the decision of the board to close the sale of forms.
Prospective students barricaded JAMB offices in Lagos and Benin while protesting against the decision of the board to close the sale of forms.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
NOTES: Students of Lagos State University clash with members of the NURTW during a road-blocking taxation protest (along Lagos-Badagry Expressway) on behalf of the students. Injuries reported.
Youths of Eniong Offot community in Uyo local government area of the Akwa Ibom State staged a protest over planned demolition of their homes.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: PENGASSAN: Petroleum and Natural Gas Senior Staff Association of Nigeria
NOTES: Members of PENGASSAN protest over two days over a management issue.
Suspected PDP supporters bomb the office of the APC senatorial candidate in Boni. The bombing occurred during the overnight hours and it is believed no one was present at the time of the bombing.

Eighteen persons were killed in Gokana LGA, Rivers State, as soldiers engaged loyalists of an ex-militant leader (Solomon Ndigbara) in a shootout. The clash is likely related to a recent raid on the leader's home.
Tags: Rhythm FM  Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Police forces arrest a prominent Boko Haram commander known as Ali Audu in Tela on 22/02. The information was confirmed by the police on 23/05.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: PENGASSAN: Petroleum and Natural Gas Senior Staff Association of Nigeria
NOTES: Members of PENGASSAN protest over two days over a management issue.
A group demonstrates against Senate President Bukola Saraki, calling for his resignation following the suspension of a fellow Senator. The protest took place at the national assembly.
One killed, several wounded in a Edo communal clash between those of Uneme and Okpella villages. The clash may have been related to access to a logging area.
During a battle of Nigerian and Cameroonian forces in Kumshe a house with Boko Haram members caught fire in nearby Fatake, killing three members inside.

Nigerian and Cameroonian forces engage Boko Haram along the Talala-Banki-Kumshe axis, 23 Boko Haram militants were killed (The Nation), the troops destroyed 4 AK 47 rifles and captured a gun truck mounted with an Anti-Aircraft Gun (AA Gun) and 2 AK 47 rifles, as well as a 60mm mortar. The military forces also rescued 150 prisoners, who were mostly children. Three soldiers injured. Allied forces gained control of the area.
Primary School teachers in Yagba West local government area of Kogi state protested against the plan by the authorities of the council to pay them less of their current salary.

Fulani militia attacks the Agatu communities of Akwu, Adagbo, Okpagabi, Edumoogbo, Egwuma, Okpanchenyi, Onicha K Oladukwu, Usha, Owetp, Ayilla, and Ogboju on 24/02, as well as Okokolo and Abugbe. "Hundreds" killed (300 reported later in the week - Vanguard), villages destroyed. In the following week authorities estimated 7,000 were displaced due to the violence.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NANS: National Association of Nigerian Students
NOTES: NANS affiliated students protest the termination of 12 vice chancellors by the federal government in Abuja, blocking traffic, damaging cars and other property.

Fulani militia attacks the Agatu communities of Akwu, Adagbo, Okpagabi, Edumoogbo, Egwuma, Okpanchenyi, Onicha K Oladukwu, Usha, Owetp, Ayilla, and Ogboju on 24/02, as well as Okokolo and Abugbe. "Hundreds" killed (300 reported later in the week - Vanguard), villages destroyed. In the following week authorities estimated 7,000 were displaced due to the violence.

"Hundreds" killed (300 reported later in the week - Vanguard), villages destroyed. In the following week authorities estimated 7,000 were displaced due to the violence.

Hundreds of protesters marched through streets in Asaba to express disapproval of the alleged plan by the state government to formally recognise Agbaovwe Afugbeya as monarch in Uwheru Kingdom in Ughelli North Local Government Area.

Military forces encounter and stop Boko Haram during a suspected coordinated attack on the Dikwa area. The troops recovered 26 bodies of Boko Haram, while others escaped with gunshot wounds; destroyed 3 VIED, 1 MBIED and two gun trucks. The military deaths not reported.
A secondary school student is shot and killed by security forces when a protest erupted after police attempted to stop a football match.

Fulani militia attacks the Agatu communities of Akwu, Adagbo, Okpagabi, Edumoogbo, Egwuma, Okpanchenyi, Onicha K Oladukwu, Usha, Owetp, Ayilla, and Ogboju on 24/02, as well as Okokolo and Abugbe. "Hundreds" killed (300 reported later in the week - Vanguard), villages destroyed. In the following week authorities estimated 7,000 were displaced due to the violence.

"Hundreds" killed (300 reported later in the week - Vanguard), villages destroyed. In the following week authorities estimated 7,000 were displaced due to the violence.

Nine persons including a personnel of Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps, NSDC were reportedly killed while ten others sustained various degrees of injuries when Fulanis attacked Ibi and Wukari local government areas of Taraba State on 25/02.
"Scores" are killed when an improvised explosive device seized from Boko Haram Islamists detonated at a police station in Jimeta, Yola area.
Sellers of sachet water took to the streets of Kubwa village on 25/02 protesting the increase of the cost price of the product.

A section of Ladipo Auto Spare Part Market in Mushin area of Lagos State was grounded as traders took to the streets protesting the reported death of one of their colleagues after he was recently killed by "thugs."

Nine persons including a personnel of Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps, NSDC were reportedly killed while ten others sustained various degrees of injuries when Fulanis attacked Ibi and Wukari local government areas of Taraba State on 25/02.
Youths from Southern Ijaw Local Government Area of Bayelsa State protest 'neglect' from a western oil company following a rig explosion in their area. The protest took place in Yenagoa.
Military forces clear a Boko Haram camp at Korohuma (Kotokuma), kill 37 members of the group. Two soldiers reported dead.

Unnamed gunmen attack Ogbele community on 27/02, killing five and kidnapping the chairman of the Community Development Committee. Residents of neighbouring communities fled in fear of mass arrests from descending security forces to the area.
A vigilante group lynches a suspected thief in the Apo area of the city on the morning of 29/02. In response a group protested the killing.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: PENGASSAN: Petroleum and Natural Gas Senior Staff Association of Nigeria
NOTES: Members of PENGASSAN protest over a management issue in Abuja.
A vigilante group lynches a suspected thief in the Apo area of the city on the morning of 29/02. In response a group protested the killing.
Gunmen suspected to be "pipeline vandals" abducted three girls from a hostel in Ikorodu on the evening of 29/02.
APC youths hold a political rally in support of President Buhari in Katsina's Kangiwa Square.

Retirees from the Bayelsa state civil service under the aegis of Nigerian Union of Pensioners were attacked in front of the Government House while they were protesting unpaid gratuity by a group that they allege was hired by the state government. A conflicting witness claims there was not violence.
Residents of Akamkpa and Obubra local government areas protest in Akankpa against a state government scheme to remove a large area of forest in order to build a highway.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CAFON: Consumer Advocacy Foundation of Nigeria
NOTES: Banking customers under the aegis CAFON protest in Enugu over undue charges. In addition to the protest, the group also boycotted banking activates for the day.
A coalition of civil society groups from the state gathered the National Assembly to protest a spate of recent killings by Fulanis in Agatu Local Government in Benue State.

Some persons whose buildings were demolished to pave way for the construction of additional service lanes on the Ugbowo-Lagos Road in Benin City protest non-payment of compensation by the Edo State Government.
Youths protest against "hate speeches" by the Governor. [The protesters] said that their [demonstration] was in pursuit of Ogoni non-violence struggle.
Civil servants in Ijora protest an alleged assault on a colleague by a member of work management.
Yoruba and Hause militias clash in Kosofe the night of 02/03. Four reported dead from fighting.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
ALLY_ACTOR_2: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
NOTES: One feared dead during a leadership tussle among members of the NURTW union in Oshodi.
A group of soldiers allegedly attack a group of elderly woman who were otherwise peaceably protesting a disputed land ownership issue. The extent of the protesters' injures are not known.
Members of the Anambra State Vigilante group protested the non-payment of their eight months' salary arrears by the state government. The protest took place at the government house in Awka.
A vigilante mob attacks and set ablaze a suspected kidnapper in Kwadaru village of Kubau.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: ASURI: Academic Staff Union of Research Institutions
NOTES: Scientists under the aegis of Academic Staff Union of Research Institutions (ASURI) have embark on a street protest in Abuja over the inability of the federal government to commercialise research findings.
Military forces clear three Boko Haram camps in Alagarno forest on 04/03 (at Biu LGA) at Lawin Meleri, Matiri Bulaka and Aljeri, killing 5 members of the sect and rescuing 63 of their prisoners.
Members of WAI protest in Kirikiri against a defendant in a court case who is charged with domestic violence against his wife.

During the night of 04/03 Hausa men attacked a group of Yorubas and their shops at Mile 12 market in Kosofe. Many shops were destroyed and six killed. In response to the invasion, some armed Yoruba youths converged close to the market in readiness for another attack or clash at about 1pm. The Yorubas chanted war songs attempted to invade the market and destroy shops belonging to Hausa traders, but they were dispersed by security operatives with tear gas canisters. 105 arrested total, among both groups.

During the night of 04/03 Hausa men attacked a group of Yorubas and their shops at Mile 12 market in Kosofe. Many shops were destroyed and six killed. In response to the invasion, some armed Yoruba youths converged close to the market in readiness for another attack or clash at about 1pm. The Yorubas chanted war songs attempted to invade the market and destroy shops belonging to Hausa traders, but they were dispersed by security operatives with tear gas canisters. 105 arrested total, among both groups.
The bodies of nine are discovered in Agatu LGA on 04/03. It is believed this had been a continuation of earlier violence and Fulanis are responsible.
An APC member is attacked and beaten to death in Obibi by suspected PDP supporters.
An APC ward chairman is attacked and beheaded by suspected PDP militia in Omoku. His wife and son were also shot dead in the attack.
Military forces encounter fleeing Boko Haram near the Sabsawa axis of Sambisa forest. The following clash caused at least one soldier to be injured.

Agents of the Department of State Services (DSS) invade the Ekiti State House Assembly, abducting four lawmakers. It is believed the four were kidnapped after they refused to involve themselves in the impeachment process of the governor.
Ogoni residents protest in Bori over a military presence into their traditional communities. The protest took place "at the weekend."
Military forces clear Boko Haram from Dousa (Doksa) on 05/03, kill two and recovering weapons. The operation was in coordination with other military exercises in the area.
Military forces encounter and clear Boko Haram forces from Dure area on 05/03. "Several" Boko Haram fatalities, three soldiers injured.
Military forces encounter and clear Boko Haram forces from Amdaga Makaranta and Amdaga Madachi in Gwoza. The same brigade had recently cleared Dure. Two Boko Haram reported dead.
Police forces arrest a prominent Boko Haram commander known as Abdulmumini Abdullahi in Bali on 05/03. The information was confirmed by the police on 23/05.
Land owners protest in Kaduna over the government take-over of their property without proper compensation. Date of protest not known, source dated 06/03.
The Islamic Movement in Nigeria protest in Kano for the release of their incarcerated leader, Sheikh Ibraheem El-Zakzaky. Exact date of protest not known, source dated 06/03.

Boko Haram, in an effort to overtake Gwoza, are intercepted and repulsed at the nearby towns of Bitta (in Damboa) and Pulka. The clash began the evening of 07/03, and continued overnight into the morning of 08/03. The fight was said to have forced the military to deploy fighter jets from Yola to support ground troops who were initially being overwhelmed. Eighteen Boko Haram dead, three soldiers injured.
Suspected PDP supporters attack and kill a APC chieftain, setting him ablaze. The death either sparked or was the result of a clash between the two parties.

Scores of residents of three communities on the Ibafo-Mowe axis of the Lagos/Ibadan Expressway protest prolonged power outages at the Punch Newspapers headquarters in Ikeja and in Ibafo on 07/03.
An APC member is attacked and beaten to death by suspected members of the PDP in Opobo Town. A similar attack took place the same day in Buguma.

Hisbah forces in Sabon Gari of Kano attempted to impound a beer truck, smashing its windshield and deflating tyres. Nearby youths, angered by the action nearly attacked the Islamic group before they were separated by security forces.

Suspected PDP supporters attack and kill a APC chieftain, setting him ablaze. The death either sparked an armed clash between the two parties. It is not clear if there were any causalities or injuries from the subsequent clash.
Tags: This Day (Lagos) Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Teachers of Adeniran Ogunsanya College of Education, Agbara, protest pay by barricading the gates of their institution. During the demonstration, the protesters were engaged in a scuffle with management, which led to the non-lethal stabbing of one.

Boko Haram, in an effort to overtake Gwoza, are intercepted and repulsed at the nearby towns of Bitta (in Damboa) and Pulka. The clash began the evening of 07/03, and continued overnight into the morning of 08/03. The fight was said to have forced the military to deploy fighter jets from Yola to support ground troops who were initially being overwhelmed. Eighteen Boko Haram dead, three soldiers injured.

The clash began the evening of 07/03, and continued overnight into the morning of 08/03. NOTES: Boko Haram, in an effort to overtake Gwoza, are intercepted and repulsed at the nearby towns of Bitta (in Damboa) and Pulka. The clash began the evening of 07/03, and continued overnight into the morning of 08/03. The fight was said to have forced the military to deploy fighter jets from Yola to support ground troops who were initially being overwhelmed. Eighteen Boko Haram dead, three soldiers injured.
Eight are killed in a Fulani attack in Logo LGA in the early morning hours of 08/03.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: PENGASSAN: Petroleum and Natural Gas Senior Staff Association of Nigeria
NOTES: PENGASSAN, was well as other unions, shut down the operations of Nigerian National petroleum Corporation (NNPC) nationwide, specificity barring union members from entering an office in Abuja.
A mother's group protests ongoing violence at the hands of Boko Haram and Fulani tribes in Alausa on 09/03. The protest caused traffic problems in the city.
Support staff at the University of Ibadan protest non-payment of salaries on 09/03.
Military forces clear a Boko Haram camp at Alajeri, Guzamala LGA, killing 40 and recovering weapons on 10/03.
Members and leaders of the APC protest at a party headquarters against alleged disenfranchisement by the Buhari administration.
Military forces engage Boko Haram in Daba Magagi (Daban-Masara), wound and capture a prominent leader of the group.
Two families clash in the palace of Ooni of Ife on 10/03 over which would produce the next Obalufe (second-tier leader). No injuries were reported.
Unidentified persons kidnap an Edo State magistrate in Obadan on 10/03, reasons not known.
A Fulani group attacks Obangedde on 10/03, killing one and wounding others. The group had attacked the area earlier in the week.
A Fulani group attacks Logo LGA on 10/03, killing two. The group had attacked the area earlier in the week.
Eighteen are dead following a large explosion targeting a bank. Many other injured. Perpetrators not known.

A member of the PDP attacked a APC supporter with an axe at Yaba village in Abaji, Abuja. The extent of the victim's injuries are not clear. Following the attack members of the APC mobalizied themselves and attacked a group of PDP supporters, provoking a clash.
Tags: Daily Trust (Abuja) Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Members of the Islamic Movement of Nigeria staged a protest in Illorin on 11/03 against the detention of the Shiite leader Sheik Ibrahim Al ZakZak.
Residents of Okpai protest neglect from an area oil company, demand the reconstruction of recently demolished road.

A member of the PDP attacked an APC supporter with an axe at Yaba village in Abaji, Abuja. The extent of the vicim's injuries are not clear. Following the attack members of the APC mobalizied themselves and attacked a group of PDP supporters, provoking a clash.
Boko Haram forces ambush military forces at Banki, four Boko Haram dead, weapons recovered. The ambush occurred "at the weekend."

Nigerian forces "at the weekend" repulse a Boko Haram attack on Pulka. A similar Boko Haram attack had occred in Pulka on 08/03. Seventeen Boko Haram dead, weapons recovered. Additionally, the forces rescued 95 hostages along the nearby Bitta-Pridang-Manawashe axis, as well as 27 who had escaped from Mayo Ali village.
Military forces ambushed a group of Boko Haram forces near Komala and Musafanari villages in Sambisa forest. Several members of Boko Haram reported wonded. The clash took place "at the weekend."

Ogoni youths from the Rivers South East senatorial district "at the weekend" took to the streets of Bori in protest over the alleged "hate speech" of Governor Ezebunwo Nyesom Wike against the Ogoni population in the area.
At least seven people were killed and 19 injured when two factions of an unnamed vigilante group clashed in Gombi on 13/03.
Tags: Premium Times (Abuja) Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Members of the Aga Orunto Ruling Family staged a peaceful protest to Ooni of Ife's palace over the appointment of new Obalufe.

Fulanis attack and "take over" the Logo LGA communities of Ukemberegya, Bwarer, Mbawar, Gov and Gambe Tiev on 13/03. Two reported deaths. Other villages in the area were raided in the attack but remain unoccupied.

Military forces clear Boko Haram from Gwashari village along Damboa-Bale road, killing one and capturing three others. They also recovered 1 Dane gun, AK-47 rifle magazine, 2 knives, assorted drugs and the sum of N142,000.

Ogun State workers, attempting to enter the Ogun State secretirat, throw stones at an NLC lawmaker's car in protest of of his wishes of a labour strike. In response, police released 15 Alsatian dogs to scatter the protesters. No reported injuries.

Members of the Ekiti State House of Assembly staged a peace protest at both the US and UK embassies in Abuja, calling on the two countries to intervene after the Ekiti State House invaded by Department of State Services (DSS) on 04/03.
For the second day, members of the Aga Orunto Ruling Family staged a peaceful protest to Ooni of Ife's palace over the appointment of new Obalufe.

Youths of Anguwan Rukuba, in Jos, burnt a police station in the area after members of the National Drug Law Enforcement Agency (NDLEA) and the Nigeria Police arrested suppliers and users of a illicit drug the previous evening. No reported injury.
Military forces ambush and clear the Boko Haram camps of Golgore (15/03) and Bulasari (16/03). During the operation "a number" of Boko Haram were killed and soldier was injured.
Five dead following an ambush and clash between Boko Haram and an area vigilante group. Two of the dead are civilans bystanders.
Tags: Premium Times (Abuja) Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: JAMB candidates (Joint Admission and Matriculation Board) protest for the removal of the registrar when they believe their grades had been marked down in an effort to privative the university.
Several nurse/medical unions protest unpaid allowences in Abuja during the morning hours.
Bauchi pensioners protest non-payment of their monthly stipend on 15/03.
Electricity consumers in Calabar protest a tax hike.
Residents protesting neglect of an area oil company destroy pipelines. A similarly motivated protest took place in the area on 11/03.
Military forces ambush and clear the Boko Haram camps of Golgore (15/03) and Bulasari (16/03). During the operation "a number" of Boko Haram were killed and soldier was injured.
Hair dressers "during the week" (source dated 18/03) blocked the major entrance to Wuse market in Abuja to protest alleged harassment from officials of the market's management company.
A coalition of groups protest unfavourable tax policy in Ado-Ekiti.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: CDHR: Committee for the Defence of Human Rights
NOTES: CDHR (among a coalition of other groups) protests the alleged end of an anti political corruption crusade in Ikeja.
Students of University of Jos as well as other youths took to the streets to protest against the shooting of a fellow student by security personnel during an arrest the previous day.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: MSSN: Muslim Student Society of Nigeria
NOTES: MSSN members of the University of Lagos protest their group's non-recognition and a ban of activities by the school.
27 people were killed and 35 others were injured in an early morning Boko Haram double suicide attack on a mosque at Umarari-Molai (Dolori), a village 6 kilometers from Maiduguri.
Residents of Eket protest an area oil company over non-compensation following an oil spill.
Residents of Gbagyi Villa in Kaduna protest the plan by the Kaduna State Urban Planning and Development Agency to demolish area structures.
Unidentified gunmen attacked Mgbuitanwo, Emohua Local Government Area, beheading a man and abducting another.
Two are dead and ten houses destroyed on 17/03 when Adadama militia attacked Ochanyim town in violence related to a border dispute.
Fulanis attack Tombo on 18/03, killing 15 residents.
One is dead in election day related violence when unidentified gunmen opened fire on a group of people at Abalama in Asari Toru local government area.
One person is shot and killed at Ogboloko community in Abua/Odual LGA in election day violence. Perpatrators not known.
Four are killed in election day violence in Eleme LGA on 19/03. Details of perpetrators and victim are limited.
One is killed in election day violence at Nonwa (either Kenbawa or Udume) on 19/03. Details limited.
Six are killed when unidentified gunmen invaded Daraga on 19/03. Following the attack a group, which killed three, armed villagers attacked the suspected gunmen, killing an additional three.
Tags: PM News Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A prominent member of the APC and the director of the NIMASA survive after an assassination attempt by unknown gunmen while travelling in their vehicle. Following the attack the assailants were pursued by security officials. One of the perpetrators became injured during a 30 minute gunfight.
Tags: Premium Times Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A prominent member of the APC and the director of the NIMASA survive after an assassination attempt with no injury by unknown gunmen while travelling in their vehicle.  Following the attack the assailants were pursued by security officials. One of the perpetrators became injured during a 30 minute gunfight.
Six are killed when unidentified gunmen invaded Daraga on 19/03. Following the attack a group, which killed three, armed villagers attacked the suspected gunmen, killing an additional three.
Military forces clear Boko Haram's Dalori camp, killing 18 members (Xinhua reports 27), including a prominent leader known as the "Ameer of Dalore." Additionally, 67 of their hostages were freed.
Military forces ambush Boko Haram at Dawashi location, Borno State, kill seven.
Military air forces  carry out strikes on the Allagarno forest area of Yobe, causalities not known.
Reports of shootings in Port Harcourt are are believed to be related to ongoing election violence. The gunfire lasted for 30 minutes, no reported injuries.
Military forces clear a Boko Haram camp at Musari on 21/03, killing 58. One soldier reportedly lost in the battle.
Health workers in Ikare-Akoko protest over unpaid salaries on 21/03.

Military forces clear Boko Haram camps in Menari, Bulamari, Zangebe, Maafa, Mijigine, Baale and Kaltaram villages in Mafa LGA on 23/03, kill five, rescue 180 hostages and recover a large cache of weapons.

Boko Haram abducts 18 women and two girls from Sabongari in Adamawa on 23/03.
A Hausa trader, along with his Fulani business partner are killed by Tiv militia in Ibi LGA.

Vigilantes "last week" (source dated 30/03) attacked and nearly lynched a group of people posing as police officers in Lagos. Those impersonating the officers did so to illegally impound vehicles and sell them.

Ijaw youths attacked a group of Urhobo woman who were returning to their farms in Ogbe Ijoh on 23/03. Casualities not known. The attack lead to a clash between the two ethnic groups later in the week.

Military forces clear the areas of Wumbi, Tunish and Tilem in Kala/Balge on 23/03. The Boko Haram training camp at Tilem was destroyed. "Heavy" [Boko Haram] causalities reported, 567 civilian hostages.

Residents of Eket barricade roads in protest over a delay in payment of compensation from an oil company following a spill.
Urhobo and Ijaw youths clash in Udu LGA over a blocked road relating to a recent attack on a group of Urhobo women. The clash led to the over-running and looting a police station. "Scores" wounded.
Tags: The Nation (Nigeria) Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Civilian JTF (in coordination with military forces) stop two potential female suicide bombers at Umulari Mulai, about six kilometres away from Maiduguri on the Maiduguri-Damboa road. One of them detonated her bomb when the Civilian JTF vigilantes on duty around the area asked ‘who is there.’ The second bomber scurried away and holed up nearby. But she was discovered and shot when soldiers came to the site. Her bomb was later detonated. Only the two bombers reported dead.
Gunmen described as "land grabbers" on 25/03 attacked a group of protesters against the practice of Okada riders in Isiwu, killing one.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill a police officer in Satellite Town on 25/03. The motive of the killing is not known.
Tags: Nigerian Tribune Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Party violence among the APC at a political rally in Dobi causes one death. Eight arrested the following day.
Abductors kidnapped an army Colonel while he travelled with his wife in Kamaza on 26/03. The colonel was later found dead.

Military forces clear Madube Cikin along the Bita-Madube Ciki-Njubul axis, killing four Boko Haram and rescuing 54. At least one soldier injured. Date(s) of the operation vague. Military announcement made on 28/03. Presumably, the operation took place several days earlier.
National Insurance Commission employees protest agency mismanagement and corruption in Abuja.
Fulani militia attack the Tiv village of Butu on 27/03, beating an older man into a coma when he was unable to flee. The Fulanis had given notice of their coming attack on 25/03.
30 are killed by Kuteb militia at Yongogba, a Tiv settlement along Takum-Kpashe Road.
Kuteb militia attack Takum on 27/03, killing 20 Tiv.
Military forces gain control of the `spiritual power base’ of Boko Haram, Alagarno as well as the neighbouring villages of Yajiwa, Joba, and Mosa on 28/03. "Several" Boko Haram killed.
Military forces clear Boko Haram from Bolunga village on 28/03, kill five and capture one.

A joint military operation among the Civilans JTF and regular army on 28/03 "[that] took place at Iza [sic] general area" yields 29 Boko Haram dead, 72 rescued civilians and the clearing of Mbollena and Shamari areas. One member of the Civilian JTF was wounded in a vehicle accident.

Military forces gain control of the `spiritual power base’ of Boko Haram, Alagarno as well as the neighbouring villages of Yajiwa, Joba, and Mosa on 28/03. "Several" Boko Haram killed.
Police forces from Abuja arrest 11 PDP Ekiti State lawmakers on the evening of 29/03 over the allegation of stockpiling arms during the June 21, 2014 governorship election.
Eruwa Polytechnic students violently protest over alleged admission flaws and an increase in fees on 29/03. Police use tear gas, two injured.
Military forces clear Boko Haram from Gare village near Sambisa Forest on 28/03, killing one and rescuing 36 prisoners.

Members of the PDP gather at the Independent National Electoral Commission in Abuja to protest the continued delay to act on the Supreme Court judgment in respect of the winners of the National Assembly seats in Anambra state in the 2015 general elections.

Scores of residents in Arepo in Ogun State took to the street to protest the alleged murder of three members of the community by naval operatives deployed to safeguard the pipelines in the area. The deaths of the three may have been related to a fight in a beer parlour.

Two are dead and several houses destroyed during tit-for-tat attacks between Uneme-Ekpedo and Bekuma-Okpameri communities over land rights on 30/03. An Uneme youth was initially killed for picking a mango from a tree that the Bekuma argue belonged to them. The Uneme later attacked Bekuma residents.

Two are dead and several houses destroyed during tit-for-tat attacks between Uneme-Ekpedo and Bekuma-Okpameri communities over land rights on 30/03. An Uneme youth was initially killed for picking a mango from a tree that the Bekuma argue belonged to them. The Uneme later attacked Bekuma residents.
Over 100 residents Otodo Gbame community protested at the Lagos State Government House on 30/03 against dredging and sand-filling activities near their homes.
Members of the Islamic Movement peacefully protest for the release of their leader, Ibraheem El-Zakzaky in Kaduna on 31/03.
On 31/03 a group of Okada riders protest the killing of three of their colleagues by criminal elements earlier in the week. The group blocked several major roads throughout the city.
Military forces clear Wulwuta of Boko Haram on 31/03, kill 9, rescue 21 and recover weapons. One soldier wounded.
Members of the Islamic Movement peacefully protest for the release of their leader, Ibraheem El-Zakzaky near Zaria on 31/03.
People of Effurun community on 01/04 took to the streets, protesting alleged military victimisation of residents of their neighbourhood after a chairman has a violent encounter with a sailor.
Youths numbering over 1000 on 01/04 blocked the Ibrahim Yakowa expressway around Kamazo, a suburb of Kaduna metropolis to protest lack of electricity in their area for nearly a year.
Lagos bus drivers protest "poor staff welfare" on 01/04.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Republic of Congo (1997-)
NOTES: A dozen journalists were beaten at the Maya-Maya airport in Brazzaville by the police. They were awaiting the arrival of General Mokoko who has recently announced his candidacy for the early presidential vote in March.
Tags: Reporters sans Frontieres Violence against civilians

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Republic of Congo (1997-)
ALLY_ACTOR_2: Former Military Forces of Republic of Congo (1997-)
NOTES: Congolese authorities took presidential candidate and former army chief Jean Marie Michel Mokoko into custody and questioned him for 6 hours before releasing him.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Republic of Congo (1997-)
NOTES: 2 relatives of former presidential candidate and former general Jean-Marie Michel Mokoko were arrested, along with his close advisor and campaign manager. The spokesman of another candidate was arrested as well.
Tags: Radio France Internationale; Camer.be Strategic development

SOURCE: Les Dépêches de Brazzaville; Deutsche Welle
NOTES: Five presidential candidates called a "dead city" strike in Brazzaville, which was partially observed, largely in the south of the city.
Tags: Les Dépêches de Brazzaville; Deutsche Welle Riots/Protests

NOTES: Students protested in front of City Hall to demand subsidies.
Workers at Youssou Mbargane Diop hospital went on strike to oppose structural policies, paralyzing many services.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SUTRAIL: Single Union of Rail Workers
SOURCE: Agence de Presse Senegalaise; Sud Quotidien
NOTES: Transrail workers went on strike to protest delays in salaries, paralyzing the small commuter train system.
Tags: Agence de Presse Senegalaise; Sud Quotidien Riots/Protests

NOTES: Students, teachers and civil society organizations marched to advocate for girls' rights.
Unidentified group set fire to Dabo High School, causing major damage. A guard caught one of the perpetrators and handed him over to police.
Around 100 demonstrators from an anti-gay coalition protested against the release of accused homosexuals. Police dispersed protesters and arrested 11 because the protest was unauthorized.
Tags: Associated Press International; Sud Quotidien (Dakar) Riots/Protests

NOTES: Local government workers marched to demand payment of salaries.
Police arrested nearly 900 people in a two-day operation in Dakar and Thies in an effort to prevent potential terror attacks. Soldiers stationed on roads and in buildings and carry out searches.
Protesters marched against the recent publication by Jeune Afrique of a controversial cartoon depicting a Mouride religious leader.
Local government workers went on a 72 hour strike, paralyzing government services in Pikine and all the surrounding villages.
Mouride Muslims marched to denounce a cartoon recently published by Jeune Afrique.
Dozens of Mouride Muslims marched to protest a recent cartoon published by Jeune Afrique.
Students burnt tyres and erected roadblocks in Saint-Louis to protest against the prices of accomodation in town.

ACTOR1: MFDC: Movement of Democratic Forces of Casamance
NOTES: A Senegalese soldier was injured during a shootout with alleged Casamance rebels.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SAES: Independent Union of Higher Education
NOTES: Senegalese universities closed down for a two-day strike launched by SAES.
Transporters blocked the road into Gambia in protest against increased taxes on Senegalese trucks.
About three hundred people held a sit-in at town hall to demand the mayor's resignation.
Merchants marched in protest of raised taxes and threw objects at police who tried to stop them.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SAES: Independent Union of Higher Education
NOTES: Teachers marched in protest of the state's alleged violations of recent agreements with their union.
Telecommunications workers went on a 48 hour strike to protest outsourcing.
Villagers marched to protest lack of water and electricity.
Students started a three-day strike in Dakar. They threaten to march in the capital to put pressure on the government.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SAES: Independent Union of Higher Education
NOTES: Trade unions staged a protest march on Wednesday in Cheikh Anta Diop University in Dakar. They demand the respect of agreements from the part of the government.
Opposing political groups clashed while campaigning on an upcoming referendum. Gendarmes intervened.
Students demonstrated against government recruitment decisions, stopping traffic and clashing with security forces.
Opposing political groups clashed while campaigning for an upcoming referendum. Minor injuries reported.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SAES: Independent Union of Higher Education
NOTES: Teachers went on 48 hour strike in a continued dispute with government policies.
Four prisoners - all minors at the time of their arrest - went on hunger strike to protest long detention without trial.
University students went on a 48 hour strike.

Youth protested Ebola restrictions that have halted market activity in Barmoi Luma in Kambia district. At least eight people were injured, including with bullet wounds, as demonstrators allegedly burned down a police station and police fired tear gas to disperse them. 18 youths were arrested.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Muslim Group (Sierra Leone); Christian Group (Sierra Leone)
NOTES: Sierra Leone's Muslim and Christian leaders marched to parliament in Freetown to protest against a controversial draft law on abortion.
Angry youth pelted stones at Fire Forces for their alleged delay in responding to stress calls as a fire was engulfing a family's house Siaka Stevens Street.
Students at Koyeima Government Secondary School in Valunia chiefdom vandalised properties belonging to the school and staff on the night of 2 February, to protest against bad treatment.

Members of the ruling All Peoples Congress allegedly attacked supporters of Sierra Leone Peoples Party ( SLPP) in Moyah village in Moyamba district following local council bye-elections, injuring five.

Hundreds of students from the Fourah Bay College, University of Sierra Leone staged a peaceful demonstration at State House demanding a change of the general administration due to some loopholes in the administrative system.
Over three hundred Police Support Staff stormed the Ministry of Finance asking for backlog claim on increases made to wages and other allowances since July 2011 to present
Pupils of Koidu Secondary School and Islamic Secondary Schools clashed in Koidu, Kono district, over alleged beatings, leaving 31 injured.
Two groups of SNG forces exchanges gunfire in Siinka Dheer (14km SE of Afgooye) on 23/12. No reported causalities.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Six suspected al Shabaab members reportedly established an illegal checkpoint in Suweeto neighbourhood (Bosasso) in the early morning of 31/12. The suspected al Shabaab members tortured a civilian man near the Bosasso prison and carjacked two vehicles belonging to private companies.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Youths attacked a group of holding a New Years celebration with sticks and stones on 31/12. The youths injured four people and destroyed several cars. It is not clear as to the motive of the attack.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Two clan militias from Gaal Jecel and Jajeele sub-clans clashed in the vicinity of Buq-Goosaar (50km SW of Beled Weyne) in the morning of 01/01. At least seven combatants from both sides were killed in the clash which lasted for several hours.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: In the wake of the chaos caused by two groups of warring clan militias, al Shabaab took over Buq Koosaar without a fight.

Scuffles broke out between two youth groups from Habar Yonis and Dhulbahante sub-clans in Daalo neighbourhood (Ceerigaabo) on 01/01 following a dispute over territorial control. Ceerigaabo police intervened, shot in the air and arrested 5 people from both sides.
Al Shabaab attacked a Heliwa police station the evening of 01/01. The police officers responded, killing three of the attackers and capturing one.
Tags: Somali Dhacdo Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Unidentified assassins shoot and kill a Turkish national outside a mosque in Hodan District on 01/01. The reason for the targeting is not known.
Tags: Shabelle Media Network  Violence against civilians

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters fired at least six projectiles (SPG9 OR B10) against Xalane Base (Waberi District) in the early morning of 01/01. Four of them landed in an open ground and two landed in the sea. The rounds were probably fired from Jazeera side. No injuries reported.

The employees of Somaliland citizenship registration demonstrated in front of the mayor's office in Borama in 02/01 over unpaid salaries. The employees said that they have closed the office and will remain so until the dispute is resolved.

Two people reportedly died, one of them the suicide bomber in an explosion that happened at a restaurant near the National Theatre in Mogadishu on 2 January. It is reported that four other people were injured in the explosion. Some of the injured work for the Somali government and the rest are civilians who were taking tea at the restaurant. There was no immediate claim of responsibility but officials will likely blame the Al-Shabaab group.

Somali National Army (SNA) and local clan militia fought in Baraawe in the morning of 03/01 over unknown reasons. The fighting lasted almost one hour after which the military forces overpowered the local militia. Three combatants from the militia were confirmed dead while three SNA soldiers were injured in the fighting. The situation is calm (at the time of this report) and there is a possibility of recurrence of the clashes.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A group of Borama Town residents staged demonstrations on 03/01 following the recent strike by the employees of Somaliland citizen registration office in Borama. The demonstrators urged the government to intervene and resolve the issue.

Local media reported that two dead bodies of traders were found in the vicinity of Ceel Shiil (3km W of Ceel Buur) in the morning of 03/01. Locals confirmed that the victims were Ceel Shiil villagers. Al Shabaab are believed to be responsible (Somali Dhacdo). The two were likely targeted for regularly conducting business with SNG soldiers.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Local taxi drivers staged a massive demonstration in front of the local municipality and the main tarmac road, halting businesses and traffic movements in Garowe in the morning of 03/01. The protest came after government banned local taxis to ferry Khat sellers to and from the western checkpoint on suspicion of smuggling alcohol. Garowe police arrested some of the protestors.
Unidentified gunmen have reportedly killed a civilian while driving a luxury car in Hodan District on 03/01. It is not clear if the victim was a civilian or government official.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and severely injured a civilian man in CC neighbourhood (Karaan District) in the evening of 03/01. The motive of the attack is unknown and perpetrators escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Local militias (not identified) and al Shabaab fighters briefly clashed in Moor Eri (approx. 35km S of Maxaas) on 03/01. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters beheaded a traditional elder in Rabdhure Town in the night of 03/01. The elder previously spoke very critical about the insecurity of the town which is created by al Shabaab.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: A group of suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNGF position in Carbiska settlement (5km SE of Afgooye) on 04/01. After a brief exchange of gun-fire, al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters attack SNG forces in Ceel Shiil Village (3km SW of Ceel Buur) on 04/01. No causalities reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Ceerigaabo local government supported by the police destroyed small kiosks constructed illegally at the central grocery market in Ceerigaabo on 04/01. A group of kiosk owners attempted to stop the operations but two of them were arrested including a kiosk owner from Habar Yonis/Mohamud Hamud sub-clan who stabbed and injured one of the local government staff from Habar-Jeclo/Basan Buur sub-clan during the operations.

Police reports indicate that armed men from Majeerten/Dishishe sub-clan shot and killed two people and injured another over land dispute in Xange area near Dalwayn Village (83km N of Qardo) on the evening of 04/01. The victims hail from Majeerten/Osman Mohamud sub-clan and were searching for gold on the dispute land when the incident happened.The perpetrators escaped. The killing caused tension in the area.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Puntland customs police briefly exchanged gunfire with militias from Galmudug in the vicinity of Darxumo Market (Green line) in Galkacyo in the morning of 04/01 over taxation dispute. Stray bullets reportedly killed a businessman from Dir clan and injured another civilian. No other casualties were reported and the situation is calm.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted AMISOM/KDF convoy heading to Afmadow on its way from Dhoobley in Hawina (approx. 90km SW of Afmadow) in the morning of 04/01. One vehicle was damaged and three KDF soldiers were injured.

At least one person was killed and another injured when unidentified armed assailants attacked an apartment housing Turkish nationals near Mogadishu's main airport in Hamar Jabjab. The attack occurred during the nighttime hours of 04/01. Perpetrators not known.
Tags: Shabelle Media Network  Violence against civilians

NOTES: Two groups of SNGF briefly exchanged gunfire after one group stopped a vehicle with SNGF on security operation at Zobe junction (Hodan District) and they became suspicious of each other on 04/01. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Suspected Dhulbahante gunmen opened fire at a herd of camels belonging to Habarjeclo/Ahmed Farah sub-clan in the vicinity of Qocondhaale near Horufadhi Village (39km N of Buuhoodle) on 04/01. The camels were fetching water at the time of the incident. The gunmen destroyed jerry-cans and reportedly sexually assaulted a woman who was herding the camels before escaping from the area. The motive of the incident remains unknown. The incident comes one day after elders from Dhulbahante/Cigaal Naaleeye sub-clan and Habarjeclo/Ahmed Farah sub-clan reached peace agreement in Meygaagle Village.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: IED explosion targeted AMISOM/ENDF convoy in Leego (48km SE of Buur Hakaba) in the afternoon of 04/01. The explosion was followed by a brief armed clash which lasted for 30 minutes. Causalities could not be confirmed.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Unidentified perpetrators driving in a SURV vehicle tried to assassinate a Turkish national outside MIA in the late hours of 04/01. SNGF and his private security guards engaged the attackers in a gun-battle before they withdrew. Initial reports indicate that one of the attackers was killed and one security guard got injured.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters clashed with SNG forces in Warmahan (31km NW of Afgooye) in the early morning of 04/01. Initial reports indicate that al Shabaab fighters overrun the town and confiscated a technical from SNGF while SNG forces retreated to Afgooye. The SNG forces reportedly suffered at least 8 fatalities and five injuries.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-Non-state actor overtakes territory

NOTES: Following the capture of War Maxan by al Shabaab forces, government forces were able to recapture the village later the same afternoon. Additional casualties not known.

Two unidentified perpetrators armed with pistols shot and severely injured a man in Biyo Daaga (Yaaqshiid District) in the morning of 04/01. The motive is unknown but reports suggest that the victim was working with the government forces. The perpetrators managed to escape.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: SNGF attacked Aw Misigey (approx. 23km NE of Buur-Hakaba). They were supported by helicopters departing from Wanla Weyn District in Lower Shabelle. First reports indicate that sixteen al Shabaab fighters including their commander were killed and one managed to escape.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A device believed to be an UXO exploded in the vicinity of Bali Busle Village (145km S of Laas- Qoray) on 05/01, killing two boys and seriously injuring another. The boys were brothers and hail from Warsangeli sub-clan. The victims were herding goats when the incident happened. The device is believed to have been planted in the area during the civil war era.

Traders protested against new taxes imposed by Puntland government on imported goods at the port of Bosasso in the morning of 05/01. The traders refused to collect their goods from the port as result of the new tax tariff.
Somali forces have killed "several" Al-Shabab fighters in fighting against the group in southwestern Somalia town of Buurhakaba. No reported soldier dead.
Tags: Shabelle Media Network  Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A group of gunmen from Mareehan/Wagardhac sub-clan reportedly opened fire and carjacked a Toyota Mark II (2) car belonging to Majeerteen/Isse Mohamud sub-clan in the vicinity of Garsoor neighbourhood (Galkacyo North) in the evening of 05/01.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM-Somali forces overtake Towfiq village near the central town of Gal'ad during a military offensive in the area. Causalities, if any, were left unreported.
Suspected al Shabaab fighter attacked a SNGF base located near Ivo S Company on 05/01. Both sides exchanged gun fire before the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Unknown perpetrators hurled a hand grenade against SNG forces on foot patrol on 05/01. The grenade landed at an empty space and exploded causing no casualties. The perpetrators managed to escape.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: A powerful explosion hit a Kenyan convoy passing the road linking Dhooblay district and Taabto area in Lower Jubba. The blast killed a Kenyan commander and about 10 of his escorts, and forced the convoy to be stranded at the scene of the attack for several hours.
A former al Shabaab commander, who defected in 2015, is shot and killed on 06/01 in Berdera by suspected al Shabaab.
Tags: Shabelle Media Network (Mogadishu) Violence against civilians

NOTES: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against a house in Beled Xawo where SNG police were staying on 06/01. Causalities, injuries no reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters shot and killed a SNG soldier in Buulo Mareer Village (27 KM SW of Marka) on 06/01. Other SNGF who were rushing to the scene opened fire killing two civilian by-standers, presumably without intention. Perpetrators managed to escape.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack against SNGF base in Goof Gaduud Village (30km NW of Baidoa) on 06/01. Four soldiers were killed and four others were injured. Three civilians were also injured in the clash.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Two groups of suspected al Shabaab fighters carried out coordinated attacks on SNGP and NISA troops position in Biyo Degaanka and Abdiwayel Cinema neighbourhoods on 06/01. No casualties were reported and attackers withdrew.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Two groups of SNGF clashed in Zona K neighbourhood on 06/01. One Group was forcefully on eviction and demolishing operation but was engaged by the other SNGF group who inhabit the area. Two civilians were killed and the two groups were mediated by AMISOM/SNGF.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: SNG police attacked two SNGF who set up an illegal check-point at Jambaluul (6km NE of Afgooye) on 06/01. The forces arrested the two soldiers, manning the illegal check-point and no casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab execute a 90-year-old man in Rab Dhuure district (exact location not known) on 06/01. The killing caused area SNG forces to respond, killing four of the suspected responsible.
Tags: Universal TV Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab execute a 90-year-old man in Rab Dhuure district on 06/01. The killing caused area SNG forces to respond, killing four of the suspected responsible.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against a NISA outpost in Caymiska neighbourhood on 06/01. Both sides exchanged heavy gunfire that lasted for around 15 minutes before attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: An IED exploded in Haween Village (18km NW of Baidoa) targeting a lorry deploying troops from Baidoa town to Goof Gaduud Burey Village in the morning of 07/01. The IED explosion injured eleven soldiers who are now receiving medical assistance in Baidoa Hospital.

Al Shabaab fighters targeted an ISWA reinforcement convoy with an IED near Sanilow Village (25km NW of Baidoa) on 07/01. Immediately after the explosion an armed clash between ISWA and al Shabaab fighters erupted. Two ISWA soldiers were killed and four others were injured. Casualties on al Shabaab side are not known.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Unknown perpetrators launched a mortar attack from an unknown location targeting most likely Villa Somalia on 07/01. First reports indicate that all rounds fell in civilian neighbourhoods killing two people. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the attack.

A group of Bossaso residents hailing from Majerteen/Dashiishe sub-clan staged a demonstration in Bossaso in the morning of 08/01 in protest against Puntland president's speech accusing him of siding with their opponent (Osman Mohamud). The president's speech was calling for peaceful coexistence between the two sub-clan following a land dispute. The protest turned to violent while police at the scene responded with live bullets. One person was killed while another two others were injured.

Unidentified attackers armed with knives and other crude weapons reportedly assaulted a freelance journalist in Buuhoodle on 08/01. The motive behind the attack is currently unknown. The perpetrators escape while the victim was later admitted to Manhal Hospital in Laas Caanood.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Hundreds of Galkacyo (South) residents staged in a peaceful demonstration against the Speaker of the Somali parliament following his visit to Dhusamareeb in the morning of 08/01. The speaker together with other parliamentarians visited Dhusamareeb on 06/01 to meet with leaders of ASWJ on a peace mission to de-escalate the political tension with Galmudug State. The protest took place in Gaalkacyo.

At least 12 people were killed and 25 others were wounded in a battle between al Shabaab fighters against Somali government troops and South West Administration forces in the village of Goofguduud on 08/01.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab detonate a roadside bomb targeting a AMISOM convoy in the Shalaamboot region. The explosion caused damage to the vehicle.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against AMISOM/KDF contingent base in Badhaadhe town on 09/01.The sides briefly clashed for about 10 minutes after the attackers withdrew. The Kenya Daily reported the SNG forces reported with gunfire, killing 19 of the attackers.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against ISWA forces based in the outskirt of Baidoa town in night of 09/01. No casualties were reported from both sides.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Two groups of farmers hailing from two sub-clans of Gadabuursi clashed using sticks and stones on 09/01 over dispute on farm irrigation in Qodax Village (22km SE of Borama. Local elders intervened and managed to separate the two groups. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Gunmen dressed in Somali military uniform have opened fire on a civilian bus in Warsheekh town of middle Shabelle region, killing one person and injuring 5 others. The reason of the attack is not known.
Tags: Shabelle Media Network (Mogadishu) Violence against civilians

NOTES: One soldier is dead and two others wounded when unidentified attackers hurled a pair of grenades at their location near an Afgooye orphanage.
Tags: Universal TV  Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Unidentified attackers hurled simultaneously two hand grenade against SNG police based in the former Orphanage centre in Hawo Tako neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the evening of 10/01. The perpetrators escaped. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Two groups of SNG forces clashed in Bardheere police station in the afternoon of 10/01. The clash reportedly lasted for several hours. Reports indicate that the fighting was triggered following the murder of a former al Shabaab defector on 06/01 who was part of SNG forces in Bardheere. A soldier was killed during the fighting while unspecified number of soldiers were injured as well as a civilian.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Gunmen from Warsangeli/Reer Haji sub-clan open fire against a convoy of five lorries transporting goods from Bossaso to Ceerigaabo and Ceel-Afwayn in the vicinity of Bali Busle village (145km S of Laas-Qoray) in the night of 10/01. The attackers exchanged fire with gunmen onboard of the lorries. Reports indicate that the attacked vehicles three belongs to Habar-Jeclo while the other two belongs Warsangeli and apparently the attackers were targeting vehicles of Habar-Jeclo in a revenge for a boat belonging to the attackers sub-clan seized by Somaliland coastal guards after the forces rescued some illegal Ethiopian immigrants. Following the shootout a civilian bystander from the attacker's sub-clan was injured and later succumbed to his injuries. At the time of reporting all the five vehicles were being held in Bali Busle pending investigation of who killed the deceased man while the victim of the relatives refused to bury the body until the real perpetrator is identified.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against SNG position in Carbiska (5km E of Afgooye) on 10/01. No reported causalities.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Al Shabaab attacks the car of an army colonel in Shibis on 10/01, killing him. The explosive was detonated remotely.

Suspected magnetic IED planted in a car detonated in Manaboliyo Junction (Shibis District) in the morning of10/01. A government official was killed while another one was injured. No one has claimed the responsibility for the attack.

An IED targeted a vehicle belonging to a businessman and well-known farmer in Hawo Tako neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the afternoon of 11/01. The businessman was killed while two other people were injured in the explosion.
Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a prominent businessman in Afgooye on 11/01.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed the principal of Al-Cayn secondary school and a lecturer of Ganane University (Sh. Mohamed Cadow Hilowle) from Rahanweyn/Geledle sub-clan and inured two of his children in Baidoa in the night of 11/01. The motive behind the killing us currently unclear. Reports indicate that the victim previously used to support al Shabaab fighters.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against SNG forces Rimaygacmeed (6km SW of Afgooye) on 11/01. No causalities reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Hundreds of people held a demonstration in Warta Nabadda (Wardhiigleey) district, Banaadir region [Mogadishu], in support of peace in Mogadishu and the elimination of Al Shabaab. They carried placards stating their feelings.
Suspected al Shabaab fighters attacked SNG forces based in Danow village (16km NW of Marka) on 12/01.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Garowe local government supported by police officers demolished illegally constructed small kiosks along Sodanka road on 12/01. A group of kiosk owners tried to stop the operation and in the process a kiosk owner from Issa Mohamud stabbed and injured a local municipal officer from Majerteen/Biciidyahan. The police arrested seven people including the perpetrator who stabbed the officer.

A large number of Somaliland troops were reportedly deployed in Bali-Hadhac (62km NE of Buuhoodle) on 13/01. The motive behind the fresh deployment is currently unclear however, some reports suggest that the deployment is due to political tensions in the region and the mobilization of forming new regional state comprises of Dhulbahante and Warsangeli lands. The forces were reportedly dispatched to prevent Khatumo president of holding any meetings in Buuhoodle district. Further reports suggest that the forces proceed to Bali Cad village (51km SE of Buuhoodle) along Somalia Ethiopia border and later takeover of the village in the morning of 14/01. The village is current Khatumo headquarter, however no armed clash was reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Non-violent transfer of territory

NOTES: A group of youth gangs armed with clubs reportedly assaulted and looted hawkers of Ethiopian nationals in Tuurta neighbourhood (Burco) on 13/01 for allegedly relating the Ethiopian nationals to a recent incident where a man from Ethiopia was accused of being a man-eater after he allegedly killed a young girl near Burco. Elders intervened and stopped the youth gangs from robbing the vendors.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters reportedly abducted another al Shabaab fighter in the vicinity of Idale village (56km SW of Baidoa) in the morning of 13/01 while heading towards Baidoa. Reports indicate that the al Shabaab fighters suspected the member of being spy for SNG forces.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
