NOTES: AMISOM/KDF contingent attacked using artillery and mortar fire against a group of al Shabaab fighters spotted near Bula Gaduud Village (30km NE of Kismaayo) in the evening of 13/01.The attack lasted for about three hours and no casualties were reported from al Shabaab side so far.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attacked against AMISOM/KDF contingent base in Kolbiyow Village (38km SW of Badhaadhe) in the evening of 13/01.The clash lasted for about 15 minutes and both sides used light weapons before the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Iranian aid agency was looted in Mogadishu by some locals on 13/01 after Somalia cut its diplomatic relations with Iran.

A RCIED planted on a road side exploded in front of a restaurant in Bardaale (55km NW of Baidoa) in the evening of 14/01. A SNG soldier and refugee returnee from Dadaab camp were killed while two other civilians were injured. Perpetrators not known.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked SNG forces based in Ceel-Shil village (3km SW of Ceel Buur) on 14/01. Reports indicate that al Shabaab fighters used rocket propelled grenades and heavy machine guns which lasted for several hours however, according to media reports the attackers were repulsed back. At least nine al Shabaab fighters and a SNG soldier were killed in the clash while unspecified numbers from both sides were injured. Conflicting report: Somali Memo reported al Shabaab took over the town.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters attacked SNG base in Cumar Beere (9km NW of Afgooye) on 14/01. No reported causalities. SNG forces vacated the village as result of the attack. It is not clear if al Shabaab took control of the village following the attack.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Two groups of SNG forces clashed in Ex-control Afgooye (Dharkenleey District) in the night of 14/01. The exact reason behind the cause of the clash is currently unclear, however there are two accounts; one of the version suggest that a group of SNG forces who were base at the residential house of one of the SNG military commanders Col. Hassan Mohamed clashed within themselves while the other version suggest that a group of SNG forces attacked a SNG military base in the area where the fighting lasted for several hours. Unspecified number of soldiers were killed while several other were injured.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Gunmen hailing from Dir briefly exchanged gunfire with armed men collecting stones at quarry site hailing from Habar Gidir/Sa'ad sub-clan in near Hiiraan one IDP camp in Galkacyo south on 14/01. A stray bullet reportedly killed a woman in the IDP camp.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A member of AMISOM kills a civilian in Golweyn for unknown reason.
Tags: Shabelle Media Network (Mogadishu) Violence against civilians

NOTES: Somali forces shoot and kill four members of al Shabaab during a security operation in Maxaas.
Tags: Radio Mogadishu  Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A gunman from Marehan shot and killed another man from the same clan in Cabud Waaq in the morning of 15/01. The motive is reportedly a dispute over land ownership. The perpetrator escaped and no arrest was reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters conducted a complex attack against AMISOM/KDF contingent base in Cell Cadde Village (50km SW of Garbahaarey) in the morning of 15/01. The early morning attack started with a vehicle loaded with explosive devices driven by a suicide bomber to open up the access gate while other al Shabaab fighters fought their way inside to the base. Initial information suggest that heavily armed al Shabaab fighters engaged fiercest fighting with Kenyan Defence Forces which lasted for several hours. Al Shabaab spokesman for military operation Sheikh Abdiaziz Abu-muscab, said that their fighters have captured the base and seized heavy military arsenal. According to media reports both pro-al Shabaab and independent news outlets said that Kenyan forces have suffered heavy casualties however exact numbers of casualties from both sides could not be established at the time of reporting. A month following the attack the number of Kenyan dead is believed to be between 180 - 200 (Associated Press).
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-Non-state actor overtakes territory

NOTES: An IED exploded destroying a motor-cycle and killing its driver on the airport road (18km NW of Jowhar) on 15/01. The target is not clear but is assumed to be targeting an AMISOM convoy frequently used the road, though not present at the time.
Al Shabaab sentenced two men to death and publicly executed them in a firing squad in Aw Dheegle Village (38km SW of Afgooye) on 16/01. The two men were accused of spying for SNG forces.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: A gunman from Jejeele shot and injured a civilian man hailing from Galjecel in Hawl-Wadaag neighbourhood (Beled Weyne) in the evening of 16/01. The victim was reportedly trespassing a private farm belonging to the perpetrator. Elders of both sub-clans are trying to defuse the situation.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Residents of Buuhoodle town staged anti-Somaliland rally on 16/01. The rally was aimed to express the locals' support to Khatumo forces following the takeover of Balli Cad Village by Somaliland forces. The protestors matched in the streets of the town chanting anti-Somaliland slogans. The rally was reportedly organized by the Khatumo administration led by its president. Key speakers at the rally called for attacks against Somaliland forces.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Al Shabaab attacked a group of Kenyan forces in Dhamase. Casualties of death and military equipment were reported on the Kenyan forces, specific numbers not known.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against SNG police on foot patrol on Jamhuriya Road in the evening of 16/01. No causalities reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: An IED targeted a KDF convoy passing in Likooley Village (96km SW of Beled Xawo) in the afternoon of 16/01. One vehicle was reportedly destroyed while villagers also reported the sound of heavy gun-fire. Casualties are unknown.

Armed militia from Galjeel opened fire at a private truck in Faranjibaley (approx. 5km W of Belet Weyn) and killed a man from Jejeele and injured another one. It is not clear if this incident is revenge for the shooting of a Galjeel man in a day earlier in Hawl-wadaag neighbourhood.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters raided a private house in Alwileh, Beled Xawo District (approx. 25km NW of Ceel Cadde), killing the owner of the house and allegedly four KDF soldiers who seek sanctuary in the house after the Ceel Cadde attack on 17/01. No other casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: KDF Military reportedly killed three civilians in a grazing area called Sanoe near Ceel Cadde (60km SW of Garbahaarey in the afternoon of 17/01. Reports indicate that KDF carried out security/search operation for its soldiers taken by al Shabaab fighters and reportedly killed three nomads herding their livestock.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Following a large scale attack and ultimate take-over of Ceel Cadde on 15/01, al Shabaab exits the city on 17/01. It is not clear if SNG or KDF forces have yet regained control of the town.

Unknown perpetrators shot and killed two SNG soldiers in Kuwait neighbourhood (Dharkenley District) in the night of 17/01. The motive is unknown and the perpetrators escaped. There are unconfirmed reports that the killers are members of a clan militia based in the area.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against a NISA security outpost in the livestock Market (Heliwa District) in the evening of 17/01. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A SNG soldier shot and killed a mini-bus driver in Siinka Dheer (14km SE of Afgooye) in the afternoon of 17/01. The motive behind the killing is reportedly a dispute over money extortion at a check point. No arrest was reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Unidentified helicopter shot and killed two herders near Xuliya Village (57km SE of Laas Qoray) on 17/01.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Reports indicate that an unknown warplane conducted air strikes against suspected al Shabaab position in Arabow village (47km NE of Bu'ale) in the afternoon of 18/01. Residents reports indicate that the targeted base was destroyed but no human casualties were reported.
Unidentified attackers shot and killed a Quranic teacher in the outskirts of Bulo Burte town in the morning of 18/01. The motive is currently unknown and the perpetrators escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Al Shabaab forces shot and killed four AMISOM-KDF forces found hiding in a house near Ceel Cadde. The soldiers had apparently been in hiding following the attack on the city on 15/01.
Tags: Shabelle Media Network  Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Kenya defence forces (KDF) warplanes conducted airstrikes against al Shabaab in the vicinity of Ceel Cadde (55km SW of Garbahaarey) in the morning of 18/01. Reports Indicate that the airstrikes reportedly caused civilians' casualties and displacement of population. Included among the al Shabaab dead was senior leader Maalim Janow, the leader of the Abu Zubeir brigade. Exact total figures not known.

More than a hundred people staged an anti-Somaliland demonstration in Ceel-Buh Village (116km E of Ceerigaabo) on 18/01. The demonstrators were chanting anti-Somaliland slogans over unfulfilled developmental pledges made by Somaliland government to Warsangeli-inhabited areas. Unconfirmed reports indicate that anti-Somaliland politicians lobbying for the formation of regional state for Dhulbahante and Warsangeli sub-clans in Sanaag Region were behind the rally.
Suspected al Shabaab fighters attacked an SNG forces position in Rimaygacmeed (6km SE of Afgooye) on 18/01. Attackers withdrew and no casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against NISA forces in the vicinity of Barakat Cemetery (Yaaqshiid District) in night of 18/01. The attackers withdrew and no casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: KDF forces reached Ceel Gadde again on 19/01 after the al Shabaab attack. KDF forces concentrated on search operation but no IEDs were discovered. Al Shabaab fighters left the town already two days before and no armed clash was either reported. Kenyan forces were able to overtake the town.
Tags: Local Source Project Non-violent transfer of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Kenyan fighter jets have launched airstrikes in Ceel Gaduud and Dabley [southwestern Somalia] parts of Somalia in pursuit of Al-Shabab militants who killed Kenya Defence Forces [KDF] soldiers on 15/01. Date of the strikes not known - sources dated 19/01. No reported causalities.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Kenyan fighter jets have launched airstrikes in Ceel Gaduud and Dabley [southwestern Somalia] parts of Somalia in pursuit of Al-Shabab militants who killed Kenya Defence Forces [KDF] soldiers on 15/01. Date of the strikes not known - sources dated 19/01. No reported causalities.

Two groups of ISWA forces clashed in Diinsoor in the afternoon of 19/01. The clash was triggered after Diinsoor DC and ISWA local commander exchanged undisclosed heated argument and then the DC hit the commander using his vehicle followed by shootout between their escorts. One of the body guards of the DC was injured during the exchange of gunfire while the DC's vehicle was burnt after it was hit by bullet at the fuel tank. Ethiopian forces intervened and separated the two sides.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An IED targeted AMISOM convoy on the road between Bulo Mareer and Gol-Weyn villages (28& 21km respectively) in the morning of 19/01 followed by an ambush from suspected al Shabaab fighters. AMISOM forces after a short brief of armed clash repulse the attackers. Casualties unknown.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Somaliland forces and Khatumo militia clashed in Kalabaydh Village (30km S of Laas Caanood) in the night of 19/01. The two sides used both light and heavy weapons during the clash which lasted for an hour after which the Khatumo forces withdrew. The attack was initiated by the Khatumo forces from Sahdheer (59km SW of Laas Caanood). Casualties could not be established.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters executed an elderly man accused of being a witch-doctor in Kurtunwaarey in the afternoon of 19/01.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG forces based in Mushaani village (14km NW of Marka) in the morning of 19/01. The attackers withdrew immediately and no casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Unidentified clan militia attack an al Shabaab location in Adan Yabaal, Middle Shabeelle, killing six.
Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against a SNGF defence post in Carbiska (5km SE of Afgooye) on 20/01. Attackers withdrew immediately and no casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Two men, first suspected to be members of Jubaland security forces were executed by firing squad east of Jilib town on 20/01. The men who hail from Ogaden sub clan were caught on their way towards Kenya boarder with no exact area mentioned. None of the Jubaland force commanders admitted that the killed men were among Jubaland forces.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters attacked an ENDF convoy near Lanta Garaski (approx. 15km N of Waajid on 20/01. Attackers fired small arms fire against the convoy and escaped. ENDF continued with their journey to Buurdhuxunle. No reported causalities.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Two people have been killed after Al-Shabaab fighters ambushed an African Union army convoy which later resulted in heavy fighting near the southern Somalia town of Buulo Mareer.
Tags: Somali Dhacdo Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A group of al Shabaab fighters launched a complex attack against Seafood and Beach View restaurants on 21/01. The attack began with a VBIED explosion at the entrance of the restaurants followed by around five attackers entering the restaurants from the beach side and firing at customers. Security guards from the restaurants engaged the al Shabaab fighters in a gun-fire exchange before NISA and Gaashaan forces arrived and took over the operation. Roughly an hour later, a second explosion (a suspected VBIED) happened outside of the restaurants but causing no casualties as the place was already cleared by NISA. Between 22:45 and 23:10, around six explosions of hand grenades were reported. Reports indicate that more than 25 people including a national UN staff and six attackers were killed and more than 50 others, including a national INGO staff were wounded.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A group of al Shabaab fighters launched a complex attack against Seafood and Beach View restaurants on 21/01. The attack began with a VBIED explosion at the entrance of the restaurants followed by around five attackers entering the restaurants from the beach side and firing at customers. Security guards from the restaurants engaged the al Shabaab fighters in a gun-fire exchange before NISA and Gaashaan forces arrived and took over the operation. Roughly an hour later, a second explosion (a suspected VBIED) happened outside of the restaurants but causing no casualties as the place was already cleared by NISA. Between 22:45 and 23:10, around six explosions of hand grenades were reported. Reports indicate that more than 25 people including a national UN staff and six attackers were killed and more than 50 others, including a national INGO staff were wounded.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Local militia from Xawadle sub-clan attacked an al Shabaab position in Mabaax Village (75km E of Bulo Burte) on 21/01. Reports indicate that AMISOM/SNG forces reached the village after the clash however is not known if they will remain in there. One militia and two al Shabaab fighters were killed in the clash.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Khatumo forces reportedly carried out hit-and-run attacks against Somaliland forces based in Bali Cad and Widhwidh Villages (49km N and 51km E of Buuhoodle) in the night of 22/01. The Somaliland forces reportedly responded with both light and weaponry fire during the clash which lasted for an hour after which the Khatumo forces withdrew. Casualties could not be established.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: KDF conducted an airstrike in Ceel Gaduud (48km SW of Garbarhaarey) on 22/01. Casualties were unable to confirm. The target of the strike was not articulated by the source.

Khatumo troops reportedly carried out hit-and-run attack against Somaliland forces based in Kalabaydh Village (30km S of Laas Caanood) in the night of 22/01. Somaliland forces reportedly responded with light and heavy weaponry fire during the clash which lasted for an hour after which the Khatumo forces withdrew. No causalities reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Locals reported that a missile hit a location outside Kananax Village (43km SE of Diinsor) on 22/01. It is not clear who and how the missile was fired as no noise of a plane was heard during the time. Casualties are unknown. The target of the shelling is not known, military or civilian.

Khatumo forces reportedly carried out hit-and-run attacks against Somaliland forces based in Bali Cad and Widhwidh Villages (49km N and 51km E of Buuhoodle) in the night of 22/01. The Somaliland forces reportedly responded with both light and weaponry fire during the clash which lasted for an hour after which the Khatumo forces withdrew. Casualties could not be established.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Residents of Buuhoodle town staged anti-Somaliland rally on 16/01. The rally was aimed to express the locals' support for Khatumo forces following the takeover of Balli Cad Village by Somaliland forces. The protestors matched in the streets of Buuhoodle chanting anti-Somaliland slogans and burned the Somaliland flag. The rally was reportedly organized by the Khatumo administration led by its President.

More than a hundred Rahanweyn traders staged a peaceful demonstration in Ceerigaabo on 23/01. This follows after governor of Sanaag Region gave Rahanwayn traders a seven-day ultimatum to leave Ceerigaabo. The demonstrators requested Somaliland president to intervene and give them enough time to prepare for their exit. Police dispersed the demonstrators. Reports six traders were arrested during the protest.
Unknown assailants shot and killed a SNGF soldier in Bundo Weyn in the evening of 24/01. The perpetrators managed to take his AK-47 and escaped from the scene.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNGF position in Carbiska (5km SE of Afgooye) in the evening of 24/01. There was a brief exchange of gun-fire before the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: KDF planes launched an airstrike against [al Shabaab locations] Daar Village (31km NW of Baardheere) on 24/01. Casualties are still unknown.

Two groups of SNG forces exchanged gun-fire in the vicinity of Ex-Control Afgooye (Dayniile Distrct) in the morning of 24/01. Reason behind the clash is said to be land dispute related between Habar-Gidir and Murusade. Both sides suffered casualties (numbers not known) while the situation is still tense.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A group of Ethiopian Oromo ethnic staged a peaceful demonstration in front of Somaliland ministry of Interior in Hargeisa on 24/01 in protest against new instructions issued by Somaliland government to deport Ethiopian national, mainly Oromos. The protestors requested from the government to reconsider the instructions and review the issue case by case while also asking for more time if the government fail to honour their request. Some protestors stated that they stayed in Somaliland over 40 years and owned assets. Police arrived at the scene and dispersed the demonstrators.

Two groups from SNG police and ISWA forces clashed near ISWA presidential palace (Baidoa) in the morning of 25/01. The clash was allegedly triggered after SNG local police commander ordered some of ISWA military personnel to be disarmed because of their absenteeism in the military barracks while the military officers ignored prompting shootout. Two soldiers were killed while another one was injured.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A group of people from southern Somalia staged a demonstration in front of the immigration office in Borama on 25/01. The group were protesting against the decision by the Somaliland government to expel all non-citizens. The protestors appealed to the government to reconsider its deportation decree. Police dispersed them and arrested five of them after they refused to leave the area.
Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a brief hit and run attack against NISA troops in Biyo Degaanka on 25/01. Attackers withdrew immediately and no casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Armed gunmen shot and killed a civilian man in the vicinity of Wajir neighbourhood (Marka) in the morning of 25/01. The motive is believed to be clan revenge. The victim hails from Biimaal clan.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters ambushed and attacked an ENDF convoy heading from Xudur to Tayeelow in Shiida Village (26km NE of Xudur) on 25/01. Attackers fired small arms and RPGs against the convoy but retreated immediately after ENDF/ISWA forces responded. No casualties were reported but one hut caught fire in the village after being hit by a round of RPG.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters destroyed a donkey cart heading to Burdhuxunle in Lanta Garaski (15km N of Wajiid) on 25/01. The owner was badly beaten and warned against transporting goods to ENDF/SNGF. At the time of the incidents, the donkey was not carrying goods.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces leave Baadhaade on 26/01; al Shabaab quickly fills the void.
Tags: Associated Press Non-violent transfer of territory

NOTES: Somaliland army pulled out of Bali Cad Village (51km E of Buuhoodle) and established temporary base in the areas of Bali Hadhac (62km NE of Buuhoodle) on 26/01 for an undisclosed reason. The forces were initially part of the troops that recently took over the control of the village from Khatumo administration.
Tags: Local Source Project Headquarters or base established

NOTES: A gunman from Dashiishe shot and injured another man from Issa Mohamud in Tuurjaale neighbourhood (Bossaso) in the evening of 26/01. Reports indicate that the shooting followed after the perpetrator and the victim had physically assaulted each other for undisclosed reasons. The perpetrator escaped while the victim was taken to hospital.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: A gunman hailing from Habar-Yunis/Ali Saciid sub-clan shot and killed a SPU officer in Burco in the afternoon of 26/01. The incident happened after a group of police officers including the victim went to stop a construction of a disputed plot of land. The perpetrator who claims the ownership of the disputed land was later arrested by the police.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighter ambushed a KDF convoy, travelling from Ceel Cadde to Likooley on 26/01. The attack was opened with an IED explosion and followed by an exchange of gun-fire. Unconfirmed reports indicate that two KDF vehicles were destroyed and the District Commissioner of Ceel Cadde, travelling with the convoy was seriously injured. Further reports indicate that the KDF convoy had to remain at the targeted place and did not arrive in Dhamase as expected.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Reports indicate that KDF troops withdrew from Ceel-Cadde Village (55km SW of Garbarhaarey) shortly after mid night on 26/01. Al Shabaab fighters took over the control of the town without any clash. The motive behind the withdrawal of KDF military is no clearly known, but thought to be military strategy.
Tags: Local Source Project Non-violent transfer of territory

NOTES: Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a businessman in the medical section of Bakaara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the afternoon of 26/01. The motive behind the killing is unknown and the perpetrators escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against AMISOM (Burundians) base inside Kabka compound (Hodan District) in the evening of 26/01. The AMISOM forces responded with gunfire after the attack. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against SNG forces on foot patrol near Biyo Degeenka (Hodan District) in the night of 26/01. No causalities.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: KDF helicopters bombed a grazing area approximately 20km NE of Hoosingow (Badhaadhe District) in the afternoon of 26/01. The area is inhabited by pastoralists and casualties are unknown. The specific target of the KDF is not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a KDF convoy near Likooley (95km SW of Belet Xawo) on 26/01. The ambush reportedly started with an IED explosion before the attackers moved in. No reported casualties.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: SNG forces conducted a security operation in Safarnooleys Village (51km SE of Luuq) on 26/01. The forces captured a suspected al Shabaab fighter and beheaded him. No other casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Kenyan forces kill an al Shabaab "commissioner" in the Likooleey area of Ceel Cadde. The commissioner may have been in the custody of the Kenyan military at the time of this death.
Tags: Shabelle Media Network Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Gunmen reportedly hailing from Dhulbahante shot and killed a driver of a vehicle transporting khat in the outskirts of Hoosingo (97km NW of Badhaadhe) in the morning of 27/01. The victim hail from Sheekhal clan and the incident was reportedly related to previous revenge killings.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Jubaland intelligence forces shot and injured a poet from Darood/Ogaden sub-clan in Aargo - Fanoole Neighbourhood of Kismaayo in the morning of 27/01. The man was reportedly shot after ignoring a stop order form the forces during an ongoing security operation. He was hospitalized locally and later medevaced to Mogadishu.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: An IED hit a KDF convoy in Kolbiyow (33km SW of Badhaadhe) in the morning of 27/01. Initial reports indicate that one KDF was killed and nine others wounded while one APC was damaged. Helicopters from Kismaayo are said to have flown to the area to medevac the injured soldiers to Dhobley.

Local residents of Maydh (50km N of Ceerigaabo) held a peaceful demonstration on 27/01 in protest against the director of health in the region from Warsangeli. The protestors accused the director of diverting all health facilities to eastern Sanaag where his clan dominates and they called government to intervene the matter.

A magnetic IED attached to a vehicle exploded in the vicinity of Mogadishu Cinema (Wadajir/Medina District) in the afternoon of 27/01. The vehicle belonged to one of the military officers who was not in the car when the incident happened. Two civilian bystanders were slightly injured in the blast.
An anti-al Shabaab protest is held in Abdul-Aziz 28/01. The protest was a direct response to an attack on a Liido beach restaurant.

A group of al Shabaab fighters ambushed a SNG soldier in the vicinity of Abiikarow (13km NW of Marka) in the morning of 28/01. The soldier and another civilian man were driving a motorbike when the incident happened. The SNG soldier was killed and the civilian was injured in the ambush.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: AMISOM/KDF reportedly withdrew from their base in Bula Gudud (32km NE of Kismaayo) in the afternoon of 28/01. Reports indicate that the KDF forces moved to Kismaayo and so far this is the third base Kenya forces vacated. Further reports indicate that al Shabaab fighters immediately moved in to the village.
Tags: Local Source Project Non-violent transfer of territory

NOTES: Dir clan militias attacked Xawadle forces in Deefow (29km NW of Belet Weyn) on 28/01. At least 1 Xawadle militiaman was killed and another one was injured. Casualties from Dir side are unknown. Both militias were concentrating in the vicinity of Deefoow and tensions remained high. Lieu police is also at the scene.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a custodial officer in the vicinity of Dabakaya Madow neighbourhood (Dharkenleey District) in the morning of 28/01. The victim was reportedly on his way to work when the incident happened. The perpetrators escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Garowe residents staged a peaceful demonstration against 4.5 formula in Barhada square in the morning of 28/01.

Jubaland intelligence force shot and injured a man from Darood/Marehan at Somalistar (Calanley neighbourhood) in Kismaayo on 28/01. The man was reportedly holding a black plastic pistol, and tried to run away after he saw the approaching forces. A stray bullet fired during the incident reportedly killed an intelligence officer (Darood/Ogaden) and injured a female civilian (Darood/Marehan).
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab gunmen attacked and injured a judge in Baardheere on the evening of 29/01.

A peaceful demonstration supporting the 4.5 formula for allocation of parliamentary seats took place in Baidoa town in the morning of 29/01. The demonstration was organized by the local administration.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against the residence of Baraawe DC in Baraawe town in 29/01. No casualties were reported. Perpetrators escaped.

National Intelligence and Security Agency (NISA) conducted a security operation targeting al Shabaab operatives in Ceelasha (12km SE of Afgooye) in the morning of 29/01. NISA captured unspecified number of al Shabaab fighters and seized weapons. One NISA soldier and one al Shabaab combatant were killed during a shootout, while the operation was ongoing.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A large number of people staged a peaceful demonstration in front of the mayor office's in Eyl on 29/04 in support of Puntland President's decision to oppose 4.5 formula. The mayor addressed the rally.

A SNG soldier opened gunfire against a group of civilians in the vicinity of Via Ejito (Hamar Weyne area) on 30/01 for unknown reasons. The perpetrators escaped. Three civilians were injured in the shooting.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

ALLY_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A joint SNG/AMISOM operation yields 50 al Shabaab arrests in Jowhar.

Clan militias hailing from Majerteen/Wabeeneeye sub-clan and Warsangali/Dubeys sub-clan clashed in vicinity of Qaw village (16km W of Bosasso) on the afternoon of 30/01. The confrontation was linked to a land dispute and it lasted for about one hour. Casualties are unknown. Governor of Bari region and the regional police commissioner, supported by 10 technicals, reached the area to prevent further clashes. The situation remains tense.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Al Shabaab clashes with AMISOM Kenyan forces in Baardheere. A "number" of Kenyan soldiers are said to have been killed and wounded in the ambush.
Tags: Somali Memo  Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: SNFG soldiers, with strong support of AMISOM-KDF, conducted a large-scale house to house security operation in Baardheere town in the morning of 31/01. Reports indicate that about 100 suspects were arrested during the operation. The security operation followed the assassination attempt on Baardheere court judge.

A group of women and children from Daray Macaane staged a peaceful demonstration complaining about the piles of garbage which had been dumped in the area. The piles from the town had been dumped thus affecting the Hygienic situation of the area and caused many diseases to the area inhabitants. The police came to the scene and dispersed the gathering, there is no arrests or casualties reported.

A number of Renting Vehicle owners demonstrated in front of the governor's office venue complaining about the National Electoral Commission (NEC) renting regulation. Those drivers accusing the NEC of making the regulation difficult for those drivers to work in the NEC Registration Campaign. The NEC has made a condition for the renting vehicles in which new models for Land Cruisers 4X4 and should be in good condition and verified from a certain Garage which became a difficult to majority renting vehicle owners in the town.

Youth hailing form Habar Yonis and Habar Jeclo sub-clans fought in Barwaaqo neighbourhood (Ceerigaabo) on 31/01 following a dispute at a wedding ceremony. Ceerigaabo police intervened, shot in the air, and arrested 4 people from both sides.

Local taxi drivers staged a large demonstration in front of the local municipality and on the main Garowe tarmac road, halting businesses and traffic movements in Garowe in the morning of 31/01. The protest was a response to governments decision to ban local taxis from carrying khat sellers. The ban followed suspicions that alcohol is being smuggled together with khat. Unspecified number of protestors were arrested.

Garowe central jail forces demonstrated over unpaid salaried and denied access to officials who tried to enter the jail on 31/01. The protesting forces stated that the protest will continue until the dispute is resolved. The central jail was built by UNODC for pirates during presidency of Abdirahman Farole.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a KDF reconnaissance unit near Taraka village (approx. 47kms E of Baardheere) in the afternoon of 31/01. The KDF forces were assessing the road between Faafax Dhuun (approx. 26kms E of Taraka) and Taraka at the time of the attack. Casualties are unknown. Following the attack, KDF forces shelled Jungal (approx. 23kms E of Baardheere) and Taraka. The two incidents of shelling were locally perceived as indiscriminate. No reports about casualties of the shelling are currently available.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a KDF reconnaissance unit near Taraka village (approx. 47kms E of Baardheere) in the afternoon of 31/01. The KDF forces were assessing the road between Faafax Dhuun (approx. 26kms E of Taraka) and Taraka at the time of the attack. Casualties are unknown. Following the attack, KDF forces shelled Jungal (approx. 23kms E of Baardheere) and Taraka. The two incidents of shelling were locally perceived as indiscriminate. No reports about casualties of the shelling are currently available.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Khatumo forces launch attack against Somaliland forces in Widhwidh Village (49km N of Buuhoodle) on 31/01. No causalities reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Street protests turned violent after security forces tried to break up anti-government match in Bosasso town on 01/02. Puntland soldiers fired into the air with volleys of gunfire being heard across the city. The protesters were taking to streets in support of detained Youth leader identified as Abdiasis Farah Haji Saed. Two deaths reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in Ceelasha locality (12km SE of Afgooye) in the evening of 01/02. The victim used to be a broker and the motive behind his killing is so far unknown. Perpetrators escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: About five mortar rounds landed in the northern residential side of Villa Somalia in the morning of 01/02. A child was killed and seven other civilians were injured. It is unclear who fired the mortars.

NISA personnel manning a legal checkpoint near KM4 opened gunfire at armed an armed escort along the airport road in the early morning of 01/02. The NISA reportedly opened the fire after the armed guards refused to stop at the checkpoint. NISA temporarily detained the guards for interrogation.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Khatumo forces carried out a hit-and-run attack against Somaliland troops in vicinity in the vicinity of Xudun in the evening of 01/02. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Kenyan forces vacate Sarinleey base in Baardheere and are replaced by Ethiopian soldiers, reasons unclear.
Tags: Local Source Project Non-violent transfer of territory

NOTES: An ISWA soldier was shot dead after he opened fire in the main Baidoa police station shooting a police officer on 02/02. The circumstances are still unclear but reports indicate that the ISWA soldier had complaints about the arrest over a civilian and that led to the dispute.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: An unidentified gunman shot and killed a prominent businessman from Majerten/Omar Mohamud sub-clan in Bosasso in the evening of 02/02. The motive of the incident is yet to be established and the perpetrator escaped from the scene.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: A gun man from Majeerteen/Isse Mohamud shot and killed another man from Majeerteen/Ali-jibrahil in the noon of 02/02 on Garowe, reasons unclear.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: An under vehicle IED exploded in Xamar Jabjab district in the early evening of 02/02. The vehicle belonged to the head of an LNGO, who, alerted by a by-stander, had moved away from the car when the blast happened. Despite the magnitude of the explosion, which was heard 2Km away, nobody resulted injured. The car owner was, at the time of the incident, accompanied by his brother, an INGO staffer. However, initial investigations suggest that none of them might have been the target, but rather a third person: the newly appointed Chief Accountant of the Sea Port, who happens to rent an apartment in the same building as the victim, and has the exact same vehicle.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and seriously injured a civilian man in the vicinity of Hormuud Telecom at Bakara market in the afternoon of 02/02. The victim used to work for Hormuud Telecom and the reason behind his attack is currently unknown. Perpetrators escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Khatumo forces carried out a hit-and-run attack against Somaliland troops in Waqdariya army base near Laas Caanood in the evening of 02/02. Somaliland forces reportedly responded with light and heavy weaponry fire during the clash which lasted for an hour after which the Khatumo forces withdrew. A Somaliland soldier reportedly sustained minor injuries.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A suicide-style bomb is detonated on a passenger Airbus 321 shortly after takeoff (at 11,000 feet) from Mogadishu. One death reported (the bomber), and the aircraft landed safely. The bomber may have been ridden a wheel-chair as an effort to conceal the explosive. In the week that followed al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack, stating the target of the attack was senior western officials. A passenger believed to be the bomber was killed, probably after being propelled out of the aircraft in the explosion, investigators said. Several other injuries reported. Twenty arrests were later arrested in connection with the attack.
Tags: Agence France Presse  Violence against civilians

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Al Shabaab attacks and kills an unspecified number of Kenyan forces in Taraka.
Tags: Radio Andalus Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: AMISOM/KDF forces vacated Khadijio Hagi (Bulo Haji) Village (34km SW of Belet Xaawo) in the night of 03/02. Some of the residents left with KDF in fear of al Shabaab, who immediately took over control of the town. Reports indicate that al Shabaab fighters called the locals at a public gathering, threatening that they know those who used to collaborate with KDF/SNGF and will punish them. KDF moved to Hareri Holse in Arabiya near the border on the Kenyan side.
Tags: Local Source Project Non-violent transfer of territory

NOTES: A group of SNA personnel ambushed an al Shabaab minibus near Cali Fool Dheere Village (21km NE of Jowhar) in the afternoon of 03/02. Both sides engaged in a serious exchange of gunfire after which the al Shabaab fighters were defeated. The al Shabaab mini-bus came from Cali Fool Dheere Village where they were collecting tax due to the weekly market day and heading towards Ceel-Baraf when the incident happened. Eight al Shabaab fighters were killed in the attack.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces base in Ceelasha settlement (12km SE of Afgooye) in the night of 02/03. No Casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at a police officer who was in a crowd of civilians in the vicinity of Radarka (Dayniile District) in the night of 03/02. The police officer and three civilians were reportedly injured in the attack. The attackers escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed AMISOM troops on foot patrol near Gol-Weyn Village (22km SW of Marka) in the morning of 03/02. Both sides exchanged gunfire before the al Shabaab fighters retreated. Pro-al Shabaab website claimed that six Ugandans were killed in that attack.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces in Goof-Gaduud (Burey Haraw area) (29km NW of Baidoa) on 03/02. The fighting lasted for several hours and SNG military officer told the media that they have overpowered the attackers. Causalities could not be established.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a civilian man on 03/02. The motive is believed to be a clan revenge. The victim hails from Habar Gidir. The tension is relatively high in Marka and gunfire could be heard in the town following the shooting.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Many people continued to protest against the manager of the Customs Office for the second day running in Zaylac on 03/02 over the construction of a concrete wall which extended from the customs office to the main entrance of the Zaylac Fishermen Association building. The protests continued after police refused to release five fishermen who were arrested in early demonstrations on 02/02. The protests turned violent after the protestors burnt tyres. Police shot in the air to disperse the crowd and arrested seven people.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Al Shabaab ambushed AMISOM-KDF contingent with three RCIED explosions in a sequence and fired with small guns at Jeldesa area of Tabta Village neighbourhood (aaprox 55 KM SW of Afmadow town) on 03/02 afternoon. No human casualties reported and no property damaged, the explosions missed the target according to reports from the residents and travellers who got caught up in the ambush.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Kenyan forces exit Khadijo Hagi village, al Shabaab quickly enters the village. No violence reported.
Tags: Somali Memo  Non-violent transfer of territory

NOTES: Heavy clashes between Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers and Al-Shabaab embarked in Ali Foldhere locality near the southern town of Mahaday in middle Shabeelle region. An unspecified number of dead reported.
Tags: Shabelle Media Network  Battle-No change of territory

ALLY_ACTOR_2: Mutiny of Military Forces of Somalia (2012-)
NOTES: An ISWA soldier defected with his AK-47 rifle to al Shabaab fighters in Aliyow Doyoow Village (31km SE of Baidoa) in the night of 05/02. Al Shabaab fighters reportedly gave him money amounting to $150 in exchange for his gun. The soldier was later beheaded in his house by unidentified assailants.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: An IED targeting a SNA convoy in Ceel Wariir (Ceel Xarar)(approx. 20km NE of Jowhar) in the morning of 05/02. The explosion hit and damaged one of the SNA vehicles. Three soldiers were killed by the blast and five others were injured.

Two groups of farmers hailing from two sub-clans of Gadabuursi fought using sticks and stones in Geerisa over a dispute of a pasture land on 05/02. Local elders intervened and managed to separate the two sides, no casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against SNG forces outpost near the Livestock Market (Heliwa District) in the night of 05/02. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers retreated. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: AMISOM/Uganda has vacated Marka Town. This move comes after SNGF left the town yesterday evening. Residents report that al Shabaab is in the sea port and also in other Government buildings, and leading Friday prayers in the mosques. The motive of the move of AMISOM is unclear at this stage.
Tags: Local Source Project Non-violent transfer of territory

NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab targets an airport security official with an IED. The security official was not harmed, though three others died in the blast.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF faced an ambush at Yoontoy Yarey Village neighbourhood (25KM NE of Kismaayo) which turned into a heavy clash that lasted for 2hrs, both sides used heavy machine guns, mortars and artillery then al Shabaab withdrew. No human casualties or property damaged as residents report.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a SNA convoy in the vicinity of Buufow Bacaad in the morning of 06/02. The attackers managed to seize a military vehicle and destroyed another one. Four SNA soldiers were reportedly killed in the fighting. Casualties on al Shabaab side could not be established.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Students from Farah Omar secondary school staged a peaceful demonstration on the road from Radio Hargeisa to the Ministry of Education in 26 June District (Hargeisa) in the morning of 06/02 in protest against an order from the Ministry of Education of allegedly transferring best teachers in the school to other schools according to the students claims.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM and Biyamal attack al Shabaab location in Marka a day following the sect gaining control of the city. Causalities not known, though the clash caused a large displacement of the area population.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Local clan militias clashed with Somaliland police in Qarasgoy Mountain near Sheikh town on 06/02 following dispute over land ownership. The clash followed after the government granted the disputed land to a foreign investor from Kuwait to develop a solar plant station to supply electricity to Sheikh and surrounding villages. The fighting was initiated by the local gunmen who claimed the ownership of the land. A Somaliland police officer was slightly injured. The police arrested three gunmen while the rest managed to escape.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Unidentified attackers shot and killed an intelligence officer, head of Dharkenleey District Intelligence along with two of his guards in drive-by shooting in the vicinity of Siliga (Wadajir District) in the afternoon of 06/02. The perpetrators escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in the vicinity of Ali-Kamiin (Wardhiigley District) in the afternoon of 06/02. The motive behind the killing is unknown. The perpetrators escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters took control of Weel Cade Village (Approx. 135km NW of Badhaadhe) in the morning of 07/02. Following the takeover the fighters reportedly ordered local residents to vacate some part of the village saying that its strategic point for the Mujahidin. Reports indicate that pro-Jubaland local clan militias manning a checkpoint at the village escaped before the al Shabaab arrival. Further reports in the morning of 08/02 indicate that the local population deserted the village.
Tags: Local Source Project Non-violent transfer of territory

NOTES: An IED attached to a vehicle belonging to the deputy DC for Bardheere district detonated in Bardheere in the morning of 07/02. The victim was former ASWJ spokesperson and he sustained slight injuries.
Al Shabaab fighters were reportedly spotted setting up two different bases around Ballidhidin Village (87km S of Qandala) on 07/02.
Tags: Local Source Project Headquarters or base established

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM base in Danow (Marka District) in the night of 07/02. Casualties are unknown.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Two groups of SNG forces clashed in the vicinity of Hanta Dheer neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the morning of 07/02. The motive behind the intra-clash is believed to be over a land dispute. The fighting groups hail from Murusade and Habar-Gidir. Three soldiers were reportedly killed in the clash and seven others were injured.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Two groups of gunmen from Dhulbahante and Habar-Jeclo reportedly exchanged gunfire in Qocondhaale near Horufadhi Village (39km N of Buuhoodle) on 07/02. The motive behind the shooting remains unknown but is believed to be related to previous dispute between the two clans. After brief shootout the two groups reportedly retreated from the incident scene. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters beheaded a civilian man from Rahanweyn/Laysaan sub-clan in Kashiidow Village (42km NW of Baidoa) in the morning of 07/02. Reports indicate that the victim (a driver) was beheaded in his house after he allegedly refused to come out. The motive behind the killing is currently unclear.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

ALLY_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: SNG/AMISOM forces jointly conducted security operations in Xamar Jab Jab and Waaberi districts in the morning of 07/02. About 500 suspects were arrested during the operations. Reports indicate that the forces arrested people from the roads, residential houses and even some were picked from public buses. The arrested targets are not known.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against a crowd of people in Qoryooley town in the evening of 07/02. A man was confirmed dead and six others were injured in the blast. The perpetrators escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: More than hundred people staged a demonstration in front of Sheikh police station on 07/02 in protest against the arrest of a group of elders by Somaliland authority. The arrest of elders followed after local clan militias clashed with Somaliland police in the previous day in Qarasgoy mountain over a land dispute and the government is trying to put pressure on the elders to surrender the escaped gunmen. Reports indicate that an ongoing construction belonging to a Kuwaiti foreign investor has been suspended following the armed clash, arrest of elders and subsequent demonstration. The rally ended peacefully.

Khatumo forces carried out a hit-and-run attack against Somaliland forces in Widhwidh (49km N of Buuhoodle) in the evening of 07/02. The Somaliland forces reportedly responded with light and heavy artillery during the clash which lasted for about an hour after which the Khatumo forces withdrew. A Somaliland soldier reportedly sustained minor injuries.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A group of Dhulbahante militias loyal to Somaliland Minister of Health opened fire and stormed the office of a local journalist working for Somali Channel TV in Buuhoodle on 08/02 over resignation reports of a pro-Somaliland soldier. The incident comes after the reporter broadcasted a press conference in which the soldier, who was one of the local commanders of Dhulbahante militia loyal to the Somaliland Minister of Health stated to have resigned from his position. The militia destroyed some of the equipment in the office while confiscating others. It is not clear if any civilians were present at the time of the facility's attack.
Dhulbahante militias clash with Somaliland forces following an attack by the former on a radio station earlier in the day. Causalities not reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: An unspecified number of troops loyal to Khatumo administration took over the control of Buurowadal Village (90km E of Laas Caanood) on 08/02. The motive behind the takeover is currently unclear however, reports indicate that it is due to a new strategy in which Khatumo wants to mobilize Dhulbahante local and expand its control in Sool region.
Tags: Local Source Project Non-violent transfer of territory

NOTES: A RCIED was targeted against SNA vehicle near Danow Village (16km NW of Marka) in the morning of 08/02. The vehicle was heading to Qoryooley when the incident happened. One soldier was reportedly injured in the blast. Perpetrators not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Suspected Kenyan warplanes conducted airstrikes against al Shabaab bases near Golaa and Naxariis villages (18km and 30km NE of Bu'ale) as well as Sokela Village (48km E of Bu'ale) in the afternoon of 08/02. The exact number of casualties are unknown but local residents have reported to have seen dead bodies of two farmers believed to have been killed by stray bullets from one of the targeted al Shabaab bases - later reports (Associated Press) confirm that an al Shabaab commander (Abdirahim Mohamed Warsame) and 10 others were killed in the strike. They also confirmed a thick smoke hovering over the targeted bases. Al Shabaab warned residents not to visit the area and the villages along the eastern and the southern sides of the River Juba.

Two clan militias from two Habar Jeclo/Ahmed Farax sub-clans (Cali Muse & Ba Cawrala) exchanged gunfire in Huluul Village (57km W of Ceel-Afweyn) on 08/02 following a dispute over the selection of a new prominent elder to be the chief elder for both sub-clans. Each sub-clan wanted the new elder to be selected among their sub-clan. Ceel-Afweyn police forces conducted security operations and arrested the two men who were leading the militias and transferred them to Ceel-Afweyn for further investigations. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Suspected Kenyan warplanes conducted airstrikes against al Shabaab bases near Golaa and Naxariis villages (18km and 30km NE of Bu'ale) as well as Sokela Village'(48km E of Bu'ale) in the afternoon of 08/02. The exact number of casualties are unknown but local residents have reported to have seen dead bodies of two farmers believed to have been killed by stray bullets from one of the targeted al Shabaab bases. They also confirmed a thick smoke hovering over the targeted bases. Al Shabaab warned residents not to visit the area and the villages along the eastern and the southern sides of the River Juba.

Heavily armed SNA forces entered and took over the control of Marka town in the morning of 08/02 without any resistance from al Shabaab fighters. Al Shabaab fighters reportedly pulled out of the town prior the arrival of the Somali Military. The SNA forces settled all the strategic positions of the town.
Tags: Local Source Project Non-violent transfer of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Suspected Kenyan warplanes conducted airstrikes against al Shabaab bases near Golaa and Naxariis villages (18km and 30km NE of Bu'ale) as well as Sokela Village'(48km E of Bu'ale) in the afternoon of 08/02. The exact number of casualties are unknown but local residents have reported to have seen dead bodies of two farmers believed to have been killed by stray bullets from one of the targeted al Shabaab bases. They also confirmed a thick smoke hovering over the targeted bases. Al Shabaab warned residents not to visit the area and the villages along the eastern and the southern sides of the River Juba. Later reports (Daily Nation) indicate 53 members of al Shabaab, including a top commander were killed in the strike.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM base in Qoryooley on 08/02. The fighting lasted for a few minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Two ISWA soldiers exchanged gunfire in Baidoa in the afternoon of 09/02 over unknown reasons. A stray bullet hit and injured a civilian man.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Suspected Kenyan warplanes conducted airstrike against al Shabaab base at Berhani Village (approx. 45km NW of Kismaayo) in the morning of 09/02. The warplanes carried out repeated airstrikes against the same point. Reports indicate that there was unspecified numbers of casualties including death and injuries from al Shabaab side. Further reports indicate one of the warplanes "a helicopter" landed briefly at the targeted area but it is not clear what they picked from the scene.

Militiamen loyal to Somaliland Minister of Health and Khatumo forces clashed near Abdi Guray Plaza Hotel in Buuhoodle in the night of 09/02. The clash was reportedly triggered by an earlier ambush against Somaliland minister of health by Khatumo forces. Both sides reportedly used light and heavy weapons during the clash which lasted for several hours after which the pro-Somaliland militias withdrew. Khatumo forces reportedly suffered unspecified numbers of injuries. Latest reports suggest that tensions flared up between pro-Somaliland and pro-Khatumo and both sides are mobilizing their respective militias.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against a group of SNG soldiers at a checkpoint in Cumar-Beere (9km NW of Afgooye) in the evening of 09/02. The al Shabaab fighters reportedly took over the checkpoint. Casualties are unknown.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-Non-state actor overtakes territory

NOTES: A group of students and teachers in Dila town staged a peaceful demonstration on 09/02 in protest against poor education facilities in the town. Police arrived at the scene, dispersed the protestors and arrested three people after they allegedly refused to leave the scene.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Kenyan air forces launch air strikes on al Shabaab locations on Berhani village. Any causalities have yet to be established. Strikes were also launched in Jubbada Hoose, near Kismayo.

An IED targeted a pick-up truck used by new police recruits on the road that links the unpaved road from the police training base to the tarmac road near Kismaayo Airport (Kismaayo) in the morning of 09/02. The vehicle was damaged by the explosion but there were no casualties.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against a group of SNA personnel in the vicinity of Beyturaas neighbourhood (Marka) in the morning of 09/02. Another hand grenade was also thrown against SNA soldiers on foot patrol in Ruusiya neighbourhood in the same morning. No casualties were reported and the perpetrators escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces based in Qoryooley town fired mortar rounds and heavy artilleries against al Shabaab hideouts in the vicinity of Camp II (approx. 10km NW of Qoryooley) in the afternoon of 09/02. Reports indicate that the shelling also affected civilian population in the area. Two civilians were confirmed dead in the attack while livestock and other properties were also damaged.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States
NOTES: A US drone targets three al Shabaab locations, Dhiig Beerta, Keli Liibaan and Dharshiinley all near Qoryooley on 09/02. The head of social affairs of the Lower Shabeelle regional administration, said alShabaab suffered casualties in the airstrikes, specific numbers known.
Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack at SNG forces outpost in the outskirts of Afgooye in the night of 10/02. Casualties are unknown.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Residents confirmed that two civilians were killed and five others were injured in Baardheere Khat Market in the morning of 10/02 after fighting erupted between two groups of SNG forces. The fight flared up after a group of government soldiers tried to disarm several soldiers who instead opened gunfire in the market area. Victims were rushed to hospital to receive medical treatment. No arrests were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: At least one person was killed and two others sustained wounds in a clash between troops in the federal government of Somalia in Bardera city on 10/02.
Tags: Shabelle Media Network (Mogadishu) Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: SNG forces based in Kamoor Village (25km NE of Belet Xaawo) vacated their base and moved back to Belet Xaawo on 10/02. Al Shabaab fighters reportedly have take over the control of the village. No reports of armed clash.
Tags: Local Source Project Non-violent transfer of territory

NOTES: Local residents staged anti-Somaliland rally and expressed support for Khatumo administration in Buuhoodle on 10/02. The rally comes a day after militias loyal to Somaliland Minister of Health attacked guards of Khatumo president in the town. The protestors marched in the streets of the town chanting anti-Somaliland slogans. The rally is believed to be organized by the Khatumo administration led by its president.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters beheaded a local cleric in Jameeco Mubaarak Village (21km SE of Bulo Burte) in the night of 10/02. The victim was sleeping in his house when the perpetrators came and picked him and later executed him outside. Reports also indicate that suspected al Shabaab fighters warned the local community against burying the body. The motive behind the beheading is currently unknown.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against SNG soldiers manning an illegal checkpoint in Mushaani Village (14km NW of Marka) in the evening of 10/02. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly and casualties could not be established.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A man from Ali Saleban sub-clan of Majerteen shot and killed a man from Ugar Saleban sub-clan of Majerteen in Timirshe Village (38 km N of Iskushuban) on the night of 10/02. The motive of the incident is not known. The perpetrator escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Khatumo forces reportedly carried out hit-and-run attacks against Somaliland forces based in Widhwidh Village (49km N of Buuhoodle) in the night of 10/02. The Somaliland forces reportedly responded with both light and heavy fire during the clash which lasted for an hour after which the Khatumo forces withdrew. Casualties could not be established.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM and SNA forces took over Biyo-Cado Village (35km NE of Jowhar) in the morning of 11/02. No clashes were reported from the village and al Shabaab fighters reportedly withdrew prior to the arrival of the allied forces. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Non-violent transfer of territory

NOTES: Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade against a police outpost in the vicinity of Hanti-Wadaag (Jowhar) in the evening of 11/02. The perpetrators escaped. One police officer was slightly injured in the attack.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters fired at least six mortar rounds at MIA in the morning of 11/02. It is not clear where these mortar rounds were fired from but it is believed that it was a close proximity to the airport. Two Ugandan soldiers were injured in the attack, though it is not clear if they were the target of the attack. Al Shabaab claimed the responsibility.

Khatumo troops reportedly carried out hit-and-run attack against Somaliland forces based in Widhwidh Village (49km N of Buuhoodle) in the night of 11/02. Somaliland forces reportedly responded with light and heavy weaponry fire during the clash which lasted for an hour after which the Khatumo forces withdrew. No reported causalities.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Khatumo riding with battle wagons reportedly open fire at local pastoralist in teashops in the vicinity of Geed Xamarka near Carro Wayn Village (45km N of Buuhoodle) on 12/02. The motive of shootouts remains unclear. Stray bullets reportedly hit and killed pastoralist from Habarjeclo clan while unspecified number of pastoralist including two other Habarjeclo pastoralist sustaining injuries. Khatumo elements reportedly escaped. The victims were admitted to Buuhoodle and Burao hospitals.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters reportedly ambushed SNA convoy near Ceel-Qooxle Village (Ceel Bur District) in the afternoon of 12/02. Casualties from both sides could not be established.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Unidentified attackers throw hand grenades at government forces in Marka. Causalities reported, though numbers unknown.
Tags: Shabelle Media Network  Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A group of youths demonstrated against a local NGO in Xarrirad on 12/02. The youths were complaining that the local NGO had not recruited them in the voters' registration awareness programme in the village. The urged the National Electoral Commission (NEC) to look into the matter.

SNGF attacked Buur Weyn Village (29km N of Bulo Burte) early in the morning of 13/02. Al Shabaab vacated the village without any resistance but re-grouped with reinforcement from other al Shabaab fighters and attacked Buur Weyn before mid-day. Although SNGF received also reinforcement from other SNGF units, they were defeated by al Shabaab and had to vacate and returned to their base in Bulo Burte. AMISOM did not send reinforcement to assist SNGF. SNGF reported one injured soldier while casualties on al Shabaab side are unknown.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Human traffickers and Puntland Marine Police Force (PMPF) clashed in Ceelaayo Village (77km E of Laas-Qoray) 12/02. The human traffickers were reportedly members of Warsangeli sub-clan and had been planning to smuggle Ethiopian immigrants to Yemen when the clash took place. One soldier was killed in the clash. The PMPF arrested 10 -14 men they suspected to have been part of the attackers and 10 immigrants.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A teenager from Habar Jeclo/Adurahim died following fist fight with another teenager from Habar Yonis/Abdi Hamuud in Ceerigaabo in night of 13/02. The incident caused tension amongst the victim's sub-clan. The reason for the fight is not known.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: An IED of unknown origin targeted Burundian contingent of AMISOM at Via-Afmadow of Shaqalaha neighbourhood in Kismaayo in on the afternoon of 13/02. No casualties reported as the IED missed the target and exploded before the convoy passed. Security operation is on-going but so far, no arrests were reported.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters threw a hand grenade against SNG soldiers on foot patrol in the vicinity of Wajir Street (Marka) in the morning of 13/02. Perpetrators escaped. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters captured and killed two militia men (identity not known) in the vicinity of K60 (27km NW of Marka) in the morning of 13/02. The militia men were travelling in a public bus when a group of al Shabaab fighters emerged suddenly and opened the fire against the vehicle. Two civilian passengers were also injured in the shooting.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Armed clan militias launched an attack against the office of an INGO in Buulo Jaan neighbourhood (Marka) in the evening of 13/02. These attackers who allegedly hail from Biimaal clan briefly exchanged gunfire with the office guards after which the attackers withdrew. This incident is believed to be related to clan conflicts in Lower Shabelle Region as the most of the office guards hail from Habar-Gidir. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at some SNG soldiers on patrol in the main market in Marka on the morning of 13/02. The soldiers reportedly opened gunfire in response to the attack. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A SNG soldier shot and killed a civilian man in Xawaadley Village (27km NW of Balcad) in the night of 13/02. The men quarrelled over unknown issue which initially led to fist fight before the soldier shot the man. The perpetrator was arrested by the security forces.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: A SNG soldier shot and killed a SNG official in Afgooye town on 14/02 morning. The reason of the killing is not clear but the shooting followed a verbal dispute which escalated between the soldier and the official. The perpetrator was arrested.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Unidentified armed militias attacked the residence of former DC of Marka in Buulo Jaan which lasted for twenty minutes after which the attackers retreated. It is not clear if the attackers were al Shabaab fighters or another unnamed group. Two injuries reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: More than a hundred people, mostly drivers of tricycle (Tuktuk) staged a demonstration against the local authority in the western part of Burco on 14/02 in protest against a directive issued by the local authority and municipal council of relocating them to a new stage and also changing the routes they play in the town. The drivers fought with the police forces and blocked the roads with their tri-cycles. Additional police arrived at the scene and arrested a number of protesters.

Two groups of herders from Dhulbahante/Ali Geri sub-clan and Habar-Jeclo/Muse Abokor sub-clan reportedly exchanged gunfire in Geed Xamarka near Carro Wayn Village (45km N of Buuhoodle) on 14/02. The motive behind the incident remains unknown but is believed to be a revenge related to recent killing of Habar-Jeclo herders in the area. After brief shootout the two groups reportedly retreated from the incident scene. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A group of youths demonstrated in Gabiley town in the morning of 14/02 in protest against a delegation from Hargeisa, comprising of Minister of Finance and the first lady. The protestors' interrupted the first lady's speech and accused the government of being corrupt. Police arrived at the scene and arrested about 15 demonstrators.

At least three mortar projectiles landed in Kismaayo airport close to the UN compound inside the premises in the afternoon of 14/02. The incident happened after the UN regular flight departed from the airport. No damage or casualties were reported.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in the vicinity of Danwadaagaha neighbourhood (Wadajir/Medina District) in the evening of 14/02. Perpetrators escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States
NOTES: According to pro-al Shabaab media reports a drone reportedly operated by the United States crashed in Sandacaar (18km SE of Ceel Waaq) on 14/02. The drone was armed with six missiles which did not explode. Al Shabaab confiscated the drone and the missiles. No casualties were reported. The Pentagon denied the crash.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters raided a residential house in Biyo-Cado Village (36km NE of Jowhar), abducted a man and later beheaded him in the outskirt of the village in the night of 15/02. The motive behind this incident is currently unknown. The village is recently taken by the allied forces and it's under the control of the government.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Local residents staged anti-Somaliland violent demonstrations and expressed their support for Khatumo administration in Buuhoodle on 15-16/02. The protests comes a day after pro-Somaliland elders from Dhulbahante held a press conference and condemned the militiamen loyal to Khatumo who killed two Habar-Jeclo herders in Geed Xamarka village near Carro Wayn village (45km NE of Buuhoodle). The protesters marched in the streets of the town chanting anti-Somaliland slogans and burned tires while also damaged and destroyed windscreens of private vehicles. The two protests is believed to be organized by the Khatumo administration.

An al Shabaab court in Ceel Ware (32km SW of Bulo Burte) sentenced a man in to a death penalty in the afternoon of 15/02. The man was accused of being a spy for SNG and the court found him guilty and he was later executed in a public firing squad.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Clashes broke out between two youth groups from Dhulbahante and Habar-Jeclo sub-clans in Daalo neighbourhood on 15/02 following a dispute over territorial control. Ceerigaabo police intervened, shot in the air and arrested two teenagers from both sides.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A Group of Ceerigaabo Toyota vehicle owners staged demonstration in front of Ceerigaabo ministry of Planning office in the morning of 15/02. The protestors accused the Ministry of Planning official of been favouritism in renting services and bringing vehicles from Hargeisa.
