This followed after Somaliland Ministry of National Planning conducted a survey in Ceerigaabo town in which most of the vehicles responded to the survey were from Hargeisa. Police arrived at the scene and dispersed the demonstrators. No arrest was made.

Students from Mohamud Ahmed Ali secondary school staged a violent demonstration in Mohamud Haybe District (Hargeisa) in the morning of 15/02 in protest against high school fees and transfer of teachers by the government. The protestors smashed windows of several vehicles belonging to the government during the demonstration. Police dispersed the protestors using live bullets which some regarded as excessive force. No reported causalities, however.

A magnetic IED attached to a vehicle belonging to former defence minister for Transition Federal Government Mr. Muhyadiin Haji Ibrahim exploded in the vicinity of KM4 (Hodan District) in the afternoon of 15/02. The Former minister was killed in the explosion while another person onboard of the same vehicle was injured. Al Shabaab later confirmed responsibility.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against a police checkpoint in Al Baraka junction (Hodan District) in the evening of 15/02. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: SNG forces conducted security operations in villages around Rabdhure in the afternoon of 15/02. The forces shot and killed several al Shabaab fighters (exact numbers not listed) in Imilow village (10km SE of Rabdhure).
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A group of youths demonstrated against a delegation of vice president and chairman of Kulmiye party during their visit to Qol ujeed village (25km NW of Borama) on 15/02. The protestors were complaining about poor socio economics of the town and blamed the government of not supporting the region. Police arrested nine protesters and transferred them to Borama.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters fired mortar rounds against AMISOM/SNA camps in Shalaambood (5km NW of Marka) in the night of 15/02. Reports indicate that the mortars were fired from Janaale direction. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers shot and killed a mother and her son in drive-by shooting in Suuq Bacaad neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the afternoon of 15/02. The motive behind the attack is currently clear but some of the reports suggested that there was a land dispute between the victims and other people. The perpetrators escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters conducted coordinated attacks in Afgooye in the night of 16/02. The al Shabaab fighters attacked three positions simultaneously, at Mukayga base, the Police Station and the Bar Ismail checkpoint. The fighting lasted for more than an hour after which the attackers managed to take full control of Afgooye town. The al Shabaab attackers also seized two military vehicles, one civilian vehicle and confiscated small arms and they stayed in the town until 05:00 in the morning. Initial reports confirms death of three SNG soldiers and four civilians.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Two groups of SNG forces clashed in Belet Xawo in the morning of 16/02 following after two commanders disputed over the commanding of the police station. The DC arrived at the scene and managed to intervene between the two fighting forces. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Local residents staged anti-Somaliland violent demonstrations and expressed their support for Khatumo administration in Buuhoodle on 15-16/02. The protests comes a day after pro-Somaliland elders from Dhulbahante held a press conference and condemned the militiamen loyal to Khatumo who killed two Habar-Jeclo herders in Geed Xamarka village near Carro Wayn village (45km NE of Buuhoodle). The protesters marched in the streets of the town chanting anti-Somaliland slogans and burned tires while also damaged and destroyed windscreens of private vehicles. The two protests is believed to be organized by the Khatumo administration.

SNG forces launched an offensive against al Shabaab fighters' base in Waamo/Dhanfaruur Village (25km S of Buur-Hakaba) in the evening of 16/02. Reports indicate that one SNG was killed and another one injured in the clashes while casualties from al Shabaab side could not be established.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run-attack against SNA base in Ceelasha (12km SE of Afgooye) in the night of 16/02. After a brief armed clash the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Somali government forces capture two al Shabaab commanders (not identified) outside of Diinsoor on 16/01.
SNG police and NISA personnel exchanged gunfire over unknown reasons in Dabka junction (Hodan District) in the morning of 16/02. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: An IED that was planted at the roadside under a second hand cloth seller's table exploded at Balcad Junction of Shaqaalaha neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the night of 16/02. The IED targeted Jubaland forces that were on security patrol. No human casualties reported but the table and its surrounding was damaged.

Reports indicate that a UXO/Mine accidently exploded in Arabow Village (48km NE of Bu'ale) in the morning of 17/02. Further reports indicate that the device was remnant of an airstrikes by unknown war planes early in February and a group of al Shabaab fighters were inspecting the remaining at the scene when the explosion occurred. Two al Shabaab fighters were killed while another one was injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM/SNG convoy in Gol-Weyn Village (22km SW of Marka) in the evening of 17/02. The ambush was followed by fierce armed clash between the two sides which lasted for about twenty minutes after which the al Shabaab attackers retreated. Three civilians were injured by stray bullets.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Local government authority and police officers destroyed illegal constructions on a main road in Jigjiga Yar area (Hargeisa) in the morning of 17/02. Some of the owners opposed the operation and hurled stones at the police, destroying some mirrors of civilian cars. Police responded by firing bullets and arresting at least 10 people for damaging vehicles and disrupting police operations.

Unidentified perpetrator(s) planted an IED in to a vehicle (Land cruiser) belonging to Jubaland Minister of Social Affairs in Shirkole of Farjano neighbourhood in the evening of 17/02. The Minister was supposed to meet with Jubaland president at statehouse however his driver received information regarding the IED fitted in the vehicle and changed to another car instead. An EOD team arrive and safely dismantled the device after communication network was suspended. The security forces arrested three people, relatives of minister on suspicion ground. Latest reports on 18/02 indicate that the security forces again arrested more suspects' and currently could not be determined the number of people arrested.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An IED of unknown origin targeted an AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of Mariin-Gubaay (50km NE of Baraawe) in the morning of 17/02. One of the convoy vehicles was damaged by the explosion. A Somali driver was reportedly injured in the attack.

A SNG soldier manning a check point in the outskirts of Baidoa town indiscriminately opened fire against a public mini-bus in Mayafulka (7km NE of Baidoa) on 17/02. The motive is reportedly about taxation dispute where the driver refuse to pay money. The driver and another passenger were injured.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Unidentified gunmen attacked a registrations office in the vicinity of Sabawanag (76km NE of Baki) on 17/02. A police officer guarding the registration venue was injured while the office was destroyed and the staffers escaped unhurt. The reason this incident is currently unclear however it could be a border dispute in the area.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters and SNG forces briefly clashed in the vicinity of Barakaat Cemetery (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 17/02. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A young man from Ali Saleban was shot and killed by unknown assailant in Biyo-kulule neighbourhood of Bosasso town in the night of 18/02. Motive of the incident is yet to be established. The body was removed from the scene and taken to Bosasso General Hospital. Three suspects were arrested and detained in Bosasso Central Police Station in connection with the murder.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against NISA forces in Abdi Wayel Cinema neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the night of 18/02. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly but no casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: An IED was discovered in a dumping pit near the soccer stadium in Isbartiiba section of Farjano in Kismaayo neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the evening of 18/02. The explosive was discovered after an intelligence received a tip-off from a local resident who became suspicious about a box place at the road side.

Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against SNA positions in Shalaambood Village (10km W of Marka) in the night of 18/02. Both sides engaged in a heavy fighting after which the attackers were repulsed. Casualties are unknown.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Kenya-AMISOM forces attack al Shabaab forces at Siidimo, killing 20, including a notable IED expert.

A hand grenade was thrown by unidentified attackers against a group of SNA personnel in the vicinity of Wajir Street in Marka in the evening of 19/02. The hand grenade landed on a crowd of civilians and soldiers. One SNA officer and two civilians were killed in the blast while two civilians and two SNA personnel were injured. Sources confirm that SNA in Marka later executed a suspect.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A RCIED was targeted against a vehicle carrying the DC of Baraawe, Huseen Mahamed Barre (Jeex), in the morning of 20/02. The explosion hit the vehicle and injured the DC. Deputy DC of Baraawe District confirmed that the attacker was arrested by the security forces.

An armed clashed broke out between two groups of SNGF in Beled Xawo on the morning of 20/02. The fighting broke out after one group tried to stop the other from taking taxation from the market and public transports. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Local clan militias reportedly engaged in an armed clash with al Shabaab fighters in an area near Ceel-Huur Village (60km N of Xarardheere) in the afternoon of 20/02. One combatant from the local militias was reportedly injured in the clash while unconfirmed reports suggest that eight al Shabaab fighters were killed in the clash. Reports say that the fighting broke out after al Shabaab fighters attempted to forcefully collect Zakat (alms) from the local herders.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A group of people staged a peaceful demonstration in front of Ceerigaabo court on 20/02 to express their anger against the regular postponement of cases against local youth gangs and grass land disputes. The demonstrators were mostly parents and nomads. Ceerigaabo police arrived the scene and dispersed the crowd.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: KDF warplanes carried out an air strike against suspected al Shabaab fighters' military camp in Qudaxley (15km N of Garbahaarey) on the morning of 20/02. Casualties are unknown so far. Local residents are trying to escape away from the areas which KDF Airforce is targeting, which led to displacements of the resident communities. No causalities reported.

A group of people, mostly businesswomen, staged a demonstration at Laas Caanood grocery market on 20/02. The demonstrators were protested following reports that the market has been sold to a local businessman.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at SNA personnel on foot patrol in Wajir Street (Marka) in the evening of 20/02. No causalities.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters fired four mortar rounds against Baidoa airport on 21/02. Three rounds landed in the protected area close to Salamey IDP and the other landed outside. No causalities or damages were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNGF base in Garas Weyne Village (47km NW of Xudur) on 21/02. Both sides were using small arms fire and no casualties were reported. Al Shabaab fighters retreated.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Al Shabaab attacks SNG forces in Heliwa, resulting in a heavy exchange of gunfire. No reported causalities.
Tags: Radio Andalus Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A group of drivers and conductors of lories staged a peaceful demonstration in Laas Caanood on 21/02 in protest against tax increase by Somaliland authority. Police arrived at the scene, dispersed the protestors and arrested unspecified numbers of demonstrators.

A group of local residents in Lughaye staged a peaceful demonstration on 21/02 in protest against the recent attack against voter’s registration office in Sabawanag on 17/02. The protestors called for the government to solve disputes on district boundaries in the area.

Hundreds of people staged a peaceful demonstration in KM4/ in front of the parliament/Dajirka along Maka Al-Mukarama road in the morning of 21/02. The demonstrators urged the government to mention the status that Mogadishu will have after 2016. The protestors had slogans indicating the need for Mogadishu residents to have equal rights as the other residents living in other regions. The provisional Constitution of the Federal Republic of Somalia states that Mogadishu will have special regulation that will be endorsed by the parliament.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: Al Shabaab forces attack a group of Ugandian soldiers delivering supplies to Baidoa. Casualties reported, exact figures not known.
Tags: Radio Al-Furqaan  Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A SNG soldier hailing from Hawiye/Ajuran shot and killed his colleague (Rahanweyn) in Hawl-Wadaag (Baidoa) in the evening of 22/02 over unknown reason. Police arrested the perpetrator.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Two groups of SNG military (sector 21) engaged an internal clash in the outskirt of Cadaado town in the morning of 22/02. The motive behind the clash is currently unknown but unconfirmed reports indicate that the two groups fought on clan lines (Marehan vs Ayr). Galmudug officials intervened and managed to stop the fighting. Four combatants from both sides were killed.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Galmudug forces as well as some residents of Ad and El-Abdi villages [in central region of Mudug] engaged al Shabaab forces in their area, killing 22.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab forces ambushed a group of AMISOM-Ethiopia forces at Leego on 22/02. The attack destroyed one of the vehicles in the convoy. No causalities.
Tags: Somali Dhacdo Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: NISA forces arrest a senior al Shabaab official in Bakara Market on 22/02. No name released.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Heavily armed al Shabaab fighters’ ambushed AMISOM/SNG forces convoy near Yaaq Biri Weyne (22km W of Wanla Weyne) in the morning of 22/02. The attack started with a RCIED attack which destroyed an oil tanker followed by gunfire which lasted for hours while part of the convoy managed to reach Leego later in the afternoon. Four vehicles were destroyed and eleven combatants from both sides were killed in the attack.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A RCIED exploded in Carafaat neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the morning of 22/02 shortly after a SNG pickup passed at the incident scene. A civilian bystander was reportedly injured in the blast. The perpetrator escaped.
A RCIED detonated near the market (Afgooye) in the afternoon of 23/02. Three civilians were injured in the blast. No arrests were made in connection with the attack.

An unidentified gunman opened gunfire against a public mini-bus in the vicinity of Buunda weyn (Afgooye) in the afternoon of 23/02. Two passengers were injured in the shooting and the attacker was arrested.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: SNG forces on a security operation clashed with al Shabaab fighters briefly in Doonfuul (14km NE of Xudur Town) in the evening of 23/02. The al Shabaab fighters withdrew after brief exchange of gunfire and no casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A senior al Shabaab leader (identity not known) is arrested by government forces in a hotel in Bakaro market in Hodan on 23/02.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a brief hit-and-run attack against NISA base at the Sarta Qabyada building (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 23/02. The attackers withdrew immediately and no casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: An unidentified attacker opened gunfire indiscriminately against a crowd near Caalin Cafeteria in Horseed neighbourhood (Baidoa) in the noon of 24/02. The cafeteria is frequented by ISWA MPs in the afternoons. Three civilians were killed and three others were injured in the shooting. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the attacker is a NISA officer who is now under arrest. The motive of the attack is unknown.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Army infighting kills three, including two civilians in Baidoa on 24/02. Four wounded. The cause of the clash is not known.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: SNA/AMISOM forces took over Caadley and Ceel-Baraf villages (41km & 55km NE of Jowhar Town) in the morning of 24/02. Al Shabaab fighters made no resistance and left the villages before the arrival of the allied forces.
Tags: Local Source Project Non-violent transfer of territory

ALLY_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: SNA/AMISOM forces took over Caadley and Ceel-Baraf villages (41km & 55km NE of Jowhar Town) in the morning of 24/02. Al Shabaab fighters made no resistance and left the villages before the arrival of the allied forces.
Tags: Local Source Project Non-violent transfer of territory

NOTES: The body of a young man was found in the vicinity of Oodweyne neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the morning of 24/02. The victim was stabbed with a knife by unknown attackers and several wounds could be seen on his body. The motive behind the killing is currently unknown.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: More than a hundred people staged a peaceful demonstration in Dhanaano Village (62km N of Caynabo Town) on 24/02 against the head of the village over slow developmental progress in the village. The demonstrators requested the minister of interior and the president to replace the head of the village for failing his duties.
A brief shoot-out broke out between Puntland and Galmudug forces in Taarrogo area (12km W of Galkacyo Town) in the morning of 24/02. Five injuries reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: SNG forces clashed with suspected al Shabaab fighters in the vicinity of Livestock Market (Heliwa District) in the evening of 24/02. The al Shabaab fighters withdrew after a brief exchange of gunfire. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A group of local residents believed to be pro-Khatumo reportedly gathered and staged a demonstration in Laas Caanood on 24/02 in protest against bill-boards erected by Somaliland National Electoral Commission in the town urging the locals to registers as voters. The protestors reportedly destroyed a number of bill-boards. Police arrived at the scene and dispersed them. They also arrested a number of protestors.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed AMISOM convoy near Qurac-Madoobe (22km NE of Jowhar Town) in the afternoon of 24/02. Both sides exchanged in a gunfire for some time after which the AMISOM convoy managed to proceed its journey. The convoy came from Ceel-Baraf and was heading to Mahadaay when the incident happened. Casualties are unknown.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Khatumo forces carried out hit-and-run attack against Somaliland forces based in Widhwidh Village (49km N of Buuhoodle Town). The forces fired motor shells towards Somaliland army camps but missed their target. One pastoralist sustained injuries in the shelling and the Khatumo forces retreated back to Buuhoodle Town.

An ISWA soldier who tried to stop a rickshaw which did not stop for him opened fire in Berdale neighbourhood on 25/02. One civilian woman was killed by a stray bullet and another succumbed to her injuries a short while later. No arrest was reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched an ambush against ENDF/SNFG convoy travelling from Leego to Baidoa in the afternoon of 25/02 in Daynuunay Village (18km SW of Baidoa). AMISOM convoy was attacked several times and so far four casualties were reported on ENDF/SNGF side.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against the office of the DC of Kaxda neighbourhood (Dharkeynley District) in the evening of 25/02. The perpetrators escaped from the scene. Casualties are unknown.

A gunman shot and killed a civilian man, wounding another man in Rako Village (78km NE of Qardho) on 25/02. The incident is said to be linked to previous clan revenge killings, perpetrator not identified.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: KDF launched an airstrike at Tuulo Barwaqo (21km SE of Garbahaarey Town) in the morning of 25/02. At least six missiles were reportedly fired and only one exploded. Ten al Shabaab, including four top commanders were killed in the blast.

At least six mortar rounds were fired from an unknown location against Villa Somalia (Wardhiigleey District) in the afternoon of 25/02. Four of them landed inside Villa Somalia Complex, injuring some staff from the prime minister’s office while the other two landed in a populated area killing an unknown number of civilians - Agence France Presse counts four, including two children. Al Shabaab immediately claimed responsibility for the attack.

Khatumo forces reportedly carried out a hit-and-run attack against Somaliland forces based in Widhwidh Village (49km N of Buuhoodle) in the night of 25/02. Somaliland forces reportedly responded with light and heavy weaponry fire during the clash which lasted for an hour after which the Khatumo forces withdrew. No reported casualties.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Decapitated bodies of two men were found in the vicinity of Xujub (11km SE of Beled Weyne Town) in the morning of 25/02. The victims were apparently beheaded and no group has so far claimed responsibility for the killing.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters beheaded an ISWA soldier who hails from Jilible sub clan of Rahanwein in the morning of 26/02 in Ceel Garas Village (35km NE of Xudur) who previously defected from ISWA forces. Reports indicate that the ISWA soldier sold his AK-47 rifle and wanted to live in Ceel Garas village, under control of al Shabaab and was consequently beheaded.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: A vehicle loaded with explosives detonated between SYL Hotel and peace garden (Xamar Weyne District) in the night of 26/02 after NISA forces instructed the driver to stop at a checkpoint. After the explosion, gunmen tried to storm SYL hotel but they were stopped and killed by the hotel guards. Another car bomb exploded outside the nearby peace garden thirty minutes after the first explosion. Some of the Mogadishu families visits peace garden with their children on weekends. The attackers did not manage to enter SYL hotel due to the resistance of the hotel guards. Ministry of Internal Security released a statement and stated that five NISA personnel were killed in the first explosion. According to hospital sources, more than 15 civilians were killed in the attack and close to thirty others were injured. The security forces mentioned that the attackers were five in number, two drivers and three attackers. According to Police, the explosives were estimated to be 200kg, the biggest explosion Mogadishu experienced.
Tags: Agence France Presse  Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against SNA personnel on foot patrol in the vicinity of Beytu-raas (Marka) in the evening of 26/02. The hand grenade reportedly landed on an empty place. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters ambushed an ENDF convoy travelling from Wajiid to Buur Dhuxunley in Lanta Gasarta Village (pprox.16 KM N of Waajid) on 26/02. After exchange of gun-fire, the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: The African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM), supported by the Somali troops, killed at least ten Al-Shabaab militants and injured 20 others near Somalia's southwestern town of Hudur on 26/02.
Unknown men armed with pistols shot and killed a SNGF soldier in Bundo Weyn neighbourhood of Beled Weyne on 27/02. The motive is unknown and assailants managed to escape.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against AMISOM/SNA forces in Buufow Bacaad Village (5km NW of Marka town) in the afternoon of 27/02. These forces were deployed in Buufow Bacaad to receive a convoy from Mogadishu. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters retreated to Janaale direction. According to locals, al Shabaab brought injuries in Janaale. The exchange of gunfire also caused the death of number of goats which were caught in the crossfire. No specific report of human fatality.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Tension reportedly ran high between the Puntland forces and Dhulbahante militiamen loyal to Khatumo administration in the vicinity of Buuro Wadal Village (90km E of Laas Caanood) on 27/02 following a dispute over territory controls. This followed after the pro-Khatumo militiamen took over the control of the village without any confrontation from Puntland and established checkpoint. The tension reportedly triggered a large amount of force mobilization from both sides for possible armed clash, causing panic among the local residents.
Tags: Local Source Project Non-violent transfer of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED was targeted against AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of Ceel-Wareegow (11km NE of Marka town) in the afternoon of 27/02. AMISOM soldier was injured in the blast while the explosion also damaged an AMISOM vehicle.

Two groups of people from Habar Jeclo/Biciido and Habar Yonis/Sacad Yonis sub-clans reportedly clashed using knives and other crude objects following a dispute over land ownership in Dhabar Dalool near Ceel-Afwayn on 27/02. An older woman from Habar Yonis/Sacad Yonis was injured in the clash. Ceel-Afwayn police arrived at the scene arrested two men; one from each side.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched hit and run attack against AMISOM base in Maslax compound (Heliwa District) in the night of 27/02. The attack started with mortars followed by face to face confrontations, after which the attackers withdrew. One person was confirmed dead while three civilians were injured.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters fired at least three rounds of mortar fire against the new airport in Kismaayo on 27/02. At least three rounds landed inside KDF protected area. No casualties reported.

Unknown gun men attacked one of the top intelligence commanders of Jubaland while he was heading to his house in the centre of Shaqalaha neighbourhood. The same group again attacked a JLF vehicle that was on patrol near Hanta Biyaha, Kismayo. They managed to escape and no casualties were reported. After the incidents JLF conducted a security search operation in the area.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A number of people demonstrated in Lughaye against the attack carried by gunmen against voters’ registrations office in Sabawanag area on 27/02. The demonstrators called on the Somaliland government to arraign the suspects in court. They also called on the government to intervene in the ongoing dispute over boundaries between Hargeisa and Lughaya districts.

IWSA forces coming from Tayeeglow on security operation clashed with al Shabaab fighters in Mubarak (39km SE of Xudur) on 27/02. ISWA forces were defeated and retreated back to their base in Tayeeglow. Four ISWA soldiers were injured in the armed clash.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM/SNA forces took over control of Qoor-Dheere Village (35km E of Jowhar) from al Shabaab fighters in the morning of 27/02. Al Shabaab fighters reportedly vacated the village without resisting the allied forces.
Tags: Local Source Project Non-violent transfer of territory

NOTES: Two men armed with pistols shot and killed a shopkeeper inside her shop in Siinaay Junction (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 27/02. The motive behind the killing is not known. The attackers escaped from the scene.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: A group of parents staged a peaceful demonstration in Badhan (106km E of Ceerigaabo) on 28/02 in protest against Puntland ministry of Education. These demonstration came after the Ministry increased fee for the forthcoming Puntland secondary and intermediate exams in 2016. They urged Puntland ministry to solve the issue otherwise their students will not sit for the exam. Somaliland and Puntland holds their secondary & intermediate exams in most of eastern Sanaag districts (Badhan & Dhahar) every year.

A SVBIED (minibus) that was parked in front of Baidoa Hotel exploded near Dahabshiil office in Baidoa in the evening of 28/02 where locals assemble in the afternoon causing high number of casualties. A few seconds later a suicide bomber (assumed to be a female) entered a very popular “Beder Restaurant’ and exploded her suicide vest. The restaurant is frequented by traditional elders, politicians, diasporas for sharing ideas and information during evening tea time. A large number of security forces were deployed in the town, curfew was imposed for the night and movement of vehicles and people was restricted. Reports from medical source indicate that 37 people died in the two attacks including a medical doctor working for Bihow hospital while over 50 people were injured, some of them with serious injuries. Victims with serious injuries are expected to be air lifted to Mogadishu for specialized treatment. Al Shabaab has claimed the responsibility of the two attacks. Other sources hold 55 dead.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: A woman was killed and two other civilians were injured following after security forces open fire to disperse local people that tried to storm Baidoa hospital searching for their family members.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: PIS (Puntland Intelligence Service) soldier shot and killed a local council officer over land dispute in the morning of 28/02. The incident happened after the local council officer attempted to grab land in Bixin area. The perpetrator was among PIS soldiers deployed to the area to prevent massive land grabbing. The perpetrator was arrested.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM/SNAG forces clashed with al Shabaab fighters near Biyo-Cado Village (36km NE of Jowhar) in the morning of 28/02. Both sides exchanged heavy and light weapons during the clash after which AMISOM/SNG forces overpowered the al Shabaab fighters. Two combatants from both sides were confirmed dead.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A man from Majerteen/Isse Mohamud sub-clan shot and killed a man from Madhibaan in the vicinity of Kalabeyr Village (60km W of Garowe) on the afternoon of 28/02. The perpetrator was arrested.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Somaliland police arrested three protestors in Lawya Caddo on 28/02 after they were allegedly accused of disrupting the voter registration exercise.

Gunmen hailing from Habar-Gidir/Sa'ad reportedly shot and killed a herder man from Majerteen/Isse Mohamud in an area near Semade Village (30km W of Jariban) in the evening of 28/02. The motive of the killing is not yet clear but it is believed to be related to past clan revenges. The victim was reportedly deaf. The perpetrators escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An IED exploded prematurely near Tabta (75km SW of Afmadow) in the afternoon of 28/02. AMISOM forces in the area responded with heavy gun fire in the direction of the explosion. No casualties were reported.

Jubaland forces on security operation launched a hit and run attack against al Shabaab fighters in Abdale Birole (41km SW of Kismaayo) on 29/02. Reports indicate that three al Shabaab fighters manning a checkpoint in the village were killed. No casualties were reported from Jubaland side.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Jubaland forces attacked al Shabaab fighters mobilizing their fighters at Shandarmood Junction (20km NW of Kismaayo) on 29/02. No casualties were reported from both sides.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters beheaded a SNA soldier in Laantabuur (11km SW of Afgooye) in the evening of 29/02. The soldier was out of the camp when the SNA forces vacated their camp and he came back without knowing al Shabaab presence in the camp.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Reports from Afgooye confirm that al Shabaab fighters took-over Laantabuur (11km SW of Afgooye) from SNA forces in the evening of 29/02. SNA personnel reportedly vacated the base after they received information regarding al Shabaab fighters planning to attack the base. The SNA forces retreated back to Afgooye.
Tags: Local Source Project Non-violent transfer of territory

NOTES: Militiamen believed to be loyal to Khatumo forces reportedly fired RPG and mortar rounds against Somaliland forces based in the vicinity of Qorilugud Village (38km NW of Buuhoodle) on 29/02. The rounds reportedly landed in pastoral area close to Maygaagle and Qorilugud villages.

Unidentified sniper shot and injured a civilian woman inside her residence after the attacker allegedly aimed at her from a window in Macmacaanka neighbourhood (Wadajir/Medina District) in the evening of 29/02. The motive behind the attack is unknown. The perpetrator escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: A group of SNG forces staged a demonstration at the General Dhagabadan Training Centre and erected road-blocks in front of the main gate to the centre. A senior Somali national army official addressed the group and they returned back to their barracks. No casualties or damages were reported.

Militiamen believed to be loyal to Khatumo forces reportedly fired RPG and mortar rounds against Somaliland forces based in the vicinity of Qorilugud Village (38km NW of Buuhoodle) on 29/02. The rounds reportedly landed in pastoral area close to Maygaagle and Qorilugud villages.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM base in Qoryooley town on 29/02. The fighting lasted for almost an hour. Casualties from both sides could not be established.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: SNG forces on security patrol engaged in an armed clash with al Shabaab fighters driving on a motorbike near Abaq Beeday (16km E of Xudur) on 01/03. The al Shabaab fighters managed to escape but one fighter was reportedly injured in the clash.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Somali security forces killed seven fighters from the Al-Qa'idah-linked Al-Shabab group in Abdale Birole on the evening of 01/03.

A RCIED targeted a SNA vehicle on Mogadishu-Afgooye road near Xawo-Cabdi Locality (9km SE of Afgooye) in the morning of 01/03. The explosion damaged the military vehicle and killed at least four SNA personnel. Perpetrators not known.

Militiamen believed to be from Issa Muse clan reportedly ambushed a vehicle carrying the deputy governor for Saahil region (Berbera) and the police divisional commander for the same region near Biyooley (22km NE of Sheikh) on 01/03. The motive behind the shooting remains unclear. The officials were reportedly heading to Tuulo Dhibiijo village (19km NE of Sheikh) on mission to solve conflict between farmers, owners of vehicles and vegetable dealers following after they had disputed over transportation issues. The divisional commander was killed in the incident while a body guard was slightly injured.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Galmudug forces together with local clan militias reportedly attacked al Shabaab fighters based in Caad Village (43km N of Xarardheere) in the morning of 01/03. Other reports suggest that similar fighting broke out in Ceel Cabdi Village (22km S of Xarardheere). Casualties could not established.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A group of youths and women staged violent demonstration in Ceel-Afwayn on 03/03 in protest against the killing of Saahil Police divisional commander in Biyooley near Sheekh on 01/03 by clan militias believed to be from Issa Musa. The demonstration turned violent after the protestors closed roads and burned tires. Ceel-Afwayn police forces arrived at the scene, open fire at the air and dispersed the demonstrators. No casualties or arrests were reported.

Galmudug forces together with local clan militias reportedly attacked al Shabaab fighters based in Caad Village (43km N of Xarardheere) in the morning of 01/03. Other reports suggest that similar fighting broke out in Ceel Cabdi Village (22km S of Xarardheere). Casualties could not established.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: At least four soldiers have been killed after a military convoy was hit by a roadside bomb outside Mogadishu. The perpetrators are not known.

A demonstration in protest against the arrest of Yemeni fishermen and their boats was held in Qandala on 01/03. The demonstrations were reportedly organized by individuals harbouring alleged illegal foreign fishing vessels following the arrest of the Yemeni fishermen by PMPF in Qandala on the same day. The demonstration ended peacefully.

Two RCIEDs simultaneously targeted against SNG convoy in the vicinity of Siinka Dheer (13km NE of Afgooye) in the evening of 01/03. A brief exchange of gunfire followed the blast. Casualties and perpetrators are unknown.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces base in the outskirt of Afgooye town in the night of 02/03. The fighting lasted for a few minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A group of youths mostly hailing from Habar-Jeclo/Basanbur sub-clans staged a demonstration in Ceerigaabo on 02/03 in protest against the killing of their fellow clansman (Police visional commander in Berbera) in Biyooley near Sheekh on 01/03 by clan militias believed to be Issa Musa. The demonstration turned into violent after the protestors closed roads and burned tires. Ceerigaabo police supported by military forces arrived at the scene, open fire at the air and dispersed the demonstrators. No casualties or arrests were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG police outpost in the vicinity of Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the night of 02/03. After a brief exchange of gunfire the attackers withdrew. No reports of casualties.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Heavy fighting broke out in Dhusamareeb town between pro-Galmudug militia, led by former SNGF commander who switched sides last year and ASWJ in Dhusamareeb in the early hours of 02/03. The fighting is still on-going, seemingly Pro-Galmudug militia having the upper hand. More than seven combatants from both sides were confirmed dead while more than that number were injured. Civilians also suffered unknown numbers of losses. Galmudug forces have taken over Mareer Guur (28 KM NE of Dhusamareeb) after ASWJ went to Dhusamareeb for reinforcement. Both sides mobilizing reinforcement which could affect other areas like Cabud Waaq, Guriel and Xerale.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A group of SNG soldiers exchanged gunfire with an armed man in the vicinity of Zobe neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the afternoon of 02/03. The motive behind the armed clash is unknown. A civilian bystander was killed in the shooting.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Heavy fighting broke out in Dhusamareeb town between pro-Galmudug militia, led by former SNGF commander who switched sides last year and ASWJ in Dhusamareeb in the early hours of 02/03. The fighting is still on-going, seemingly Pro-Galmudug militia having the upper hand. Galmudug forces have taken over Mareer Guur (28 KM NE of Dhusamareeb) without resistance after ASWJ went to Dhusamareeb for reinforcement.
Tags: Local Source Project Non-violent transfer of territory

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters attacked two bases of SNG forces in Beytu-raas and Saraha neighbourhood (Marka) in the early morning of 02/03.The fighting lasted for about thirty minutes after which the al Shabaab attackers withdrew. The attackers reportedly left two dead behind.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Unidentified armed men opened gunfire against a private vehicle passing near Suuqa Weyn (Wadajir/Medina District) in the night of 02/03. The vehicle belonged to former Wadajir DC who was not in the car when the incident happened. The driver was injured in the shooting. The perpetrators escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Military forces carry out an operation in Xudur District - exact location not known - on 02/03, encountering and clashing with al Shabaab, killing 6.
Tags: Universal TV  Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters fired about ten mortar rounds against Hawo Tako neighbourhood in Afgooye town in the evening of 03/03. First reports indicate that about fourteen (14) civilians were injured in the attack while civilian residential were damaged.
Unidentified attackers hurled two hand grenades against SNG police forces at Baar Ubax Junction (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the evening of 03/03. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: An IED attached to a tree exploded at the Barcaleen Check-point on the road between the Kismaayo airport and the town. The tree use to be a tax collection checkpoint and was completely destroyed. Two staff from Jubaland Ministry of Finance were injured in the blast.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against an ISWA police based in Mayafulka (7km NE of Baidoa) on 03/03. The exchanged of gunfire lasted for about 20 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched a brief hit and run attack against an ENDF convoy in Safar-Nooley (15km SE of Diinsoor) on 03/03. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Four militiamen allegedly claiming to be from the Barre Hiraale militias beheaded a 50 year old farmer hailing from Darood/Bartire sub-clan on the eastern side of Juba river near Yoontoy Yarey (25km NE of Kismaayo) on 03/03.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Local residents in Ceel Afweyn stage violent demonstrations to protest against the killing of a police commander by clan militias on 03/03. No reported injury.

Scuffles broke out between two youth groups from Habar Yonis and Habar Jeclo sub-clans in Barwaaqo (Ceerigaabo) on 04/03 following a dispute over territorial control. Ceerigaabo police arrived the scene and arrested four.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Explosions from unknown origin target Ethiopian forces in Baardheere on 05/03. Of the three dead two were civilians. It is not clear if the perpetrators were at the scene or the explosives were IEDs.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters fired mortar rounds against KDF military base in Buulo Garas village (approx.1.25km W of Bardheere) in the morning of 05/03. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM base in Ceel-Baraf Village (55km NE of Jowhar) on 05/03 night. The fighting reportedly lasted for thirty minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties cannot be established.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM convoy near Gol-Weyn Village (22km W of Marka) in the afternoon of 05/03. Both sides exchanged different types of gunfire during the clash. The AMISOM convoy came from Mogadishu and was heading to Baraawe when the incident happened. Casualties are unknown.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: An IED exploded prematurely as suspected al Shabaab fighters wanted to plant it in the outskirts of Goof Gaduud (27km SW of Baidoa) on 05/03. Reports indicate that one al Shabaab fighter was killed and another injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces based in Buufow Bacaad fired unknown number of mortar rounds at Janaale town (14km NW of Marka) and the neighbouring villages in the night of 05/03. According to local reports, the mortars caused unspecified number of civilian injuries. The intended target is not clear.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: KDF jets launch attacks on Jilib area on 05/03, targets not known. The majority of missiles landed in nearby agricultural fields. Causalities not known.

A local al Shabaab commander surrenders to SNG forces in Qoryooley in the afternoon of 05/03. The defector is called Sheikh Mohamed Haji Ali and he used to command about ten al Shabaab fighters. Qoryooley authority confirmed the defection and added that they are transferring him to Mogadishu for investigation. The man was alone and no other fighters were accompanying him.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against a group of SNG soldiers on foot patrol inside Qoryooley town in the evening of 05/03. No casualties. The perpetrators escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Somaliland police in Allay Baday village (37km SW of Gabiley) arrested at least 15 teenagers on 06/03 after they staged a demonstration against a visiting minister of Agriculture. The protestors accused the government of been corrupt and failed to meet the promises they made during last election adding that the authorities also neglecting their village. Reports indicate that the demonstrators were supporters of WADANI party (opposition) while the police accused them of causing disturbance.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab attacks government forces location near Baraawe town during the nighttime hours. The fighters attacked the SNA base with rocket propelled grenade launchers and machine guns before they were repulsed by the coalition forces comprising of AU and Somali troops. No reported causalities.
Tags: Shabelle Media Network  Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM base in Mudul-Brawe (5km NE of Baraawe) in the night of 06/03. After brief exchange of gunfire the attackers retreated. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States
NOTES: American drones fired missiles and other explosives against an alleged an al Shabaab training camp in Raso in the morning of 06/03. Reports indicate that neighbouring villagers reported to have seen black smoke and sounds of explosions from the area. The Pentagon believes 150+ al Shabaab dead in the strike. It is believed there was a mass meeting or a "graduation ceremony" of sorts for al Shabaab fighters in the area which accounts for the high number of dead. Other reports indicitate the group may have been gathered to launch an attack on AMISOM-KDF forces in the area.

Unidentified attackers launched an attack against SNA base in Shalaambood (10km W of Marka) in the night of 06/03. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No Casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: An IED exploded at a civilian checkpoint at Beled Weyne airport on the morning of 07/03. The explosion injured at least five, including two AMISOM soldiers. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the attack.

Unidentified three masked men armed with clubs reportedly assaulted a woman and broke her arm in Farah Omar neighbourhood (Burco) on 07/03. Reports indicate that the woman recently deserted the ruling party “Kulmiye” and joined WADANI party (opposition). The exact motive behind the incident is currently unclear, however, it could be related to party-hopping by large supporters of Kulmiye to WADANI party. The perpetrators escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM and SNG forces, bases in Qoryooley in the night of 07/03. The fighting lasted for about 30 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Militiamen hailing from Habar-Gidir/Sa'ad shot and killed two men hailing from Marehan/Wagardhac sub-clan in an area near Saaxo Village (70km SW of Galkacyo) in the afternoon of 07/03. The motive of the killing was allegedly associated with previous clan clashes and revenge killings between the two sub-cans. The incident caused tension in the area. No other casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Khatumo forces reportedly carried out a hit-and-run attack against Somaliland forces based in Bali-Hadhac Village (62km NE of Buuhoodle) in the night of 08/03. Following the attack the Somaliland forces reportedly responded with light and heavy weapons during the clash which lasted for several hours after which the Khatumo forces withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Two groups of SNG soldiers fought in Buurdhuubo (35km SE of Garbahaarey District) in the afternoon of 08/03. The fighting started when a commander tried to disarm a group of soldiers following the refusal of his orders. One soldier was killed in the fighting.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Gunmen (pastoralists) hailing from Majerteen/Omar Mohamud sub-clan reportedly shot and injured a herder man hailing from Habar-Gidir/Sa’ad sub-clan in the vicinity of Damerale (45km E of Galkacyo) on 08/03. The motive of the shooting was reportedly related to previous clan revenge. The injured man was taken to Galkacyo (South) Hospital. No arrest was reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man inside Bakara market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the morning of 08/03. The motive behind the attack is not known. The perpetrators escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: Motor rounds landed in Via-Afmadow, Shaqaalaha neighbourhood in Kismaayo town in the morning of 08/02. The motors hit in an open place inside a civilian compound and no casualties were reported. The motors are said to have targeted an AMISOM (Burundian) base near Via-Afmadow.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of the United States
NOTES: SNG forces, aided by US Naval airpower launched an attack at Aw-Dheegle (Afgooye District) in the morning of 09/03. According to information from the ground a helicopter landed in Aw-Dheegle town and engaged fighting with al Shabaab fighters in the town. Further reports indicate that SNG forces broke all the doors of the ADC Compound, the district administration and the police station. The attacking forces were reportedly present in Aw-Dheegle close to two hours then left. Four al Shabaab dead bodies were seen in the town in the morning. Some reports claim 10 dead.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A carbomb exploded near the entrance of Xerada Gaadiidka Booliska (Police Transport Compound) in Cabdicasiis District in the morning of 09/03. The explosion happened near a teashop where a group of soldiers and civilians were having their tea. Reports indicate that there was ongoing police training in the compound when the explosion happened. Three police officers and at least one civilian bystander were killed in the attack.

An RCIED targeted against ISWA military vehicle in Korow-Rooge (15km SE of Baidoa) near Mayafulka in the morning of 09/03. Further reports confirm that soldiers were heading to Daynuunay to receive their salaries. The explosion resulted unspecified number of injuries.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces base in Lafoole (6km SE of Afgooye) in the night of 09/03. Both sides exchanged different types of gunfire before the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ALLY_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of the United States
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed SNG forces on foot patrol outside Shalaambood (7km SW of Marka) in the morning of 09/03. The fighting lasted for about 30 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Two bodies of al Shabaab fighters were reportedly seen in the battle field.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A tricycle motor best known as “Tuktuk” loaded with explosives detonated in the vicinity of 21st October neighbourhood (Waaberi District) in the morning of 09/03. The explosion occurred after the police instructed the driver to stop but the driver went out of the vehicle and ran away. The police arrested four people in connection with this incident. The number of causalities and injuries was not reported or unknown.
Somaliland forces left Bali-Hadhac Village and set up a temporary base in Carro Weyn Village (45km NE of Buuhoodle) on 09/03.
Tags: Local Source Project Headquarters or base established

NOTES: An IED exploded near Bardheere Police Station in the morning of 10/03. SNG police conducted a security operation in the area where the explosion took place and several people suspected of having link with the IED incident were arrested. Two civilian bystanders were injured.

Somaliland forces from Oog village near Caynabo on the main road to Laas Caanood were dispatched to Ceegaag village (48km N of Buuhoodle) in the morning of 10/03. Initial reports suggest that the forces take over the village without resistance from Khatumo forces who were based there. The movement of Somaliland troops and the takeover triggered tensions and panic in the local inhabitants in the area.
Tags: Local Source Project Non-violent transfer of territory

NOTES: At least two civilians were killed and nine others wounded in a bomb planted in a tea shop in Garbaharey explodes. No group has yet to claim responsibility.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM/SNG forces launched an attack against al Shabaab fighters in Miir-Taqwo (53km NE of Jowhar) in the morning of 10/03. Heavy fighting followed where both sides exchanged different types of weapons. Two combatants from both sides were killed in the clash.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: An ISWA soldier abducted a civilian man and later killed him in the vicinity of Mayafulka (7km NE of Baidoa Town) in the afternoon of 10/03. The victim was travelling on a mini-bus to Mogadishu when the incident happened. The victim hails from Marehan while the perpetrator hails from Rahanweyn/Leysan sub-clan. The motive is believed to be clan revenge and the perpetrator was later arrested.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: A group of unidentified Wabxo-area militia attacked a group of al Shabaab during the evening hours of 11/03, killing four.

Galmudug forces launched an attack against a group of unidentified armed militias who erected an illegal road-block in Godin Labe Village (46km NE of Dhusamareeb) in the afternoon of 11/03. The fighting lasted for almost one hour after which the Galmudug forces overpowered the militiamen and managed to destroy the illegal road-block. Two men from the militias and a civilian bystander were reportedly killed in the clashes.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: An IED planted in a teashop exploded in Qansax Dheere in the evening of 11/03. The security forces conducted security operations after the explosion and arrested seventy people in connection with the explosion. Two people were killed and five others were injured in the blast.

Local residents staged anti-Somaliland demonstration in Buuhoodle on 11/03 while also expressed their support to Khatumo administration. The protest was triggered following deployment of Somaliland forces in the areas of Ceegaag village. The protestors marched in the streets of the town chanting anti-Somaliland slogans and burnt tires. The rally was reportedly organized by the Khatumo administration.

Unidentified armed group believed to be from Habar-Jeclo opened fire at vehicle (Toyota Noah) belonging to Dhulbahante/Reer Hayaag sub-clan in the area of Oog village (23km E of Caynabo) on 11/03 after attempts to stop the vehicle failed. The vehicle was ferrying passengers from Burco to Buuhoodle when he incident happened and the driver speed off and managed to escape unhurt. The incident is reportedly related to previous killing of Habar-Jeclo man by Dhulbahante militias in Geed Xamarka near Carro Weyn village (45km NE of Buuhoodle). This incident triggered tensions in the area especially local travellers between Burco, Laas Caanood and Buuhoodle. No casualties were reported.

Eight are wounded when a roadside bomb targeted a group of government soldiers in Kismayo on 12/03. Of the wounded, four were solders and four were civilians who were injured after the solders opened fire indiscriminately in response to the blast.

Eight are wounded when a roadside bomb targeted a group of government soldiers in Kismayo on 12/03. Of the wounded, four were solders and four were civilians who were injured after the solders opened fire indiscriminately in response to the blast.

Two groups from Khatumo and Somaliland forces reportedly exchanged gunfire which lasted for a few minutes in the vicinity of Ceegaag Village (48km N of Buuhoodle) in the afternoon of 12/03. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: An explosive device suspected to be a RCIED targeted against a group of tax collectors in the vicinity of Hawo Tako neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the morning of 12/03. The Deputy DC of Afgooye Mr. Mahdi Ahmed Hassan stated the authorities are still investigating what caused the explosion. Eight people including civilians were injured in the blast. No arrest was reported in connection with this incident.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Kenya air forces launch attacks against al Shabaab locations at Reys Qode. "Several" reported killed, no specific numbers given.

Local youths staged demonstration in Carmo (100km S of Bossaso) in the morning of 12/03 in protest against increased transport fares in the town. The demonstration turned in to violent after the protesting youths started throwing stones at vehicles using the main road (Qardho Bossaso road) hence disrupting traffic movement. Police arrived at scene, dispersed the protestors and arrested about 20 youths and later taken them to Carmo Police Station. No reports of casualties during the demonstration.
Al Shabaab fighters beheaded a local elder in the outskirts of Xarardheere Town in the night of 12/03. The motive behind the killing is currently unknown.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters attacked SNG forces conducting a security operation in the vicinity of Ceel-Cali (64km SW of Beled Weyne) in the morning of 13/03. Both sides briefly exchanged gunfire after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties are unknown.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters hurled a hand grenade against a group of SNA soldiers on foot patrol in the vicinity of Beytu-raas (Marka) in the evening of 13/03. Casualties are unknown. The perpetrators escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Al Shabaab attackers hurled a hand grenade against SNG soldiers' position in Qoryooley in the night of 13/03. The soldiers opened gunfire in response to the attack. Two soldiers were injured in the blast. The perpetrators escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier in Shalaambood (10km W of Marka Town) in the evening of 13/03. The motive behind the attack is unknown and the perpetrators escaped. A security operation was conducted the following day leading to 100 arrests.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Two men armed with pistols shot and seriously injured a civilian man in Bakara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the afternoon of 13/03. The man was working for Dahabshiil Money Transfer and was on his way home when the incident happened. The motive behind the attack is unknown while the attackers escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Galmudug Daraawiish forces attacked a police outpost near Cadado Police Station in the morning of 14/03. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Two police officers were reportedly injured in the shooting and the motive behind the attack is currently unknown.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Djiboutian coast guards engaged in shooting with Somaliland coast guards in Ceebaad Island (16km N of Zeylac) on 14/03. One Somaliland soldier was killed and two others injured in the shooting. Casualties from the Djiboutian side is unknown and the motive of the shooting is currently unclear.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Militia groups reportedly affiliated to Puntland and Galmudug administrations clashed in the vicinity of Damerale Village (45km E of Galkacyo) in the afternoon of 14/03. The clashes reportedly broke out due to ethnic tension related to theft in the area. Both sides reportedly deployed more militias to the area. Eleven combatants were killed (Radio Kulmiye) in the clash and three others were injured.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Al Shabaab gains control of Garcad on the evening of 14/03, no reported violence. Between 200-400 al Shabaab left the village the following morning, heading North East along the coastal line.
Tags: Local Source Project Non-violent transfer of territory

NOTES: Two gunmen from Habarjeclo/Soolamadaw sub clan shot and killed a truck driver from Dhulbahante/Samakaab sub-clan in City Plaza neighbourhood (Burco) in the morning of 14/03. The motive of the killing is said to be revenge against the killing of Habarjeclo herder by Dhulbahante gunmen in Buuhoodle. The perpetrators initially escaped but were later seized by the police.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Unidentified gunmen shot and killed two young men in the vicinity of Buulo Jaan neighbourhood (Marka) in the night of 14/03. The motive is believed to be clan revenge. The two victims hail from Dir clan and the perpetrators escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: ISWA/SNG forces conducted a security operation and clashed with suspected al Shabaab fighters in Kurman Village (21km NW of Diinsoor) on 15/03. The joint forces took over the village for two hours before they retreated to their main base in Diinsoor. One suspected al Shabaab fighter and one ISWA soldier were killed in the operation.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-Government regains territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: An al Shabaab assault on a AMISOM-KDF camp in Afmadow on 15/03 causes 19 al Shabaab dead following the Kenyan response.
Tags: Daily Independent (Nigeria) Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against a group of SNG soldiers in Qoryooley in the evening of 15/03. Three soldiers and three civilian bystanders were reportedly injured in the attack and the perpetrators escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Al Shabaab gains control of Garmaal on the morning of 15/03, no reported violence.
Tags: Local Source Project Non-violent transfer of territory

NOTES: Kulmiye political party supporters staged a demonstration against a delegation from Wadani political party who went to the area to receive new members to the party. The demonstrators threw stones at the delegation which led to clashes between the supporters of the two political parties. Police arrived at the scene and arrested more than 10 people from the two sides.
Al Shabaab abducts three humanitarian workers from Siidimo on 15/03.
Tags: Shabelle Media Network Violence against civilians

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters carried out an attack against Jubaland forces in Afmadow Town in the early morning of 16/03. Reports indicate that five battle wagons including two big trucks carrying fighters penetrated into the town and launched an attack on Afmadow Police Station using different kinds of weapons including hand mortars, RBGs, automatic machine guns and several hand grenades. The fighting lasted about an hour and two Jubaland soldiers were killed while three others were injured. Several houses were also burnt by stray bullets and hand grenades. The al Shabaab fighters retreated from the town and casualties from al Shabaab side remains unknown.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters and Puntland forces clashed near Garmaal Village (144km SW of Bandar Beyla) in the morning of 16/03. The fighting was reportedly initiated by Puntland forces who launched an attack against al Shabaab positions in the village. Both sides reportedly suffered casualties but exact figures remain unknown.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against SNG forces outpost in Bakaara junction (Hawl-Wadaag side) in the night of 16/03. No causalities, the perpetrators escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Al Shabaab ambushes a Kenyan convoy at Kolbiyow, destroying the vehicle and killing eight.

Khatumo forces ambushed Somaliland forces in Widh Widh Village (49km NE of Buuhoodle) in the night of 16/03. The two sides reportedly engaged in fierce fighting that went on for hours after which Khatumo forces withdrew. No causalities were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Puntland forces attacked al Shabaab fighters in Bad-Qado area near Godobjiraan Village (70km NE of Jariiban) on the afternoon of 17/03. Reports indicate that the two sides engaged in a heavy fighting that lasted for hours. Casualties could not be established. The al Shabaab fighters involved in the clash arrived on boats in Garacad on the evening of 14/03 and were about 400 fighters.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Seventy al Shabaab are killed and 30 captured during four days of fighting (17-20/03) with Puntland forces in Suuj, Nugaal.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed SNA forces’ convoy in the vicinity of Gol-Weyn Village (22km SW of Marka) in the morning of 17/03. The forces were transporting food supplies to SNA forces in Buulo Mareer when they were attacked. Both sides exchanged gunfire which lasted for about an hour. Casualties from both sides remain unknown at this stage.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Two suspected al Shabaab fighters armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG police officer in Warta Nabaada (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the afternoon of 17/03. The victim was the head of investigations in the Warta Nabaada neighbourhood. The perpetrators managed to escape.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: A SNG police vehicle was targeted with an IED in Dhagaxtuur section (Afgooye) in the morning of 17/03. The driver and another soldier were injured in the blast.
Unidentified drones reportedly bombed al Shabaab position in Suuj Village (81km SW of Bandar Beyla) in the night of 17/03.  Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: A KDF convoy was targeted with an IED in Gulshu, a farmland located between Kolbiyow and Raskambooni along the border (approx. 45km SW of Badhaadhe) in the afternoon of 17/03. Casualties are unknown.
Al Shabaab fighters fired mortar rounds against the bases of Puntland Army at Af Urur area of Galgala on the night of 17/03. Casualties could not be established.

Residents of Zeylac on 17/03 held a peaceful demonstration in protest against the killing of a Somaliland coast guard by Djiboutian marines on 14/03. The protesters accused Djibouti government of violating Somaliland territorial waters. They called on Somaliland government to defend its borders.
Al Shabaab attacks a police checkpoint at Bossaso the evening of 18/03. Two police reported dead.
Tags: Somali Memo  Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM base in Ceel-Baraf (55km NE of Jowhar) in the night of 18/03. Both sides exchanged gunfire for almost twenty minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Seventy al Shabaab are killed and 30 captured during four days of fighting (17-20/03) with Puntland forces in Suuj, Nugaal.

Khatumo forces reportedly carried out a hit-and-run attack against Somaliland forces based in Qorilugud area (46 km NW of Buuhoodle) on 18/03. Somaliland forces reportedly responded to attack with heavy weaponry fire. Casualties could not be established.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Puntland police forces outpost in Warshad Galay in Garsoor Neighbourhood (Galkacyo North) on the evening of 18/03. No casualties, the perpetrators escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces in Shalaambood fired mortars against civilian populated areas in Abiikarow (13km W of Marka) in the night of 18/03. The mortars landed on a pastoralist family and reportedly injured a civilian while also killing a large number of goats. The incident was confirmed also by Shalaambood chief but AMISOM did not comment on this.
Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a khat vehicle near Komorogoof village (32km SW of Doolow) on 18/03. The vehicle and the cargo was burned and the driver was taken to an unknown location.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Seventy al Shabaab are killed and 30 captured during four days of fighting (17-20/03) with Puntland forces in Suuj, Nugaal.
Unidentified assailants attack a police outpost at Garsoor on 19/03. No causalities reported.
Tags: Shabelle Media Network  Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: SNGF conducted a security operation in Ceel Jelow (19km S of Waajid) on 19/03. One al Shabaab fighter was killed. The security operation was conducted to flush out al Shabaab fighters who are engaged to destroy civilian property which is intended to be transported to ENDF/SNGF in Waajid. The forces returned back to their base in Waajid.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Unidentified gunmen believed to be Biimaal attacked a farm in Macalinka Village (Afgooye District) in the night of 19/03. The guards of the farm exchanged gunfire with the attackers for few minutes after which the attackers withdrew. The farm belongs to a Habar Gidir man. One of the farm employees was killed in the attack.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters attacked AMISOM-KDF logistic convoy contingent heading to Afmadow and started with an IED detonation followed by heavy exchange of gun fire at Abaya Bilow grazing area near Xaya Village (about 45km SW from Afmadow Town) on 19/02 afternoon. The attack lasted more than three hours and both sides have exchanged small and heavy arms fire. One APC and one big truck (lorry-loaded with assorted items) were heavily damaged by the IED and RBP fire. Two helicopters reached the location later for rescue reasons and over three hundred JLF forces from Afmadow and Dhoobley were also brought in and the convoy spent the night at the point where the ambush happened. Two JLF and seven others from AMISOM soldiers were reportedly killed, two JLF soldiers and ten AMISOM soldiers were injured. Agence France Presse claims 21 dead.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Police shot and injured three people at voters’ registration centre in Berbera on the morning of 19/03. The incident happened after applicants for the voters’ cards surged and rushed to get the card which led to disorder.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a civilian man in Gol-Weyn (22km W of Marka) in the evening of 19/03. The victim was a khat dealer and he used to sell khat to the SNG forces in Buulo Mareer. The motive behind the killing is unknown and no group claimed responsibility.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: SNGF/ISWA jointly carried out an attack against an al Shabaab base where al Shabaab demanded zakat animals from pastoralist in Bandhumi Village (15km NE of Diinsoor) in the early morning of 20/03. Reliable sources indicate that the fighting between the combatants resulted in three al Shabaab fighters being killed and no causalities/injuries reported on SNGF side.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Unidentified assailants hurled a hand grenade against a mobile checkpoint setup in the proximity of Bosasso Main Market on the evening of 20/03. Reports indicate that the grenade landed on an empty place and the perpetrator(s) managed to escape. Police opened fire after the blast. There were no immediate reports of casualties or arrest, though one death was recorded later by the Shabelle Media Network.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Seventy al Shabaab are killed and 30 captured during four days of fighting (17-20/03) with Puntland forces in Suuj, Nugaal.

Puntland forces attacked al Shabaab fighters in Tabakaraale area (about 60km SE of Jariiban) in the morning of 20/03. Reports indicate that the two sides engaged in a heavy fighting. Casualties could not be established.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against a group of SNG soldiers on foot patrol in the vicinity of Jamhuuriya (Karaan District) in the night of 20/03. Injuries, fatalities not known. Perpetrators escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a police officer in Matabaan town (63km NE of Beled Weyne) in the morning of 20/03. The motive behind the killing is believed to be dispute over the ownership of a local water reservoir. The perpetrators escaped but they are being pursued.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters fired several mortar rounds followed by a hit and run attack against the positions of Puntland Darwish forces in an area between Af-Urur and Sugure of Galgala (40km S of Bosasso) on the evening of 20/03.
