The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire that lasted for about 30 minutes after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Reports indicate that one of the militants was killed.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Reports indicate that an armed clash between Puntland security forces and alleged al Shabaab fighters occurred near Yakayake Village (30km S of Qardho) on 20/03. Reports indicate the fighting started after local community informed the security forces who attacked the al Shabaab fighters. The al Shabaab fighters were reportedly part of those who fought in Suuj area and were escaping presumably towards Galgala. The clash lasted for an hour. One soldier and seven al Shabaab fighters were reportedly killed. Other al Shabaab fled from the scene.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Unidentified war planes conducted several airstrikes at Sindigow (42km SW and Jigesa, approx. 37km SW of Afmadow) on 20/02. No casualties. The targets of the air strikes are not known.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against the residence of a prominent Puntland politician called Mohamed Ali Yusuf “Gaagaab” in the evening of 20/03. The explosive landed in an empty space and no causalities were reported.
ISWA security forces on security patrol discovered a RCIED hidden in a metal container close to their base in Garas Weyne (49km NW of Xudur) on 20/03. Two al Shabaab suspects were arrested.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters opened indiscriminate gunfire against a civilian bus in the outskirt of Buulo Mareer (29km W of Marka) in the morning of 20/03. The bus left Buulo Mareer and was heading to Jeerow Village when the incident happened. The motive behind the attack is unclear. Three passengers were reportedly killed in the attack and two others were injured. Perpetrators escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against SNG forces’ base in Carbiska (5km SE of Afgooye) in the morning of 21/03. The attack was simultaneous with al Shabaab fighters’ raid on Lantabuur SNA base. It is believed the intention was to prevent any military reinforcement that could go to Lantabuur. Both sides exchanged gunfire before the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Puntland forces attacked al Shabaab fighters in Garacad area (60km E of Jariiban) in the morning of 21/03. Reports indicate that the two sides engaged in a heavy fighting. Casualties could not initially be established, though the governor later confirmed 10 al Shabaab dead.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Heavily armed al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against SNA base in Lantabuur (12km SW of Afgooye) in the morning of 21/03. A fierce fighting went on more than an hour after which the attackers took over the base. Al Shabaab claimed killing dozens of SNA soldiers in the attack, but these claims could not be independently verified. Neutral sources confirmed that al Shabaab seized three battle wagons, three other vehicles including a water bowser and a lorry. Al Shabaab left the base before the sunrise and went towards Aw-Dheegle town.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-Non-state actor overtakes territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Reports indicate a refugee returnees convoy from Kenya Dadaab camp have survived air booming conducted by suspected Kenyan fighters Jets near Waraha Dhobley (approx. 100km SW of Bu’aale). No human and property damage reported from the scene and returnees proceeded with their travel the following day safely. The targets of the bombing are not known.

A RCIED was targeted against SNG forces vehicle passing in Tii-da neighbourhood (Daynile) in the afternoon of 21/03. The explosion hit the vehicle causing the death of a soldier and the injury of three others. Following the attack security forces made several arrests.
Al-Shabaab in Lower Jubba have spread bullets at a crowd that was  cutting down vegetation for use in burning of charcoal in the locality of Buur Gaabo. Three deaths reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against a group of SNA personnel on foot patrol in Beyturaas neighbourhood (Marka) in the evening of 22/03. Casualties not reported. Perpetrators escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: SNG forces on foot patrol and a group of al Shabaab fighters engaged in a brief armed clash in the vicinity of Barakaat Cemetery (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 22/03. Both sides exchanged gunfire before the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Suspected Kenyan war planes targeted al Shabaab bases at Beer Yamaarug (65km SW of Bu’aale town) on 22/03. Residents report there were repeated airstrikes at this location which is deep in the bush. Casualties are unknown because the area is a closed zone for al Shabaab fighters and pastoralists are banned from using roads leading to it for grazing.

More than 200 people staged a peaceful demonstration in Bosasso on 22/03 to support and celebrate the victory of Puntland Defence Forces in their recent clashes with al Shabaab fighters in Suuj Village (Bandar Beyla). The demonstrators marched on the main tarmac road, near the market and municipality council of Bosasso. Police took all security measures and the rally ended peacefully.

A group of Toyota Noah drivers from Dhulbahante staged a demonstration in Laas Caanood on 22/03 in protest against Salama Bus Company after it brought buses from Burco which have cheaper fare than the Noah vehicles. These new buses will ply from Laas Caanood to Hargeisa. They were chanting of not tolerating this new company.

Dir clan militiamen affiliated to Puntland administration killed three suspected al Shabaab fighters near Towfiiq Village (66km S of Jariiban) in the morning of 23/03. The incident happened after local pastoralists tipped off the Dir militia about the presence of seven al Shabaab fighters in area. The three were killed after they refused to surrender. The other four were arrested. It remains unclear whether they will be handed over to Puntland authorities.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Al Shabaab forces gain control of Af Barwaaqo following an Galmugug retreat on 23/03.
Tags: Shabelle Media Network  Non-violent transfer of territory

NOTES: Puntland police forces arrest 156 al-Shabaab suspects during a security sweep in Bossaso.

Galmudug forces reportedly attacked al Shabaab fighters in Af-barwaaqo area (130km N of Hobyo) in the morning of 24/03. Reports indicate that the two sides engaged in a heavy fighting. Casualties could not be established. The previous day Galmudug forces had retreated from the town giving al Shabaab control of the area.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: An ISWA Darawish soldier was shot and killed and his colleague wounded by suspected al Shabaab fighters inside Qansaxdheere on 24/03. The perpetrators managed to escape.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Kenya air forces launch attacks against al Shabaab near Baadhaade. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Kenya air forces launch attacks against al Shabaab near Jilib. Causalities not known.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in the vicinity of Ruusiya (Marka) in the evening of 24/03. The motive behind the killing is not known but unconfirmed report stated that the victim sent text messages to a number of Marka residents pretending to be al Shabaab member before he was targeted. Perpetrators escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Galmudug forces and al Shabaab fighters reportedly clashed again in an area near Af-barwaaqo Village (130km N of Hobyo) in the morning of 25/03. Reports indicate that the two sides engaged in a heavy fighting. It is reported that Galmudug forces killed 'a number' of al Shabaab fighters. Galmudug lost an officer. Unconfirmed reports suggest that al Shabaab fighters destroyed a battle wagon belonging to Galmudug forces.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Security forces dispatched from Qardho to conduct search operations clashed with a group of al Shabaab fighters in Bixin area (Bandar Beyla District) in the afternoon of 25/03. The security forces over-powered the al Shabaab fighters who were hiding in the area and managed to arrest 17 militants. Two police officers and one al Shabaab fighter were injured in the clash. The al Shabaab fighters are believed to be those who had escaped from Suuj Valley during the recent anti-al Shabaab operations.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNG forces outpost in the vicinity of Black Sea (Hodan District) in the night of 25/03. Both sides exchanged gunfire before the attackers withdrew. No Casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Khatumo forces carried out a hit-and-run attack against Somaliland troops in Widhwidh Village (49km N of Buuhoodle) on 25/03. Somaliland forces reportedly responded with light and heavy weaponry fire during the clash which lasted for an hour after which the Khatumo forces withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ALLY_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Somali troops backed by AMISOM soldiers have "pushed" al Shabaab out of villages in the outskirts of Wajid town. No reported violence.
Tags: Shabelle Media Network  Non-violent transfer of territory

NOTES: A group of youths demonstrated against the governor during a visit to visit to Ceel Gaal (50km SW of Zeylac)on 25/03. The group was complaining of the current severe drought in the area and lack of response from the Somaliland government. They also accused the government of not initiating development projects in the village. The youths reported shouted anti-Somaliland slogans. Efforts by the governor to persuade them calm down bore no fruit, forcing him to leave the village. No violence reported.
Unidentified men shoot and kill a Quran teacher following Friday prayers. Four men were arrested the following day. The motive of the murder is not known.
Tags: Shabelle Media Network  Violence against civilians

NOTES: Unidentified gunmen shot and killed two local businessmen in Ceel-Baraf Village (55km NE of Jowhar) in the evening of 25/03. The reason behind the killing is unknown.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM forces base in Ceelasha (12km SE of Afgooye) in the night of 26/03. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers retreated. Casualties are unknown.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Galmudug forces and al Shabaab fighters clashed in Galhagoog Village (130km N of Hobyo) on the afternoon of 26/03. Galmudug authorities reportedly said that their soldiers had killed about 20 al Shabaab fighters in the clash and captured and others.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed SNA forces on the road between Biyo-Cado and Ceel-baraf (Jowhar District) in the afternoon of 26/03. Both sides reportedly engaged in a serious exchange of gunfire after which the SNA convoy went back to Biyo-Cado. The SNA forces left Biyo-Cado and were heading to Ceel-Baraf Village when the incident happened. Casualties are unknown.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: SNA and NISA forces exchanged gunfire in the vicinity of KM4 neighbourhood (Wadajir/Medina District) in the night of 26/03. The clash started after SNA personnel on a military pick-up ignored NISA checkpoint after which the NISA personnel responded with gunfire. The SNA pick-up stopped, and they were released after identification. One SNA soldier was reportedly injured in the armed clash.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Hundreds of Mogadishu residents staged a public rally against UN’s Somalia and Eritrea Monitoring Group (SEMG) in Daljirka Dahsoon (Boondheere District) on 26/03 morning. The demonstrators demanded the Federal Government of Somalia to take serious measures on the threat posed by SEMG to Somali people and public institutions. The rally was peaceful and it was organized by leaders of civil society. The protestors were waving slogans highlighting the alleged violation of the SEMG on both public and private individuals in Somalia, which dedicated its resources to defame individuals to the extent of alleging innocent citizens as suicide bombers in one of its reports.

Several youths attacked Crown Hotel with sticks and stones in Koodbuur District (Hargeisa) on the evening of 26/03. The motive remains unclear. Four people were injured in the attack. Three vehicles were also destroyed in the attack. The group escaped before the arrival of the police.

A group of youth from a local sports organization staged a demonstration against the regional sports director in Laas Caanood on 26/03. Although the motive is unclear, unconfirmed reports suggest that the demonstration might have been organized by pro-Khatumo diaspora who are on visit to Laas Caanood and organizing a football tournament.
Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade against a teashop in Qoryooley in the afternoon of 26/03. The bomb missed the target and landed on an empty place causing no casualties.
Police open fire on a group of anti-Hassan Sheikh Mohamud protesters, wounding three. No reported violence from the demonstrators.
Tags: Shabelle Media Network  Violence against civilians

NOTES: Al Shabaab killed at least 5 charcoal labours, burnt property and took away over 10 vehicles in Buscbusc (30km SE of Badhaadhe) and Kidi Faani Village (30km SE of Badhaadhe) on the night of 26/03. Reason is said that the area residents opposed the al Shabaab role and refused to pay tax.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

ALLY_ACTOR_2: UCID: Justice and Welfare Party of Somaliland
NOTES: Unidentified gunmen attacked the residence of Berbera UCID party representative in Gacan Libah District (Hargeisa) on the evening of 26/03. The motive is unknown. The gunmen injured the daughter of the party official and escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Al Shabaab killed at least 5 charcoal labours, burnt property and took away over 10 vehicles in Buscbusc (30km SE of Badhaadhe) and Kidi Faani Village (30km SE of Badhaadhe) on the night of 26/03. Reason is said that the area residents opposed the al Shabaab role and refused to pay tax.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: An unidentified perpetrator hurled a hand grenade at a mobile police check point in the vicinity of NECTO area in Bosasso on the evening of 27/03. The perpetrator managed to escape. No reports of casualties, injuries.
A RCIED planted under a tree frequented by SNG forces detonated in Buurane Village (19km N of Jowhar) in the afternoon of 27/03. Casualties are unknown or not numbered. No arrests were reported.

Teachers in Ceel-Afweyn staged a demonstration against Education Director of Sanaag Region on 27/03 and accused him of not paying them their training per diems following after Sanaag Ministry of Education held a training in Ceerigaabo for all teachers of the region. Ceel-Afweyn Police forces arrived at the scene and dispersed the demonstrators but no arrest was made.
Al Shabaab forces gain control of Ceel Baraf on 27/03 following a SNGF retreat the previous day. No reported violence.
Tags: Local Source Project Non-violent transfer of territory

NOTES: Scuffles broke out between two youth groups from Habar Yonis and Habar Jeclo sub-clans in Barwaaqo neighbourhood (Ceerigaabo) on 27/03 following a dispute over territorial control. Ceerigaabo police intervened, shot in the air and arrested four youths from both sides.

Al Shabaab fighters reportedly clashed with armed militias loyal to the former governor of Bari Region in Gurur Village (65km SE of Qandala) in the morning of 27/03. The two groups exchanged heavy gun fire which lasted for about half an hour. One the governor’s militiamen was injured in the clash. The clash ends the non-official ‘no-aggression agreement’ between al Shabaab and the governor’s militia. The disgruntled politician has been seeking refuge among his kinsmen in the area after leaving Bosasso following reports that the government had been planning to arrest him over demonstrations in Bosasso.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a businessman inside a mosque in the vicinity of Puntland Cinema (Heliwa District) in the night of 27/03. The victim was a well-known businessman called Sade Mahad Dirir. He was the owner of the residence of former Mogadishu mayor General Muungaab. Perpetrators escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Unidentified gunmen raided the residence of a NISA officer and killed him in the morning of 27/03. The wife of the officer was also injured in the shooting. The motive behind the attack is currently unknown. Hodan District Police stated that they are still investigating the matter. Perpetrators escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: A male body was found inside the compound of Jubaland minister for international relations (MOPIR) on 27/03. The reasons is not clear as there are two conflicting reports.  One version states that the man was killed because he sexually assaulted a woman while the other version suggest that he was killed by the minister’s body guards after he attempted to kill the minister.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Gunmen believed to be from Dhulbahante/Farah Ali sub-clan shot and seriously injured a civilian man from Dhulbahante/Samakaab Ali Sub-clan in Farax Xaskule neighbourhood in Laas Caanood on 27/03 over revenge killings between the two sub-clans. The perpetrators escaped. Tension ran high between the two sub-clans leading to police forces conducting security operations in the evening of 28/03. No arrest was reported during the operation.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Unidentified attackers hurled hand grenade against SNG soldiers in the vicinity of Salama Hotel (Hawl-Wadaag District) and against Wadajir District Police Station in the evening of 27/03. No casualties were reported in either attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM forces base in Mudul-Brawe (5km NW of Baraawe) in the night of 27/03. The fighting lasted for twenty minutes after which the al Shabaab attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: An unidentified attacker hurled a hand grenade against a crowd of civilians and SNG soldiers in Qoryooley town on 27/03 afternoon. Following the attack, SNG forces conducted security operation and arrested 50 suspects in connection with the attack. A civilian bystander was injured in the attack.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Armed men from Jajele car-jacked a private lorry belonging to a Xawadle man in the Halgan section in the west of the town on 28/03. SNG police forces managed to get the lorry back but one hijacker was injured during the exercise. The incident is related to previous clan issues.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: An IED was attached to a place frequented by ISWA/SNA forces in Berdale (approx. 51km W of Baidoa) in the morning of 28/03. Reports indicate that the IED exploded near Berdale town entrance checkpoint. No casualties or injuries were reported from the blast and no one was captured in connection of the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted against ENDF convoy in the vicinity of Ceel-Laheley (Ceel Bur District) in the morning of 28/03. The device reportedly hit a vehicle and destroyed it. The convoy was travelling between Dhusamareeb and Ceel-Bur when the incident happened. Sources confirmed casualties although the exact figures are unknown.
Government troops are attacked by al Shabaab in the Biyo Dageenka area of Hawl Wagaag on the evening of 28/03. Causalities not known.
Tags: Radio Al-Furqaan  Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNG force’s outpost near the livestock market (Heliwa District) in the night of 28/03. Both sides engaged each other using different types of gunfire including RPGs. Casualties from both sides are unknown.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Mortar rounds from unknown origin fall on Leego the night of 28/03. Casualties not known or reported.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNG and AMISOM forces’ bases in Qoryooley town in the night of 28/03.  Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Unconfirmed number of al Shabaab fighters were injured in the clashes.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Police officers were attacked with several hand grenades in Laanta Towfiiq, Yaaqshiid. The sound of the grenade explosions could be heard in the surrounding area. Two injuries reported.
Tags: Radio Al-Furqaan  Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Intelligence forces' headquarters at Baar Ayaan junction of Yaaqshiid were attacked with hand grenades. After the grenade attack, intelligence forces opened heavy gunfire. Perpetrators, causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: A road-side bomb from unknown origin exploded, targeting Ethiopian forces in Berdale on 29/03. Five deaths, other wounded reported

Puntland forces and clan militias reportedly from Dashishe sub-clan clashed in Dalweyne Village (84km N of Qardho) on the afternoon of 29/03.  The fighting, which lasted for about an hour, broke out after the clan militias attempted to establish an illegal check point. Additional security forces were dispatched to the area. One soldier and two clan militias were reportedly wounded. The security forces seized a battle wagon and other unspecified number of weapons from the clan militia. The clan militia fled the area after the clash.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: NISA Forces captured a vehicle (Toyota Carib) loaded with explosives in the vicinity of Taleex neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the morning of 29/03. The NISA conducted the operation acting on information received from the public. Three AK47 rifles were also seized by the security forces. The NISA dismantled the explosives. It is not clear if the suspected were arrested.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at a group of police forces in the vicinity of Black Sea (Hodan District) in the night of 29/03. No casualties were reported and the attackers escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ALLY_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: SNA/AMISOM forces conducted a security operation against al Shabaab fighters in Laanti-Garaska Village (60km SE of Waajid Town) in the morning of 29/03. Reports indicate that both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew from the area. No casualties were reported.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Three gunmen from Dhulbahante/Wacays sub-clan shot and injured a pastoralist man hailing from Habar-Jeclo/Ahmed Farah sub-clan in the vicinity of Qorilugud (46km NW of Buuhoodle) on 29/03. The perpetrators are believed to be pro-Khatumo militias and their motive is currently unclear.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched a frontal attack on government intelligence forces at the former court building in Suuqa Xoolaha, Mogadishu on 29/03. Casualties not known.
Tags: Radio Al-Furqaan  Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Unidentified gunmen shot and killed the chairman of Siinaay business community in the vicinity of Siinaay (Wardhiigley District) in the morning of 29/03. The motive behind the killing is unknown and the perpetrators escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Unidentified gunmen in a drive-by shooting sprayed bullets against a car carrying a group of doctors in Taleex neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the evening of 30/03. The victims were working for DEVA Hospital, A private Turkish hospital in Mogadishu. The motive behind the attack is currently unknown.  Two Turkish doctors and four Somali nationals including three doctors were killed while five other Turkish nationals and a Kenya teacher were injured in the same attack. Somalia Prime minister condemned the attacked and termed it a massacre while also sending condolence message to the relatives of the victims saying that he shares the pain with them.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Unidentified gunmen opened gunfire against a teashop where a SNA soldier and some civilians were sitting in the vicinity of ex-Control Afgooye (Hodan District) in the evening of 30/03. The motive behind the attack is unknown but it is believed that the SNA soldier was the target. The SNA soldier and at least three civilian bystanders were killed in the attack. The perpetrators escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Violence against civilians

NOTES: Police discover and remove a hidden explosive of unknown origin planted in a Baardheere police station on 30/03.

A group of youths together with community leaders staged a peaceful demonstration in Ceerigaabo in the morning of 30/03 in support of the postponement of the ongoing voters registration exercise for a month in order to address the current drought in the country.

A magnetic IED attached to a vehicle detonated in the vicinity of Macalin Nuur neighbourhood (Dharkenleey District) in the evening of 30/03. The vehicle reportedly belonged to one of the parliament staff and the incident happened at the gate of his residence. No casualties were reported.

Pro-Khatumo militias reportedly open fire against pastoralist from Habar-Jeclo travelling near Dhilaalo village (27km NE of Buuhoodle) on 30/03.  Reports indicate that the pastoralists shot back in defence forcing the attackers to retreat back. The motive behind the attack is currently unclear. Causalities/injuries not known.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

NOTES: Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at police security outpost in Bakara junction (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the night of 30/03. No casualties were reported. Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against a group of police officers on foot patrol near Hawl-wadaag Police Station (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the night of 30/03. The device reportedly missed the target causing no casualties. The attackers escaped.
Tags: Local Source Project Battle-No change of territory

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces fired artillery/mortar rounds from Leego (48km SE of Buur-Hakaba) in the morning of 30/03 following fears of possible attacks by al Shabaab fighters from that area. No casualties were reported.

SNG forces attacked a local militia (Makane/Bantu)  in Bundo Weyn on 31/03. In the exchange of gun fire one militia and one SNG soldier were injured. SNG forces confiscated a technical belonging to the clan militia. The reason for the attack and confiscation is unknown. No arrests were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM convoy in the outskirts of Ceel Lalelay (35km SE of Dhusamareeb) on 31/03. No casualties were reported.

NOTES: A suicide bomber detonated his suicide vest near Uunlaye Hotel in Israac neighbourhood (Galkacyo North) on the morning of 31/03. The suicide bomber was targeting Puntland’s Mudug regional chief accountant. Six people, including the chief accountant, some of his body guards and the suicide bomber, were killed in the blast. The al Shabaab military operation’s spokesperson Sheikh Abdiaziz Abu Muscab said that the al Shabaab was behind the blast.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a convoy of AMISOM and local militias near Janaale Village (14km NW of Marka) in the morning of 31/03. The exchange of gunfire lasted more than 30 minutes. The allied forces left from Buufow Bacaad and were heading towards Janaale when the incident happened. Casualties are unknown but two helicopters landed in Shalaambood and reportedly evacuated a number of injured UPDF soldiers.

NOTES: American drone strike reported against al Shabaab leader Hassan Ali Dhoore on 31/03 at a unnamed location 20 miles south of Jilib. A US defence official said the strike targeted a vehicle Dhoore was riding in with two other al Shabaab members.

Community activists and parents at Austerville Primary School, in Wentworth, are calling for the sacking of the newly appointed principal. Protesters first took to the streets on Monday, demonstrating outside the school, and continued on Thursday.

During ANC Branch Meetings in Gauteng, members were attacked in the towns of Winterveld and Bronkhorstspruit.

Protest action reportedly took place at the Acadia campus of TUTs. These protests are part of ongoing protests led by students and outsourced workers.

About 200 DA supporters gathered outside the Despatch town hall to protest the water leaks in Nelson Mandela Bay area.

Hundreds of Masiphumelele High School pupils staged a protest outside the school, barricading the gate with burning tyres and calling for the removal of the principal.
Residents held a picket in Newlands East over housing allocation.
DASO members continue to protest by staging a sit-in protest at NMMU.
Service delivery protests have been going on since Monday the 8th in Riverlea.
A suspected housebreaker was killed by a mob in Tickyline Village near Tzaneen after a pensioner was robbed
A correctional officer has been arrested for participating in a mob attack in Worcester which left one man dead.
Tags: The New Age (South Africa) Violence against civilians

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SALIPSWU: South African Liberated Public Sector Workers Union
NOTES: Workers and Cleaners downed tools and held peaceful protests outside UKZN's Howard and Westiville campuses. A memorandum was handed over by the South African Liberated Public Sector Workers Union
Stones were hurled at police and passers-by by community members in Robert Sobukwe Drive (near Bishop Lavis) after a suspected gang member was arrested.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: AMI: Alternative Mining Indaba; Students (South Africa)
NOTES: Two peaceful demonstrations took place in Cape Town. The first saw a sit-in outside the International Convention Centre in Cape Town, supported by the Alternative Mining Indaba and the Economic Justice Network. In the second event, students of Uxolo High School and Sizimisele Technical High School marched to the Western Cape Department of Education in Cape Town.
Parents protested outside a school in Dunoon over the lack of space in the local schools.
Protesters took to the streets, burning tyres, in New Brighton over service delivery.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: ANCYL: African National Congress Youth League
NOTES: ANCYL members protested outside the offices of ''The Witness'' Newspaper in Pietermaritzburg.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: DASO: Democratic Alliance Student's Organisation; SASCO: South Africa Students Congress
NOTES: DASO and SASCO members continue to protest by staging a sit-in protest at NMMU.
Protesters took to the streets, burning tyres in Riverlea. Police responded by firing rubber bullets at the protesters

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SALIPSWU: South African Liberated Public Sector Workers Union
NOTES: Workers and Cleaners downed tools and held peaceful protests outside UKZN's Howard and Westiville campuses. A memorandum was handed over by the South African Liberated Public Sector Workers Union

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SPRM: Ses'khona People's Rights Movement; EFF: Economic Freedom Fighters
NOTES: Ses’khona People’s Rights Movement have taken to the streets despite the group only having permission for a gathering in Cape Town. Protesters attempted to beak through a police fence but were held back. There were reports that stones and bottles were thrown at police. Later in the day, police clash with rioting EFF supporters during an anti-Zuma demonstration in central Cape Town.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: #ZumaMustFall; PAC: Pan African Congress; Students (South Africa)
NOTES: Peaceful demonstrations were held in Cape Town by #ZumaMustFall, PAC and students.
About 60 #ZumaMustFall protesters took to the streets in Durban.
Right2Know protesters are banned from protesting outside parliament so launch an anti-Zuma protest alongside Bhunga Avenue Kewton instead.
About 60 employees of Lafarge South Africa gathered at the company's Lichtenburg plant to protest after an agreement on their demands was not reached during negotiations.
About 250 residents blocked roads with burning tyres in New Brighton over the lack of service delivery.
A march took place in Pretoria by the #ZumaMustFall movement in a series of nationwide marchs for the state of the union address.

Residents took to the streets over water bills in Turfloop in Limpopo. The protest was met with burning tyres, timbers and drainage pipes, causing the police to use teargas and rubber bullets to disperse the protesters.
Two of three suspected robbers were killed after residents of Maake village attacked them for allegedly robbing a local supermarket.
Tags: African News Agency Violence against civilians

NOTES: Hundreds of ANC members rallied in East London and threatened to make the city ungovernable if the party leadership does not dissolve its regionals structure.
About 100 residents frustrated by train delays torched a minibus taxi and overturned two delivery vehicles before police arrived and arrested one person.

Service delivery protesters blocked the R72 near Zuney, just outside Alexandria. Some motorists attempted to move the branches the protesters used to block the road but were chased off without reported injuries.
Some students built a shack on the UCT campus as part of the #RhodesMustFall protest against a lack of student housing at UCT.
Students protested on the DUT campus following a student suicide related to a rejected funding application on Friday. The students were dispersed by police using stun grenades and pellet guns.

Hundreds of residents demonstrated against poor service delivery, using burning tires and other material to block roads. They clashed with police, who used tear gas, stun grenades, and rubber bullets to disperse them.
Protests over fees hit the DUT's Pietermaritzburg campus as well as its Durban campus, following a student suicide over a rejected funding application.
A group of nurses marched to the SA Nursing Council in Pretoria to demand better working conditions, before marching on to the department headquarters after no official would hear their grievances.
During service delivery protests, some residents in the Booysen Park area attempted to clear a blocked road and ended up in a clash with the protesters who were largely Xhosa.

SOURCE: GroundUp; IOL; Xinhua General News Service
NOTES: The #RhodesMustFall "Shackville" protest at UCT escalated after students broke into some residences and burnt university art and vehicles before police were able to intervene and disperse the protesters with stun grenades, while arresting 8. At least 6 students were suspended following the violence. At least 2 buildings were hit by petrol bombs, including the office of the Vice-Chancellor, although reports conflicted on whether this occurred during the protests on Feb.16 or 17.
Tags: GroundUp; IOL; Xinhua General News Service Riots/Protests

NOTES: About 60 high school students led by an EE representative protested outside the Department of Education offices in King William's Town to demand their matric certificates.

Students at WSU have engaged in violent protests between Feb.16-17, burning university property and vehicles, and looting cafeterias. The campus was shut down in response to the ongoing violence on Feb.16, with students being told to vacate their residences until calm could be restored.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SAMWU: South African Municipal Workers' Union
NOTES: As many as 500 SAMWU members marched in Pietermaritzburg against casual labour. They demanded that contract and casual labourers be made permanent employees.
#FeesWillFall student protesters protested to demand the suspesion of academic programmes so that the process of clearing debt, registration and residence placement can be completed.

A group of 30 UCT students occupied the university's administrative building to protest against the arrest and suspension of students in relation to the recent #RhodesMustFall "shackville" protests. They left half an hour later.

9 students, including an SRC leader, were arrested as private security and police cracked down on a protest by outsourced workers at the University of KwaZulu-Natal. The students were allegedly throwing stones at buildings and were protesting illegally.
North West University's Mahikeng Campus was shut down after "enraged students demanded that suspended SRC president Benz Mabengwane be reinstated."

Students at WSU have engaged in violent protests between Feb.16-17, burning university property and vehicles, and looting cafeterias. The campus was shut down in response to the ongoing violence on Feb.16, with students being told to vacate their residences until calm could be restored.

Residents of Sabie protested to demand a vacant piece of land be given to them to build houses. During the protests a truck was burnt, roads were barricaded, and the residents threatened to set fire to a number of buildings, including the local hospital.
Municipal workers in the Vyrheid area went on strike.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: DENOSA: Democratic Nursing Organisation of South Africa
NOTES: Around 1000 DENOSA members protested against the bad treatment of nurses in the province in Bhisho.

Students picketed outside the Western Cape Department of Education offices, demanding the end of the collaborative schools pilot project which is believed to be leading to the privitization of education.
Employees of Buffalo City's solid waste department went on strike over the lack of protective uniforms.

A group of residents of Kanana in Hammanskraal took to the streets and marched to give a memorandum to their ward councillor after other residents of the area started building shacks illegally on empty land.

SOURCE: The New Age (South Africa); The Times (South Africa)
NOTES: A bus was set on fire during violent protests on the Wits University campus.
Tags: The New Age (South Africa); The Times (South Africa) Riots/Protests

NOTES: AN EFF member was stabbed in the stomach during clashes with ANC members outside the Provincial government complex in Nelspruit.
Between 150 to 200 protesting employees of the High Court in Pietermaritzburg demanded that their grievances be addressed by picketing inside the building.
Nine people were arrested after protests on February 18 which saw residents plunder the home of two alleged murder suspects.

Scuffles broke out between students at the University of Pretoria over the institution's language policy. Members of the ANC, AfriForum Yotuh, the PYA and the EFFSC were all present. It was not clear which groups were involved in the clash. Later police arrived and clashed with the students who armed themselves with stones and set at least one tire on fire. 14 students were then arrested.
Residents of the Reeston area barricaded the only school in the area with tires and trees to demand housing and a meeting with their councillor.
A handful of ANC members protested outside the Western Cape legislature ahead of the State of the Province address by the premier.

ALLY_ACTOR_2: SANCO: South African National Civics Organization
NOTES: 9 people were arrested in Cofimvaba following a clash between ANC members and Nyanisweni residents led by SANCO members during a protest related to house demolitions.
Angry pupils of Tshehlwaneng in Jane Furse burned classrooms and staffrooms while vandalizing others during a protest against the principal, who they say assaults them.
14 people were arrested after protests at the University of Witwatersrand led to a bus and a mattress being set on fire.
A group of residents of Pharare Village in the area of Maake killed a man who was accused of being responsibl for a series of break-ins recently.

Residents from Schoemansdal, Driekoppies, Jeppes Reef, Buffelspruit and other areas marched to the Schoemansdal police station to protest the slow pace of police investigations into car thefts in the area.

Residents of Phagameng in Modimolle protested and blocked roads, including those between Modimolle and Naboomspruit, over water shortages. The protests later became violent, with police and demonstrators fighting for hours. The protesters threw rubble at police and forced stores to close, while the police opened fire with rubber bullets. At least 3 protesters were injured.

Two opposing protests occurred outside the Parys town magistrates court, one in favour of the 4 farmers charged with shooting two black men after they attacked an elderly landowner, and the other made up of about 200 black demonstrators in favour of the death penalty for the farmers.

SOURCE: News24; Xinhua General News Service; Cape Argus (South Africa)
NOTES: Students protested on the University of Pretoria campus to demand the end of instruction in Afrikaans. The students burned tires and threw rocks at police, who responded with rubber bullets. The protests also spilled onto nearby streets. The EFF says that 27 students were later arrested.
Tags: News24; Xinhua General News Service; Cape Argus (South Africa) Riots/Protests

NOTES: Thousands of ANC supporters marched for "unity, democracy" and against racism in Pretoria.
Between Feb.20-21, Vigilantes in Schoemansdal arrested five people suspected of being criminals who have been caused trouble in the area. Two of them were beaten to death and then set on fire.
500 youths from the YFN marched from the Pier 14 shopping centre to Nelson Mandela Bay's city hall to demand a crackdown on crime.
Between Feb.20-21, Vigilantes in Schoemansdal arrested five people suspected of being criminals who have been caused trouble in the area. Two of them were beaten to death and then set on fire.

SOURCE: The Herald (South Africa); The Daily Vox (Johannesburg); The Journalist (Cape Town)
NOTES: Student protesters were attacked by spectators when they attempted to occupy a Rugby pitch during a match. The protests were in support of outsourced workers on strike at the university. Police later arrived to restore calm. Some injuries were reported.
Tags: The Herald (South Africa); The Daily Vox (Johannesburg); The Journalist (Cape Town) Riots/Protests

SOURCE: AOL; Cape Times (South Africa); Cape Argus (South Africa)
NOTES: Classes at UWC have been disrupted and university property damaged in three days of protests against outsourcing between Feb.22-24. #FeesMustFall protesters and outsourced workers clashed with police and university security during the protests.
Tags: AOL; Cape Times (South Africa); Cape Argus (South Africa) Riots/Protests

NOTES: About 100 students caused disruptions throughout the Durban University of Technology's campus, discharging fire extinguishers, throwing stones, destroying property and attacking people over a lack of accommodations.
Gauteng Councillor Mbuyiselo Dokolwane was shot dead in Freedom Park in Johannesburg. It was not clear what led to the shooting.

Violence broke out between black students, largely from the EFF, and white students, largely aligned with Afriforum, over language policy and larger issues over how the University of Pretoria should be run (e.g. renaming it to the University of Tshwane). Both groups fought and threw stones at each other, with at least two students injured. Police attempted to separate them, and at least 29 students werwe arrested.
Tags: Sowetan (South Africa); CAJ News Agency (Johannesburg) Riots/Protests

NOTES: Disgruntled residents of Shaka's Head village torched their ward councillor's home and car and barricaded the N2 highway near Ballito over the ANC's nomination of a candidate they disagreed with.

SOURCE: AOL; Cape Times (South Africa); Cape Argus (South Africa)
NOTES: Classes at UWC have been disrupted and university property damaged in three days of protests against outsourcing between Feb.22-24. #FeesMustFall protesters and outsourced workers clashed with police and university security during the protests.
Tags: AOL; Cape Times (South Africa); Cape Argus (South Africa) Riots/Protests

NOTES: After an anti-land invasion unit began demolishing structures in an open field in Parkwood Estate, residents retaliated by throwing stones at police and burning tires. 4 people were later arrested.

A group of concerned parents picketed the Sosebenza Primary School in Khayelitsha following allegations that the principal and staff are corrupt. Some arguments broke out when the principal came outside, but no violence was reported.

Students at Jan Masibi Middle School in Disaneng village near Mafikeng, rioted in their school, breaking windows and damaging ceilings until police were called to get them under control. They say they were angry about assaults carried out by the school's teachers.

Residents of Siqalo, a poor informal settlement near Mitchell's Plain, who worked for Silver Solutions blocked Vanguard Drive with portable toilets and burning tires, as well as damaged traffic lights, during a 48 hour protest over working conditions

Residents of Phagameng township near Modimolle engaged in violent protests over service delivery and demands that their mayor and councillors step down. Some youths burned tires while police used rubber bullets and stun grenades to disperse the protesters.
A group of about 50 social work graduates marched in their graduation gowns from Nangoza Jebe Hall in New Brighton to the Social Development offices in Struandale for employment.

Inmates of the Baviaansport Correctional Centre in Pretoria started a hunger strike after not receiving dinner with no explanation. At least 16, allegedly the leaders of the strike, were transferred to Zonderwater Correctional Centre.
4 people were arrested after two Metrorail trains were torched and two others pelted with stones in Pretoria. 5 busses were also burned. It is not clear what motivated the vandalism.
A group of protesters blocked a road in Zwide with burning tires to demand the resignation of the Ward 25 councillor.

SOURCE: AOL; Cape Times (South Africa); Cape Argus (South Africa)
NOTES: Classes at UWC have been disrupted and university property damaged in three days of protests against outsourcing between Feb.22-24. #FeesMustFall protesters and outsourced workers clashed with police and university security during the protests.

NOTES: "1 woman was shot dead and another wounded in Dunoon when police allegedly opened fire on a taxi" which was carrying the two women employed at a Nando's franchise. It is not clear why the police opened fire on the taxi.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SAMWU: South African Municipal Workers' Union
NOTES: Thousands of Buffalo City Metropolitan Municipality workers organized by SAMWU marched to East London city hall demanding a salary increase and back pay.

Several students at the Mafikeng campus of the NWU were injured when they clashed with campus security. The students were allegedly attempting to disrupt an event to inaugurate a new SRC. A car belonging to a security company and two buildings, including an administrative one, were torched by students during the incident, who also threw rocks.

Residents of Siqalo, a poor informal settlement near Mitchell's Plain, blocked Vanguard Drive with portable toilets and burning tires, as well as damaged traffic lights, during a 48 hour protest over service delivery.

More than 400 residents from various Mhlontlo municipalities took to the streets to demand the removal of the political leadership of their wards and for the municipality to be placed undr administration. Police later arrived and threw stune grenades, causing some protesters to flee.
"Scores of people living in an informal settlement destroyed government houses that were under construction in Sir Lowry's Pass" which were meant for residents of the area waiting for housing.
Taxi drivers blockaded entrances to Tongaat after a man was arrested for intimidating an alleged "lift club operator".

Violent protests occurred on the University of Free State's campus after the institution did not force the vice chancellor to resign. Police used stun grenades and rubber bullets to disperse the protester, and arrested several of them.
A group of at least 3,000 protesters engaged in violent service delivery protests in Folweni, attacking municipal offices with petrol-bombs and damaging at least one municipal vehicle.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SAMWU: South African Municipal Workers' Union
NOTES: Hundreds of municipal workers, organized by SAMWU, marched through the streets of Johannesburg to demand an end to corruption within municipal structures and call attention to salary and tax concerns.
Violent protests over service delivery continued in Phagameng in the Modimolle area.

Hundreds of University of Pretoria students walked silently on the university's campus, which had been closed due to recent protests, in a #PrayerWalk to "seek divine intervention to resolve racial tensions" at the institution.
Between Feb.25-26, 16 houses were petrol-bombed and at least 100 others damaged by community members who were prevented from illegally moving into the structures in the Sir Lowry's Pass area.

Striking workers demanding full-time employment engaged in violent protests on the Westville campus of the University of KwaZulu-Natal. The protesters threw rocks at vehicles and flipped at least one campus security vehicle.
Between Feb.25-26, 16 houses were petrol-bombed and at least 100 others damaged by community members who were prevented from illegally moving into the structures in the Sir Lowry's Pass area.
Residents and police of Boksburg engaged in a motorcycle procession to protest against police killings in the area.
In response to Cape Town's annual gay pride march, a few hundred supporters of Alternative Inclusive Pride protested against the main event, accusing it of excluding lesbians and black people.
A group of residents of Endlovini informal settlement in Khayelitsha closed down a Somali shop after a protest on the 27th February 2016.

At a community meetingin Austerville, a group of unhappy residents disrupted a Q&A session. The dispute culminated clashes and fist-fights occuring between residents, government officials and local security.
A small group of Campaign Against Canned Hunting, and Beauty Without Cruelty supporters picketed outside the Rhebokskloof Wine Farm in Paarl.
A 23-year-old man accused of killing a woman was attacked and set alight by an angry mob in Tibanefontein, Limpopo

NOTES: Workers demanding an end to outsourcing clashed with officers of a private security company which had been hired by the University of the Western Cape.

NOTES: About 100 Bhisho Legislature employees downed tools and protested outside ANC caucus offices against its next planned MPL.

About 500 students marched at TUT's Soshanguve campus. Forming a human chain on the streets of the township north of Pretoria, the students sang songs as they protested. Although security was present, there was no violence reported.
About 100 nursing students from Cape Peninsula University of Technology's Athlone campus marched to the Provincial Legislature to protest a cut in the number of their bursaries.
A group of outsourced workers at Unisa in Pretoria downed tools and protested over a wage dispute.

Violence broke out at the Tshwane University of Technology (TUT) when striking outsourced workers clashed with their working colleagues. Four workers were attacked by the striking guards. The guards retaliated, but sustained injuries and were taken to hospital.
Fourteen Nigerians fled Wolseley after crowd marches against them, loots their shops, and accuses them of murder and drug-dealing.
Hundreds of College of Cape Town (Crawford) students protested at the Athlone Campus because they had not received their full bursaries.
About 200 Rastafarians protested outside the Parliament buildings in Cape Town.
A protest over electricity in Delft, turned violent after protesters blocked the N2 and Symphony Way setting vehicles alight. Three protesters were arrested. No injuries have been reported.
More than 200 disgruntled members of the taxi industry rode in a cavalcade through the streets of George in protest.
Grahamstown residents, marched to the town's police station, following the alleged harassment on 19 February of vocal student activist Lihle Ngcobozi.

Joburg motorists were confronted by an angry mob from the Jeppe Hostel who surrounded their vehicles and demanded that they turn around. A truck and a bakkie were torched, with police who tried to intervene pelted with stones and debris by a group from the George Goch Hostel who had congregated in Ruven Road near the M2 highway.
protests in Folweni resulted in the destruction of a newly built fire station.
Protests continued at the Crawford campus in Athlone by students unhappy with the transport allowances.
Protests took place in the the Cape Town CBD by residents of Gugulethu.
Violence erupted when a group of residents torched five RDP homes in New Horizons, claiming the community's concerns over housing issues had fallen on deaf ears.
Residents went on the rampage and blockaded sreets in Gerena rental village in Polokwane.
Reclaim the City campaigners marched through Sea Point in protest against the province's sale of a R135 million property to the Phyllis Jowell School.
EFF and Afriforum members gathered in Stellenbosch in a tense stand-off. No violence or clashes were reported in the peaceful displays.
A group of about 300 students are protesting for an increase in bursary payouts at the Boland College in Strand

Protest action has taken place. Eight students are arrested after one lecturer is allegedly held hostage and property is damaged in protest action at the Northlink college in Bellville. No direct interactions between demonstrators and police mentioned during the actual protests.
Protests started at the King Sabata Dalindyebo college in Elliotdale when 60 students did not receive some of their final year results.
A school and shop were set alight at Masakona village in Limpopo, allegedly by a group opposing government's plan to include them under a new municipality.
In Plettenberg Bay, protesters continued to take action burning tyres on the streets.

Supporters, angry about the death of a murdered teen, gathered and held placards outside the Wynberg Magistrate's court.
Desperate parents locked teachers out of Funiwe Primary School near King William's Town and protested in the pouring rain.

Over the weekend, a mob went on the rampage attacking foreign-owned shops. Four people were injured and one man was killed.
A group of mothers gathered for a mass breast-feeding protest at Edgars in Cavendish Square, Claremont.

About 1,000 people, aligned to the ANC, protested in Durban’s Folweni area, blocking traffic and torching a lorry. Later, a fire station ans school office were burnt and police cars damaged. In response, police arrested 10 people.

Taxi Drivers have been protesting and destroying property since the 14th March in Joe Slovo informal settlement in Cape Town. Cars were stoned, a delivery truck set alight, the MyCiTi Phoenix station damaged and Democracy Road barricaded with burning tyres.
ANC and SACP members protested outside the Constitutional Court, in Johannesburg, over the release of Chirs Hani's murder.
Students have been protesting in King William's Town since Monday 14th March.

Protests continued in Mookgophong as streets were barricaded and four houses were set alight. Police also came under attack with petrol bombs thrown at a Nyala vehicle. In the ensuing chaos, one man was killed and 22 people were arrested.
Angry parents, who attended a meeting in Port Elizabeth, became rowdy and started singing in protest. Some even blocked the exit through which the media were attempting to leave.
Community members, lead by the MCPA, marched to the Mpukunyoni Traditional Council offices in protest against what they deem corrupt leadership.
A MyCiTi bus operating along Route 251 in Century City was stoned as Taxi drivers continued to strike.
The SJC (Social Justice Coalition) held a march from Town Two Clinic to Harare in Khayelitsha.
Students have been protesting in King William's Town since Monday 14th March.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: NEHAWU: National Education, Health and Allied Workers' Union
NOTES: Police threw stun grenades at protesters wearing NEHAWU t-shirts in Port Elizabeth.
Protesting Zandspruit residents destroyed a petrol station shop near their informal settlement in northern Johannesburg.
A man was shot and killed at the Glebelands hostel, Umlazi in another killing in the troubled area.
On the 15th March, the leader of the previous day's protest was attacked at his home resulting in his trucking being destroyed.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: PASMA: Pan Africanist Student Movement of Azania
NOTES: About 500 people, lead by PASMA and SASCO, chanted outside the administration office at the Cape Peninsula University of Technology (CPUT) Cape Town campus earlier today demanding the removal of the vice-chancellor.
A large group of bus operators, supported by the Ses’khona People’s Rights Movement, marched to the Cape Town Civic Centre.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: DENOSA: Democratic Nursing Organisation of South Africa
NOTES: A small group of nurses, under the banner of the Democratic Nurses Organisation ofSouth Africa (Denosa), MARHED  to the provincial legislature in Cape Town.
A mob attempting to torch a police station in ongoing protests in Folweni, KZN.  A Municipal vehicle was also torched as police fired stun grenades to disperse the crowd.
Taxi Drivers staged a march in the Johannesburg CBD against Uber, which they claim is operating illegally.
Students have been protesting in King William's Town since Monday 14th March.
Port Elizabeth College DA Students Organisation members protested outside the institution's main entrance saying they had been cheated out of two seats on the Students' Representative Council.
Two houses were vandalised after a scuffle broke out between two rival groups (ANC and the UDM) in Veeplaas, Port Elizabeth
A police armoured vehicle was set alight, at least two police officers were wounded and businesses were looted when irate residents of Zandspruit informal settlement against electricity cuts.
A man was murdered by a group of community members because he was accused of carjacking on the 16 March 2016 in Zimbane Valley, Mthatha
Tags: South African Police Service Violence against civilians

ALLY_ACTOR_1: PASMA: Pan Africanist Student Movement of Azania
NOTES: More than 500 student protesters disrupted lectures at the Cape Peninsula University of Technology (CPUT) again to demand the removal of the university's vice-chancellor, Prince Nevhutalu
Teachers, students, parents and community members came out in their numbers to march against vandalism and crime in Lwazi Primary School in Gugulethu.
Hundreds of residents protested in Mookgophong over lack of services and the removal of a municipal leader.
Numerous Shoprite workers protested against poor pay and their employment through labour brokers in Pretoria.

A liquor store and other shops were damaged in the riots and several cars were burnt out in ongoing protests in Zandspruit. Although there was a large police presence no reports of violence or arrests have been made.
About 100 protesters held a picket outside the Wynberg Magistrate’s Court.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SAMWU: South African Municipal Workers' Union
NOTES: A DA Mayor was beaten with a knobkierie when workers, aligned to SAMWU, forced their way into his office and damaged property in Willowmore during a strike.
Hundreds of women in Alberton, Gauteng donned their sneakers to take part in the Global Million Women health March for Endometriosis.
Residents and gangsters in Elsies River turned on firefighters who were trying to extinguish two cars set alight by gang members. They threw stones at the firefighters, forcing them to leave the area
A group of young people spent the day protesting outside the St George Hotel in Pretoria where the African National Congress national executive committee (NEC) members were meeting.
KwaZulu-Natal police have arrested 16 people after they allegedly stoned a murder suspect to death at Candover near Mkhuze.

The MyCiTi Dunoon station in Dunoon was attacked and vandalised by protesters. Protesters threw rocks and objects at the station building, causing damage to the glass panels and exterior of the building.
A Reverand and a group of children from Biko Village near Reeston marched for 1.5km in support of people struggling to get jobs and coping with falling out of the economy.
Police fired shotgun rubber rounds and stun grenades to prevent protesters from further damaging a MyCiTi bus station and attacking officers. A petrol bomb was also thrown at a MyCiTi bus station
Riot police dispersed a mob of angry protesters who stoned cars and barricaded the R104 near Lethabong in Tshwane.
A man who allegedly stabbed his girlfriend to death has died in police cells, after he too was knifed in an ensuing mob justice attack in Mbekweni.
Two men were attacked by a group in Table View in an alleged vigilante attack. Reports said one of the victims was killed.

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SATAWU: South African Transport and Allied Workers' Union
NOTES: About 200 South African Transport and Allied Workers Union (SATAWU) members from Prasa marched to the offices in Cape Town station.
Metro Police said the area was relatively quiet after tyres were set alight by protesters in ongoing violence in Dunoon.
Pikitup workers continued their strike as they emptyed rubbish bins on the streets of the Johannesburg CBD in front of metro police.
About 200 municipal rubbish removal workers disrupted morning rush-hour traffic in Umlazi in protest. There were no immediate reports of damages or injuries.
An anti-mining activist and the chairman of the Amadiba Crisis Committee was assassinated in his house in Mbizana.
Nearly 400 protesters assembled on the sports field in Dunoon.
About 100 eThekwini municipality security guards stormed a meeting in Durban and inserted their pay grievances on the agenda.
100 angry Port Alfred residents gathered outside court in Port Alfred to protest violence against women and children.
An attack took place at a mine near Ulundi, resulting in an employee sustaining serious burn wounds to his left hand and an office block being burnt.
Tags: The Mercury (South Africa) Violence against civilians

NOTES: In the latest vigilante attack, a man was killed in Khayelitsha, after he and an accomplice tried to rob a shop.
Protests outside the houses of drug dealers started in Ennerdale (1st day).
Tyres were burnt and rubble strewn on the road during protest action in Glendale on the KZN's north coast.
Residents marched for the second day (2nd of 3 days) to the homes of suspected drug-dealers in Ennerdale, South of Johannesburg.
Municipal ANC officials stormed the house of an elderly women and damaged her property in Malende in Kwa-Zulu Natal.
In Siyabuswa, a government official was killed in what is thought to be an assassination-styled killing.
Tags: The Sowetan (South Africa) Violence against civilians

NOTES: In ongoing strikes, Pikitiup workers threw rocks at temporary workers. One man was stabbed in the violence several vehicles were damaged.
Protests outside the houses of drug dealers continued into thier 3rd day in Ennerdale (3rd day).

SOURCE: The Star (South Africa); The Sowetan (South Africa)
NOTES: A municipal worker, attending to a complaint, was killed and another injured while on a job at the weekend in Palm Ridge, Ekurhuleni.
Tags: The Star (South Africa); The Sowetan (South Africa) Violence against civilians

ALLY_ACTOR_1: SAMWU: South African Municipal Workers' Union
NOTES: SAMWU union leaders led hundreds of striking employees in a protest march in the Joburg CBD ahead of the start of their disciplinary hearings.
About 80 protesting taxi drivers and conductors blockaded the N2 and R102, at the Tugela Bridge on the KwaZulu-Natal North Coast.
A small group of people, lead by a PAC activist, marched to to the Grand Parade to commemorate the 1960 protest against the pass laws when 30,000 people marched to the city centre from Langa.

SOURCE: Daily Dispatch (South Africa); The Herald (South Africa)
NOTES: In violent protest action, a Daily Dispatch truck was attacked and damaged in the evening by unhappy rioters in Colchester. Police had to use stun grenades and fire rubber bullets to disperse angry protesters.
Tags: Daily Dispatch (South Africa); The Herald (South Africa) Riots/Protests

NOTES: A strike by taxi drivers has turned violent in the Durban city centre, with police firing teargas, shops closing and reports of looting.
Protests began in Kliptown, Soweto on Wednesday night over electricity supply.
Tyres and tarred poles were set alight last night as violent protests erupted in Mfuleni in Cape Town.
In protest action, a clash between private and protesting campus security guards broke out at the Walter Sisulu University in Mthatha. A stray bullet hit a student on the hand during the clash.
Equal Education members marched 38km from New Hanover to Pitermaritzburg over two days.
About 200 Port Elizabeth residents blocked roads in protest at delays in housing on the R334 and R335 roads in Port Elizabeth.

The Soweto house of the Joburg member of the mayoral committee (MMC) for environment and infrastructure services Matshidiso Mfikoe has been petrol-bombed. This is in the wake of soured relations between the SA Municipal Workers Union (Samwu) and Pikitup, which falls under Mfikoe’s portfolio.

In protest action over electricity, residents protested on the streets during the night.  Reports claim that police had fired rubber bullets at the protesters after they had blocked roads with burning tyres and thrown stones at them.
About 500 protesters demanding employment from local mines have barricaded the R31 road between Kuruman and Hotazel with burning objects and rocks

Members of the Mfuleni community just outside of Cape Town attacked a Councillor's home and set fire to the community hall. Almost 1 000 people blocked roads during the day by burning rubbish. They also threw rocks at vehicles passing by and assaulted some people.
Equal Education members marched 38km from New Hanover to Pitermaritzburg over two days.
33 people were arrested during violent protest action in Port Shepstone. Police were forced to fire rubber bullets at disruptive taxi drivers in which property was allegedly damaged.
The Gauteng SACP, ANC, COSATU, SANCO supported by several organisations held a successful protest march to the Kgosi Mampuru Correctional Service Centre in Pretoria.
Soldiers opened fire on Mundri prison, killing one police officer and injuring another in May 2015.
Shilluk women raped at military base in Ayat, Malakal.

NOTES: SPLA/M-IO forces composed of Shilluk tribesmen attacked Dinka community in Atar, accusing them of hiding fighters and munitions. 6 civilians killed, either shot or cut with pangas.
Military attack villages in Upper Nile on Sept 2, 2015. Bodies of 6 women and 2 boys found hanging from a tree.
Soldier kill 1 and rape 1 girl in Koch in Oct 2015.
Military attack Pilling in Oct 2015, at least 2 civilians killed.
Military kill 50 people from Adok. Reports differ as to wheter they were locked in a container and suffocated or were beaten to death.

NOTES: At least 25 killed over two days inside UN protection site in Malakal after fighting between Dinka and Shilluk displaced communities. UNMISS police used tear gas. Fatalitiies included 3 MSF staff. During fighting between Dinka and Shilluk militia, SPLA soldiers entered camp on night of Feb 18 and attacked Shilluk and Nuer IDPs, burning tents and killing civilians. Fatalities reported are result of both Dinka-Shilluk fighting and by military violence against civilians. Therefore, 9 fatalities coded for Feb 17 battle, 8 coded for Feb 18 battle, and 8 coded for Feb 18 violence against civilians.

NOTES: Clashes between Tunisian forces and suspected IS militants left 55 people dead Monday in Ben Gardane. At dawn, gunmen targeted a police station and military facilities in the southern town, in an attempt to establish a "Daesh emirate" in Ben Guerdane. Residents told AFP the assailants appeared to be natives of the region. Government said that 36 militants were killed and seven arrested and that 12 security officers and 7 civilians were also killed. The twelve security forces officers killed include a soldier, 10 domestic security officers, one of whom was killed at home. 14 other security officers and three civilians have been injured.
